reviews.review: A pleasant trip down Dubai Creek. We took a sunset cruise down Dubai Creek on an Abra. Given the weather it was cooler to do it in the evening but in addition taking in the sunset while taking a slow cruise down the creek is lovely.We had young children with us and were concerned with safety and life jackets. They do not have kid-size jackets on board. We were worried about the many boats on the Creek and possible accidents. But the rise was slow and safe.As it is engine-powered, it is quite noisy and the seats in front of the driver are particularly hot.
Taxi Boat Ride. When leaving the spice souk head to Abra Dock, take the short taxi boat ride to cross the creek for 1AED(£0.20) and visit the old Souk as well as the Iranian Mosque.

A way to experience the old Dubai. A must to do...have a great ride and experience the old Dubai's means of transportation. Dubai Water Taxi is an excellent experience too...it's the modern means of water transportation. Dubai have a great means of transportation - water, land and air.
A must do in Dubai. We found the dock adjacent to the textile souk and took the boat ride across to the gold souk. A great activity and highly recommended.
Cheapest wather Taxi and Amazing Boat!. Best trick for going to see old dubai is taking abra (boats) from special stations in creek...Try this Amazing 1AED boats called: AbraBest wishes...

Gotta take an Abra across the creek!. This is an easy way to get to the other side of the creek. $1.00 gets you a one way ride across. Right at the dock there are shops and a suk to shop at. NIce gathering area to just find a shady spot and sit for awhile.
happy go place. one must visit the place, its an enjoyable place, chill, use the abra boats, it cost very little, for a 5 minutes ride, i myself have gone a number of times...
Its nice only 1 aed. You can use boat from nasirsquar to bur dubai only for 1aed. You can enjoy view while going on boat i
Fantastic. Our trip to Meydan was made all the better by Mark who showed us how the stables work on an everyday basis.He shared his love&vast knowledge of Meydan,a trip not to be missed.

Really fun!. Really fun to see the city from the creek perspective. After a long day on the city tour bus it was nice and relaxing to sit on the boat in the afternoon. But don't buy any drinks, way to overpriced!

Traditional old harbour . I personally love this place. In 90s I use to walk here at night and this place use to be very calm and quite. Now it's over crowded it's heaven for ladies Gold Jewellery shops just across the Road and cheap shopping stuff available in old style shops.

Best way to travel from Meena Bazaar to Gold/Spice Souk. The Abra's are small motor boats that charge only 1 Dirham to take you across the creek. Very useful for travelling from the Gold/Spice souk to Meena Bazaar.
Great fun, nice way to see the Creek. Fast and efficient staff, great value experience, a fun way to see the creek area and experience a little bit of the old Dubai.

Water taxi ride across to the old souk. Great idea to soak in the atmosphere with a boat taxi ride across the creek to the old souk area. Taxi is very cheap, the heritage area and old souk is a pleasant area to walk around .
Crowded. Reservation highly recommended. Food nice; environment a little loud in some of the boats due to music and noisy tourists

A must do. How better to experience the real Dubai with a water taxi ride Cross the creek to visit the souks . The taxis go up the creek and you see all the fishing boats and another view on the city.
Right place to visit during winter time.. Feel old dubai at very cheap price, go around various markets in Burduabi in Abra or choose to rent out your small boat to enjoy ride. Must visit place.
Nice Experience. They explained to us that these boats were used as taxis to transport people from one end to the other. We tried it a few times

Take an abra ride and see the local atmosphere for just 1 dirham (20P/25c). very accessible, takes you across the Dubai creek in a jiffy and cheap but fun entertainment, Lovely views. Choose a not-so-very-hot day.
Boat ride across the creek. This is a great opportunity to cross the creek with an abra boat. Also an ideal way to get to the gold and spice souks.
Great way to see theriver. We caught the ferry to and from the Deria Souk. It was a quick and efficient way to cross the creek. If you have the time, take the round trip tour. Great value at 1 drn.

Taxi boat short adventure.. Get on the lovely small taxi boats; they will give you a ride across the creek for a very budget price. I never get tire of riding on these small water taxis. It is fun and it takes you to the souks on both sides. Also one of the few budget things to do in Dubai.

Pleasant boat trip to the spice market. A short trip on "Abra" boat that took us to the other side of the creek. Very affordable , pleasant and interesting as we passed the old boats moored on the the other side. We took a walk through the spice market and ended up taking the metro instead of crossing back. It is one of the things one must do when in Dubai !

Must see on trip to Dubai!. This was the cheapest and one of the most enjoyable aspects of our trip. Pay one dhs per person (we didn't pay for our 1 year old son), and have a nice 5 min ride across the river to the old souk. Lots of locals on the boat as well, and you don't need to make a reservation. Just show up! Good stuff to see in Bur Dubai, close to the Dubai museum as well. As you are riding on the boat, you can feel and see what Dubai used to be like before all the high rise buildings. Really a gem!
Cross the creek. Dont miss the opportunity to cross the creek with " Abra " boats. Exciting experience to go to old town and visit the gold,textiles,spices markets
Take back to old. Takes us back to old days when Abra was doing critical service in this nations history !!!Nice to have a trip and to enjoy !!!
Best Value in Dubai. This is a great way to truly experience Dubai. The journey across the creek was very cheap and very well organised. Definitely recommended
Not a lot. Not much to say about the place, its a dock. Abra's pull in to collect people and pull out to take them to the other side....
Cheapest attraction in Dubai . This is a very cool boat ride and for only 1 aed it's a bargain in Dubai that can't be beat. Great views of Dubai as you cross the creek.

A must visit - the old picturesque Dubai........... Down to the old suq full of colourful stalls, people, spices,........the best part of old Dubai away from the moder city...a nice place to visit & take the boat crossing for 1 dirham......

Down the history lane. This is one of the trips that you should take as a tourist. the abras are almost as old as the city itself. Even in today's day and age it takes only AED 1 to travel from Bur Dubai side to Gold Souq side. The traditional abras are not AC and quite rustic but an experience

Cheap and wonderful traditional experience. This ride is worth checking out.
It is open through the day. You may need to pay for the entire boat if there is no one else who wants to cross over to the other side.
It is cheap mode of communication and worth a one try.

Boat ride with touch of tradition. Its a boat ride as cheap as AED1 and if you want it for your self completely AED 120 ......its a unique ride if you want to experience old style ....worth a ride ...
tradition boat ride. its is a unique traditional way to travel in Dubai, the boat ride is cheap just 1 AED to cross to the part of the city
Must visit. ABRA is the lifeline of creek and adjoining areas. A ride in the ABRA is a must for the visitors here.

1 AED crossing - well worth the price!!!. This is a very cheap and exciting way of crossing the Creek and get to see the spice & gold souks. In the area this is by far yhe best tjing to see. Make sure you have coins to give to the Abra Captains.

Traditional Abra boat ride.. We were part of a day tour which included the cruising in the Abra across the creek. We waited at the dock for around 5 minutes for our Abra boat to arrive drop some people off and then our tour group got on and off we went across the creek. It is always great to go on traditional transport. We used the Abra to get across the creek to visit the spice and gold souks which was good to go to as well. There are some great views across the creek and beyond Whilst your are in the Abra and you feel part of everyday life across the creek watching people go about they're everyday life and work on the boats and creek area. All in all great traditional Abra boat trip and cheap too.

Dubai Traditional Boat. In a modern city like Dubai, it is good to see traditional boat for crossing the Dubai Creek. The easiest way to cross Dubai Creek from Dubai Museum to the Spice Souk and Gold Souk.It cost just 1 AED to ride the boat. It is worth the try.

water taxi abra dubai. traditional way of traveling from bur dubai to deira or deira to bur dubai for just i aedvery cheap and every body can afford it from both side if you uses taxi it will coast you almost 15 to 20 aed
Pretty view. The view is pretty, going on the abra makes you feel like you are going back in time. It is a good idea to go on it in order to cross the creek and it is only 1 dirham!

Very beautiful Transport option. The Abra in Bur Dubai (Dubai Creek) is the most beautiful option to commute. For just 1 AED we can enjoy the nature's beauty with sea waves hitting the boat and sun shining !

Cheapest ride in Dubai. For 1 Dirham you can get scenic views of Bur Dubai and other areas riding down Dubai Creek. This is a traditional water taxi is still actively used by people during the day. You can board at Bur Dubai but you are able to travel all the way down the Creek and out onto the Gulf. There is a route map (like a bus route map) which tells you the stops.I recommend coming at night so you can see the area lit up and the Dhows with dinner cruises going by look impressive as they cruise passed you.It is the cheapest way to get around.Alternatively, there are taxis which are about 20D that will take you to the stop that you want.

Abra experience. the typical boat Abra is the best way to get to the souks, the price is just 1 AED for each ride. It´s not confortable, always crowded, but it´s an experience you need to try and also the best way to cross to the souks ( spice, gold and textile ).
Great views and Local Feel. Great way to see the canal, Bur Dubai and travel to the various souks. Very cheap to get across and you normally don't have to wait very long to get on one of the boats.

A must. So cheap and so convenient. Travel with the locals to cross the creek. Open air, fast access to a regular service. You are ushered into the next abra and no sooner find a seat on the bench that you're away.this is a must to do experience when visiting Dubai.

If you have visitors its a must try.... I've taken guests here numerous times, travel across the creek on an old Arabic Abra, enjoy Dubai from the creek, explore the old souks and take in the hustle and bustle, but don't take it serious! enjoy it....

$1 AED for a short Boat Ride. I think all travelers to Dubai should give this a try. It's cheap and a great way to experience something different. It's nice to see the old Dubai compared to the hustle bustle of the metropolis. The boat ride is very close to the Gold Souk and Metro.

Old is Gold My Abra. This place reminds my childhood days. Abra dock and the Meena Bazzar. Very old traditional spot but its a great thing to experience the boat ride.Very cheap, fun and relaxing especially during the evenings (4oclock). Parking is a small problem around this area.
Old dubai. Old school type of transportation in dubai. Cheap, fast, really interesting and great experience which i really enjoyed.

Favorite place in Dubai. This is the real Dubai. No luxury, no showing off, just purely the best the city has to offer. Such an amazing area, cruise the creek with one of this amazing abra boats and feel the breeze of the creek. The view during sunset is breathtaking visit the hindu temple hidden in between the small streets.

Traditional wag to have a tour in canal. It is old station and old boats.Tney transfer people from but Dubai to Daireh and it is fun and cheap way to experience .Both sides you can see some attraction .Old garment Bazar and Muesum of sushi and Jamal Abdol Alnaser square where is old businesses are there where still is a popular place to find cheap cell phone etc.
Cross the creek. While walking in meena bazaar, i go straight to abra and ride a traditional ride crossing the creek to see spice and gold souk, well good experience...

Once Upon Time. Abra Means Boat Service. from Bur Dubai to Deira Dubai and Deira Dubai to Bur Dubai. just for 1 Dirham. they keep the Abra the way as it was old dubai . easy way to travel both places and saving money from Taxi
A great way to see Dubai. Great value at 1 Dirham a trip crossing the creek from Bur Dubai to Deira, and a wonderful vista early evening as the sun sets with the backdrop of the mosques.

Traditional Boat. On tour to the old gold & spice souk we cross the Dubai creek on a Abra a traditional boat cost 1 Dirham p/p only a short crossing. An authentic & unique experience the driver drove the boat with his feet, lovely views on both sides of creek small wooden hull boat worth doing.

Classic times still continues. One of the oldest mode of transportation is Abra located at 2 locations which goes to opposite side at Dera. One goes to spice market while other goes to Camel Pak Rolex Towers. The rates are quite cheap to travel in between and it's a fun ride if kids are with you. Must to do by tourist.

River Taxi tour. If you are going to visit the Gold,Spice Souks this a must do, you can either jump on a river taxi for 1 Dhiram and go across from one side to the other, or you grab a river tour on the Abra its a brilliant experience catch the sights of Dubai Creek, the Palace and loads more well worth the price. all the Abra are licences-ed by the RTA there's not of this stupid Health and Safety crap on the Abra the Driver tells you to sit you sit.

Experience. Took a couple of friends from Korea here , it was a spur of moment decision yet we were not disappointed, the place is neat and clean and we were able to rent a boat and took a round, clicked quite a few selfies and had a wonderful time. Highly recommended

Sweet Boat Ride. Dubai creek was a refreshing change amidst our sky-scrapper filled tour of Dubai. After the Deserts and the amazing buildings we went over to Dubai Creek for authentic old Dubai experience.The Creek has a boat service which gets you for a low cost from one end of the creek to another. The calmness of the place was awesome. The Bur Dubai Abra dock is one of the docks in the creek. Nice place and friendly people. Do checkout the shops nearby selling authentic Dubai merchandise, also don't miss out on a chance for some nice Hookah and Tea (chai).
Abra!! A wonderful experience. As we sat in Abra, first I was little scared as I have water phobia, but later I enjoyed it a lot and wanted to get more ride on it. Its quite economic.

Great fun. I've been to Dubai for work so many times, but it took a trip with my family to finally get round to an abra trip.It's an easy walk from the metro to the dock, and the trip is very well worth the VERY small amount of money that it costs! It's only a few minutes across the river to the souk, but it's a lovely way to see a little bit more of the old Dubai that so often gets swallowed up in the modern glitz and glamour.I'd definitely recommend,
Very nice. This was a very short trip, but was a very good experience. No saftty garments as such, it's an experience to see this form of transport.
Water Taxi. We enjoyed a trip down the river on an abra - steered by the driver's feet, and with some near misses into other vehicles but it just added to the experience!

Abra -an eye to old dubai. Its an old place. Used by Dubai residents in those olden days when there was no train and public transport. This really served many people who went to earn their daily bread. Now its a tourist attraction area for many to view the scenic areas in Dubai.
evening boat ride. wonder way to tour the city... just a great experience that allows you to see into Dubai's water fare heritage.
An absolute must. Just hop on, pay the ferryman and enjoy the (short) ride. Very good way to cool down on those hot days. Lovely view of both sides of the water.
Old part of town.. A must to get the flavour of the old Dubai. Get the boat across to the gold souk and be transported back in time.

traditional life of Dubai. just for a few dirhams, hop on an abra and ride the creek to the other side. there do some shopping and come back by abra. it is very cheap and it is like a small cruise in Dubai creek. i could do this many times.
lovely. A lovely ride across the creek on an abra costing pennies was a highlight of the trip for me, could have happily gone back and forth all day.Some great views.

Authentic ride experience. Duabi Abra boat ride is authentic and unique experience, I would suggest to ride in the evening so that you feel and see the real Arabian Dubai night views. Different colors and views like unique building designs, parks in very colourful lights and mostly you will see the big Dhow boats that accommodating different tourist having dinner on sailing while viewing different live shows. The most important is you will just pay 1 Dirham per person per way, very affordable to any level of tourist.

nice experience BUT not must do. If you are going to Bur Dubai or Meena Bazzar , you can try this short activity. Its a nice water taxi crossing the creek . It is also the cheapest was to cross the creek ( Just 1 AED ). However I cannot mark it as "must do".

Watch Your Step. The abra's that cross the creek are a MUST DO tourist attraction however for those who may be getting a little rickety in their step/balance I would suggest perhaps giving this a miss as the abra can be difficult to board. The trip is short but a great deal of fun. You can hire a private abra ride up the creek for a short journey but make sure you barter for the best price.
Water Taxi. If you are the type of person with the philosophy of trying everything once you should do this. Check the skipper though as some ties the rudder to his foot whilst having lunch

Sunset ride. To ride the Abra boats it costs a mere 1 dirhams - really worth doing. We rode it as the sun was setting - absolutely beautiful. We also rode it night, Dubai being a city that likes lights, it was a lovely ride. Also, Bur Duabi is the beautiful old Dubai - it's original and worth seeing. On the ride you get to see some of the old buildings, then on the other side you get off near a local market of goods, materials, toys and gold. Worth a walk round.
Nice and sample transportation. Sample transportation tool to cross the creek from Dira Dubai to bar Dubai, with one Dyrham only, nice experience in the good waiter

Quite. It's nice place and a good way to transport. If you wanna go from bur dubai side to deira or gold souq or spice souq, then here you get the 1 Dhiram abras or boats. Its quite cheap, but the views are magnificent. Its a must travel for everyone coming to Dubai.
Great way to see the Creek and another side of Dubai.. Great way to see the Creek and another side of Dubai. Use it to get from Bur Dubai to Deira for AED1. Very efficient and no waiting.
VERY JOYOUS. We took the abra ride in the late evening. A different experience with gentle breeze touching.Not a must visit

Nice Way to see Old Dubai. this is a nice way to see old dubai. it cost only 1 AED to cross the river. there are very few tourists who comes here because they like the New Dubai better. It has its charm.

Traditional ride. A wonderful experience, beautiful scenic route and the best thing about it the price it's really cheap.Wouldn't recommend this type of boat for people with young kids it's not suitable or safe.
Great cheap boat tour!. Great cheap boat tour! costs only 1 AED for a crossing, great way to get from Gold/Spice Souk to the Textile souk and dubai fort/museum.

Traditional arabian ships. Perfect idea for your trip around Bur Dubai and Dubai Deira. You can visit this place and you can go to the many souks or museums. I recommend you: Old Souk in Deira!Fun experience and crazy shopping!

A very hot trip. Abra is a cheap way to get across to the gold souks. They charge 1 dirham per person. The boatman is very rude and cross but don't blame him as its very hot.
It smells too and other people especially men keep staring which makes western women uncomfortable.

A quick and cheap way across the creek. This is the way to get across the other side of the creek and get the feel of the old style Dubai. It give's you a whole new experience as you take in the atmosphere and organised chaos.

A unique way to travel from A-B!!. Never been of anything quite like this, but the views and travel was awesome. Really comfortable river crossing that took a matter of minutes and really really cheap!

Cheap and best sightseeing...kids will love it. My cousin lives in Dubai and she took us here. We parked near the Sabkha ferry terminal on Baniyas Rd - the lot was full but we circled a couple of times and got lucky. You will walk by several of the local cruise boats (good place for pics) before you get to the ferry station. The ferry runs periodically almost every 10-15min depending on the no of people. The wooden ferry has no railings so be aware when going with kids - I had a 1.5yr old kid and while it was scary she had a great time. The price for the 10min ferry rid is just 1dhm! Plan to visit during the evening time - one way you can see the buildings around the creek and on the way back when its darker you get to see the cruise boats all illuminated - a fun, must-do activity - like I said, cheap and best!

Abra Ride.... Fun and should try. Abra (water taxi) is the cheap mode to commute from one side Bur dubai to side of Deira and vice versa. It costs just 1 Dhs per way.Best way of transport for crossing the creek. For visitors, its a nice experience to see old dubai...
The best way to cross Dubai Creek. Crossing the Creek is so easy with an abra. It's cheap, quick and literally the most convenient way to cross the Creek.

Cheap transport from this side to that ;). This transport mode is for the people who want to avoid the traffic and use these small boats for going from Bur to Deira and vice versa, but some foreigners have made it fun for themselves :D. Anyhow, after years of been in Dubai, I finally was convinced to use it for once. It's cheap just a Dirham.
Complete Your Visit to Dubai. Very amusing, cheap and down to earth. A must for all visitors and residents. Just hop on and in 15 minutes you are across the creek.
Abra boats. The abra boats are really good way of traveling from one side to another, they cost 1 dirham and its nice ride too you would love it if you were a boat lover.

Visited gold souk in Deira. To reach the gold souk in deira, we hired a boat from old souk dock. We took a half an hour ride for 60 aed and then the boat dropped us at abra dock. It is 7min walk to gold souk from abra dock. But not so happening place to go during scorching summer of July

A must do when in Dubai. It is so much part of the whole Dubai experience. Having lived in Dubai for 8 years this was one of my favorite things to do to get to the Gold souks. Make sure you put this on your list. Don't go with a taxi - take a WATER taxi. You will not regret the sights and sounds you will experience.
Top little boat ride. this was a pleasant way to get to and around the Souk markets of Dubai, just a quaint little trip or boat ride
The Abra (water taxi) are amazing.. Great way to get from one side of the creek to the other. Very inexpensive. We took an Abra over to Deira to explore the Spice and Gold Souks.
Cheap and Convenient. With just 1-2AED you'd be able to experience riding Abra to cross the river. It's a bit faster than taking a cab.
Abra going Deira to Burdubai. Most cheapest way of transportation going burdubai from deira. You will ride in boat paying dhs.1 only

Authentic boat crossing. We jumped off the Bigbus and caught a boat across 1AED each. It was good to a traditional feel of local life albeit for 5 mins. Locals joined us crossing to Diera Souk. The boat was rickety and we'll trodden but appeared to be regulated by the RTA.

Connecting Traditionally Old Souk & Sabka with Bur Dubai. Bur Dubai Abra gives a memorable water-cruise connection on water between Bur Dubai and Deira which make the two sides of Dubai Creek.In ten minutes we can cross between Deira and Bur Dubai in an abra. Which gives two options, normal wooden boats as well as AirConditioned Water Taxi by RTA.
Feel the breeze. when we ride on the abra we go back to our old way of transportation in the sea and remember our old days
'Proper' Dubai. Great place to visit, cross the boatman's palm with gold and go across the creek on a little wooden raft/boat for great view of both sides of the river.

Nice ride. Abra crossing was a very exciting and pure authentic ride experience on our Dubai tour. i found it is very cheap price of only 1 AED. which very reasonable price. and the ride was very good to experience. we took that to come from Bur Dubai old market to Deira souk and it takes 2 minutes only.Must to experience it i would say.

If you like authentic, visit here!. This is old, authentic Dubai. If you want to go across the creek to the Spice and Gold souk, take a traditiona lwooden abra at a cost of AED 1 per person for a 5 minute journey, which is nothing! The boats just leave when they're full and take about 20 people. You just pay the driver on the boat. Don't expect any health and safety regulations - you jump on and off (over the gap if there is one) and sit on the communal seat down the middle of the boat. There aren't any rails so this might not be a good option if you have small, active children or have certain disabilities. There is a canvas roof so you can hide from the sun. Definitely the best way to cross the creek with great views and photo opportunities. When you arrive at the dock, drivers will ask you if you want to go across or round, round being a 45 minute cruise along the creek. We also did this and had the boat to ourselves. Forget expensive cruises - this is the way to see the creek! The dock itself is also really atmospheric, allowing you to capture the flavour of the other side of Dubai.
Enjoy the ride. Only with 1 dirham one way, you can enjoy the dubai creek, the air, and the view. From the port you can visit gold souk, spice souk
Practical, Cheap, and Fun. Many people use the short ferry to get to and from work everyday. Only being one Dirham, it makes for a cheap and fun way to see Bur Dubai

casual, cheap, fun, and not-too-touristy. My favorite part of riding an abra across the creek is that the locals use it, too, like taking the city bus or train instead of a hired car or taxi. Abra/boat rides are only 1 AED, no reservations or tickets needed: just queue up with the other people, get funneled toward a ready boat, find a spot to sit, and away you go.
its superb and enjoying. its cool and enjoyful.gives a very good scenic beauty. its surrounded with shops and we can tasty food

Amazing!!. This needs to be in your bucket list the next time you visit Dubai. The Abra Journey will give you one of the best views of Old Dubai & New Dubai. And the Cost - just AED 1 per trip. Never expected such a beauty for such a low cost
Fun, very cheap little boat ride.. Took the Abra across Deira Creek to the spice and gold souks. Quick and cheap little trip if you're exploring, but don't waste your time with the souqs there.

A great trip. It feels more like a pleasure cruise but the Abra forms part of the Dubai transport infrastructure, linking the Green Line from Creek Metro station to Festival City.Very cheap and well worth seeking out.
A cheap way to enjoy Old Dubai. Crossing the creek from this dock on an Abra only cost 1 AED! It's also a delight to watch the abras crisscrossing from one side to the other.

Most enjoyable. reat place to wander and absorb a atmosphere. you will be asked it you want to take a tour up the creek, but just say no and cross for a mere 1 dirham! Spice souk one side, a mall on the other for a welcome cool drink and aircon!

fabulous boat trip. It was a great adventure (at sea!) with the most fantastic food and nice entertainment as well. We will never forget how much fun we had. It was also good to see Dubai from the sea instead of from the train or the freeway or the air.

Small smooth sailing. A cheap swift way to go across the creek. Despite its size it is safe and normally all the boats are kept well maintained. I enjoyed the ride and considered it as a small aquaventure.
Good photo opportunity. This is the a good way to cross the creek to the spice/gold souks and is a good way to take some nice photos. It is cheap to cross and the scenery is good.

Mesmerizing View. The best place you can view of man made and its a creek area. The abra crossing through boats is an old age tradition and it still continues and the last best thing is the price. Its just lesser than aed 2. Try this area and friendy people all around and can ask anyone in dubai to get there
truly authentic experience. a great day out for a truly authentic dubai cultural immersion.take water it can get very hot. the markets either side of the creek are fabulous for gold or souvenirs
Picturesc area. If one is looking about old Dubai, there is the place. People going by abra, local but not disturbing noise, poverness and richness, side by side. Worth to spend half of an hour here.
Creek crossing. The scenic way to cross Dubai creek. You can get some very nice pictures here on your way to the spice and gold souq.

Best value for money. For 1 Dirham (kids travel free), this short but enjoyable ride across the creek is well worth the trip. Once on the other side, can take a walk through the old souk areas and enjoy the sights and sounds of old Dubai shops.

Commercially Important Dock. Bur Dubai is commercially very important place in Dubai. It is the centre of trade and commerce and nerve centre of large no.of wholesale & retail business houses (of old/ traditional Dubai ).Trading & commercial activities take place on both sides of creek. Hence here comes the importance of Abra Dock. Ships,,boats, Dhows load & offload goods at this dock . Fishing boats also dock here .Fancy boats,water buses are hired by tourists from here to cruise in the creek.It is a very exciting and pleasant experience. People cross the creek from BurDubai to Gold /Spice souls or for other activities through Abra dock ferry service.Only one Aed oneway fare to cross the Creek and it is really a very cheap & pleasant joy ride. Evening time it is terrific to see the Well-lit buildings, monuments, on both banks of the creek reflecting in the water.Lighted Fancy boats plying in the creek can be seen from this dock.Tourists must visit this place to get a feel of old Dubai.

Charm of old Dubai. This is the real and original Dubai ! You get a glimpse of actual life of Dubai while crossing the creek in just 1AED! We were even approached by some ppl asking for 60AED so stay away. Go for this ferry if in Dubai

Abra- a must to do activity to experience real Dubai! . We used abra to cross Dubai creek from Bur Dubai to Gold Souk in evening. You just pay one dirham (AED) cash per passenger to the boat driver! Eatch trip timing very 5mins or more... But in evening it is worth looking at mix of historical dubai with ultramodern buoldings on banks of the creek... Beutiful lights on boats and at times breez will cheer you while sailing... We travelled with baby stroller and could accomodate in abra after collepsing it fully (surprisingly, RTA, who governs abra, did not know if strollers are accomdated or not... So we took chance of carrying along as we did nit want our little one to walk across crowded streets of Dubai old soukOverall it was fascinating experience for kids and for rest of family it was experienceing traditional way of commuting... Only difficulty we had is lots of diesy smell in air as most abra boats use disel engine I suppose.Next time you go to Dubai, this is highly recommended for a change from AC METRO, BUSES AND CABS ☺

inexpensive way to see old Dubai. For 1 dirham one-way, it was the least expensive way to cross Dubai creek. (Or you could swim..) The abra was really more of a motor boat with a wooden bench on it. For some reason the boater piloted from the middle of the craft (with passengers sitting in his line of sight) from a slightly submerged position (making you wonder whether he could see).If that doesn't deter you, then the abra ride does offer a good view of both sides of the creek. There were also a few tourists (not many, though that may also be because of decreased activity on a Friday, during Ramadan), but generally it was not too crowded or too long to wait for an abra to depart.

Crossing the creek. This dock was a short walk from our hotel. On arrival at the dock there were staff there to assist and direct you to the next vessel to cross the creek. The fare was AED1 about AUD0.40 so it is recommended that you have the small coin when you arrive to pay the driver on the Abra.
The old and real Dubai. Take a trip on the Abra with the local commuters - this is the old dubai. You will find the spice and gold souks here and little bazaars with cheap food.

A Great Way to See the Creek. This is a basic ferry, used by the locals to get from one side of the creek to the other. The fare is minimal and it's a GREAT way to see the creek, especially at night when everything is lit up. Don't waste your money on those dinner cruises with the dried up food. Take this water taxi instead and get the same experience. And no matter what food you may take aboard with you, it's going to be better than the dinner cruise!!

Pleasant experience. We took the Red City Sightseeing bus around Dubai - which I would recommend for first timers to Dubai as one learns about the city this way. The Bur Dubai Abra Dock is an experience and would recommend that you try it.
Must try but!!!!. You must try it when in Dubai. Don't go in the middle of the summer. Exact change is preferred.Keep your balance and don't fall :)
A lot of fun. I went with my 4 year old son and my parents. It was so much fun for him. And it costs 1 dirham for one way :))

Nice, easy and cheap. Just do it. For transportation or for fun. Get a glimpse of old Dubai and its bustling movement by crossing the creek on those boats. It's inexpensive: just a 1 AED. Get your coins ready!

Abra Abra. If you wanted to know what old Dubai was,, Then, head to Bur Dubai Abra dock. or popularly known to residents as Abra Abra. This is indeed the cheapest mode of transportation coz it is only 1Dirham and your single penny will take you a long journey to the Past =) after this boat ride you will reach Deira Old Souk wherein plenty of bargains to choose from.. then have a walk on the old buildings along side =)

I like it here! Authentic Old Dubai Feel!. I like it here as compared to the ultra modern Dubai in the commercial centre! This neighbourhood give you better feeling of the old Dubai, and the 'Arabic Feel' - with Abra (the water taxi) to cross over the Dubai creek with just AED1.00! It is a must try for most travelers!

The Cheapest mode of transport. In 1 ADH they take you from one point to the other and it takes around 5 to 10 mins to complete the journey.If anyone is visiting the creek area they should definitely have a ride in these boat.It's really fun.The best time is Evening & Night time as we can see the limelight of Dubai Creek

Absolute must for tourists. The best way to enjoy Dubai's waterways- take a RTA ferry from Dubai Marina outside Carrefour / marina mall to Al Gudaiba... A 90 minute ride to the Abra Dock area... Then see the Gold Souk, Spice Souk, Meena Bazar Shops , museum etc - use the abra to cross... Once done u take the metro back to Marina if u in that area.. There is a metro station at al Gudaiba too. U have several options to choose at the Abra Dock- but old is gold! Once u do this, you need NOT waste your money doing other boat rides or tours... Also it is not worth taking gold class on ferry as u must go out and enjoy the water/ sea breeze and views... However buy a gold class for the metro.
Good Evening Walk. Abra Dock is the oldest transport between Bur Dubai and deiraStill the cheapest transport mode in DubaiCosts only one dirham You can use to travel between Bur Dubai and deira

Well Organized. Beautifully organized, old aged Dubai !!! for 1 AED, you travel from one side to another in a old charming Abra which are in the same form from ages :)Just be ready to get the boat bumping on to the dock at the end of the trip :)

Dubai old style. We used the dock to access the markets across the creek in Dubai. This place is hectic with both tourists and locals but the cost is minimal and the service is speedy. Be careful getting on if you are slightly unstable as they are keen to load you on and get you moving so as to maximise their numbers and income.

Dubai Favorite!!. Riding the abras for 1 dirhams is one of my favorite activities in Dubai and is something I always take visitors to do. It's one of the few places where you can feel the heritage and heart of Dubai, and it's so cheap. Plus who doesn't love being out on the water? So dig those coins out of your pocket and hop on a boat, you'll be glad you did!

Something you just have to do.... Its the one thing in Dubai that is both enjoyable and good value for money. At less than £10 for 4 of us we zipped about all over the Creekside on these great little boats. Great experience.

Waterfront Tradition. A must for any visitor to Dubai, and at 1UAED per trip must be the bargain of the century. An Agenda trip across Dubai Creek is a fascinating trip back in time. Watching the pilots ply their trade can only be likened to the gondoliers in Venice, but a lot less expensive.

Heritage by ferry ........ This is a very nice and attractive docks on both the sideWhere we can see ferry travel from Deira to Bur Dubai and vice versa Travelling by these ferry is one of the oldest mode of transportation Even there is small cargo ferry types are there for Iran and GCC countries Over all it is a good way of transport Plus you enjoy the sight thru this journey

Simplicity at its best. Did the Abra boat tour as part of the Dubai city tour...very simplistic you hop on for just 1 dhiram, sit now and in no time you are across the creek. Nice views of the dhows plying the Persian gulf, still looking old and sometimes one wonders how they make the journey. A good reminder of how far technology has come...
Great experience when visit of live in Dubai. A traditional transportation across the Dubai Creek. Encounter locals, workers, and tourist. Great way to visit the famous Gold Souq.

Organised chaos , in a good way!. A busy busy place to catch a variety of local water transport. From a 1 dhm crossing over the creek to a ferry ride round to the marina. A good way to combine getting around with a tour of the water and accompanying views. Particularly the ferry with full air con from the marina to the creek at sunset Amazing!
Getting Across the creek. The Abra Dock is quaint and traditional, a small calm trip across the water. But be prepared to bargain a good price to get across the creek.
Very beautiful. For all the lavish things that Dubai is known far, Bur Dubai reminds us all about the humble beginning of this super modern city!

Cheap and Fun ride. The creek borders two sides of the city, one is BurDubai and the other side of the creek is Deira. Both are part of Old dubai and has quite a bit of history. The Abra ride takes you from one side to another at a nominal fee of AED 1 which is shokingly amazing!! You basically squat amonst daily commuters/labors and travel on this fun ride. its quick and fun and cheap. got to do it, i grew up next to the creek and the abra ride brings back memories.
Trip To Dubai. Riding the Abra across the creek. Awesome experience especially for only one dirham. Taking the Abra across the creek lands you where most of the people of the town shop.

cheap transportation. its really cheap and best transportation to travel from bur dubai to deira.. its like a small boat and they charge around 1 dirham to make you travel from one end to the another... it takes hardly 5-7, minutes in comparison to travel by road where you have to pay more and time taken is more

One of the best traditional views of the city/area. This is the best part of the Creek area in my opinion. It is very unique for new visitors and I still love going here after living here for 8 years. Worth a trip across to the other side too!
Boat ride . We visited as family, kids loved the old boats and stepping in and off. 1 dihram only per person to cross the creek, great at sunset. Had a swarma at the Deira side which was tasty.
Great Experience at a Super Cheap Price!. If you wnat to just spend a lazy day loitering around Dubai, definitely visit this attraction. It costs just 1 Dirham per person.
A pleasant ride. Going by the Abra was one of the things I wanted to do.......worth an experience. A ride to relax & enjoy.

Abra water taxi in Dubai. Very short about 5-10min, crossing Dubai creek you may feel like there is a crowded Arabic fair, people crowded around moving up and down on many small boats and gathered together for sale and buy things on both banks of creek. Next to Abra dock is Gold souk and Spices souk.
Should try it at least once!
Cheap boat ride. Cheap way to see Dubai creek. Just pay 1 dirham coin one way.5 min boat ride across to the markets. Everyone does it, don't miss it. These boats run all day

Travel like a local and enjoy Old Dubai. The is the spot from where to take one of the plentiful Abra water taxi boats to Deira on the other side of the Dubai Creek - incredibly cheap and incredibly authentic (1 dirham/one us quarter) for a time-honored transportation system that has been around for a long time. Plus as an additional bonus, the surrounding Bur Dubai area is full of restaurants, many along the water front or even jutting out over the creek - one of the MUST SEE areas in Dubai.
The Abra docks. The Abra docks is a very interesting place to visit. It's a fun ride across Dubai Creek. You get to see and ride probably the oldest public transportation in Dubai.

Different. You will need to use the Abra to travel across the Dubai Creek if you wish to enjoy the Spice and Gold Souks. This is a very cheap way to travel - 1 Dirham - but they are very old and fill the Abra to capacity. The location of the Abra Dock is good as you can enjoy some nice Alfresco Dining. Would still do it again on my next visit.
one of the few things to see in Dubai. I would say Dubai has not so far done a great job preserving things from old Dubai, but this is one of them.

Different Transport Method across the creek. It cost 1 AED to cross the creek and the service matches. The operator was a shade rough and knocked into a couple of other Abra's on the journey. Bit rough and ready but a good insight into how the creek transport may have been in the past.
You have to ride on an Abra. You can't visit Dubai without an Abra ride. Very cheap and basic and just a nice experience. Great way to cross the Creek.

Great way to cross to the souqs. Very nice and inexpensive way to cross the water to visit the souqs on the other side. Abras are very frequent so not need to worry to miss it. I believe you can also book a longer trip with certain companies in there.
Nice transportation. Its very affordable and a quick boating experience... Nice time with nice views... Cornish maintenance was so good..
Amazing short journey. if you are in Dubai and have time must spare at least couple of hours and experience the traditional and economical ferry

Abra. abra is the traditional ship that use to connect dubai bur dubai and deriah part.
the area of the docs is close to a historic part of dubai shindga where the royal family use to live.

Always fun to go to Bur Dubia and take the boat across the creek. Its always nice to go to the creek, wander around the spice and gold souks, get lost down the alleys and then take the ride across the creek to wander and do some shopping. Grab a bite to eat and browse the shops.

May 2016. Spent a day in old Dubai - don't miss it. Lots of souks and the old boats that crisscross the creek for just 1 Dirham. Went on an evening dinner cruise - lovely food, fabulous boat and very pleasant way to spend the evening.

Relaxing and shopping. perfect and convenient with low budget ...while you do shopping with fun of street foods .....but in the souqe tunnel (wooden)shop sellers attitude is not good specially when we travel with female .....as the talk broken languages and try to be more closer to customer by emotional...which is bit loose the stranded of the city .....Love the place

Great experience. The abra( water taxi) are the perfect way if you want to see a part of the old Dubai. With only 1 dirham for person you can cross the canal and visit the souk( market- textile soul and spicy souk) . The trip is short and interesting

A fun 15 minute ride. We rode the Abra from the textile souk to the gold souk. .27cents USD You just hop on and pay the person on board. It's fun to see all the water activity and just a great way to get across the creek.

Boat ride . Enjoyed the water taxi ride to go to bur dubai with a nice view of old town and the high rise building. It's much better then going by taxi. Bur dubai feels like you are in ancient dubai and has good shopping places too

Nothing great about this. You dont lose anyting if you visit this off the route (off route from most tourist attractions) attraction mentioned in general tourist itinearies i.e. it is not a disappointment. At the same time, you dont lose anything if you dont visit this one - there is nothing interesting about this. A normal ferry to cross the creek costs AED 1/person vs you can go for a creek tour @ 160AED per person for 60 mins (I did not do this)
Interesting. It's different and at least it is old for Dubai that is. Worth a wee visit and a trip on an Abra, you wont be sea sick.
Average attarction. Abras are used by working class people, mainly to cross the creek. They charge 01DHS, merely a 10 min. ride.

Bur Dubai Abra Dock - Great Experience to Cross Like a Local. This is a really fun experience to cross the Creek on an Abra which has plied back and forth from early times for the princely sum of 1 dirham. The local laugh as you go on and are quite happy to share. Once the boat is full it sets off and only takes a few minutes to cross where you can visit Dubai Museum and some other places of interest. Many local shops here as well with interesting articles for sale. Well worth a visit to historic Dubai. Usually very busy on Fridays. If you found this review of interest please indicate below.

Dubai old town. Visited the Abra Dock after the Gold and Spice souqs, it is definitely wirth a visit of you are around the area to admire the abras and see the old part of Dubai from a different angle. It's nothing very exciting but if you are interested in the history of the town, then it is a must do!

Must to do. Crossing the Creek from Deira to Al Ras, from the Textile Souk to the Gold Souk a must visiting Dubai.Millions of people use the abra to cross the Creek for a couple of Dirham, if you don't do this your missing part of the culture of Dubai
One of the exciting excursions in Duba. One of the exciting excursions in Dubai is very cheap can hear a wonderful tour for AED only one in the waters of the creek between Bur Dubai to the old Dubai

Not much to see and dont expect too much from this park of the dubai. Just an old town of Dubai with nothing much apart from having a rough ride on a small Abra (old style boat loaded with several people). First of all, it was really windy and sand storm day when we went with the kids via train from Dubai Marina Towers (wasnt a good idea at all and no boat could go to Old dubai due to storm).Then hardy found any taxi at the train station due to storm and the station not being very busy (last station of this side of dubai). Took an Abra )old style boat ) for few dinars per person which took was a good BUT short ride and nothing excited to see around. Jus feels like you are in an OLD market where cleaning,luxury life or malls are not on government's list.Walked through Dubai Market which was just fine but nothing much to see or shop. Then we all ended up taking taxi back to marina malls after getting bored and roated enough in OLD dubai. Must visit for experience but dont waste much of your time on visit to Old dubai if you are short on your holidays
Part of Dubai. If you are near the Creek you must do. A unique experience to see the waterway from a different aspect.

Nice place . This dock is a must see. Colorful and historic place that makes the link between the 2 old part of the town Deira and Bur Dubai. You can just sit for a fresh juice and watch around. Is always windy so even under hot weather is pleasant.

A must for tourists to experience the old Dubai.. I took the water taxi from the Old souq to the Spicesouq and back just to experience the sights around Dubai Creek. It's not for tourists only. Locals use the water taxis for their everyday commute just like the ones in Venice and Bangkok.

Cheap transport!. Experience the cheapest mode of transport using the motorised abra(boat). You can use your NOL card or pay 1AED to travel across the marine stations. However RTA do operate a luxurious mode of marine transport called Water Taxi!
We could not believe the low cost. Each ride is 1 Dirham. The organisation was good and the operators were patient and efficient. Cheap transport across the creek for locals and tourists.

Public transport at its Best!!!. If you wish to go from Bur Dubai towards Deira or vice versa, this is the most convenient way to avoid travelling by your car which might get you stuck in traffic or radio signals getting jammed cross under the creek tunnel. It will cost you just 1 dirham.Having said about the price, its a good experience to see the organised way of docking these small boats at the shores and also the safety measures taken by the Dubai government to not forego this wonderful attraction which has been there for decades.

Organized Chaos. Although there seems to be no pattern to the flow of abras from one side of the creek to the other there are very helpful people on both sides of the creek as well as information booths at all the stations. ASK,ASK,ASK

Abra. Abra is a traditional boat made of wood. Abras are used to ferry people across the Dubai Creek in Dubai connecting Deira and Bur Dubai and its the cheapest means of transport between the two places.
Great experience and cheap!. Great experience to cross the creek on board a dhow and super cheap at 1 dhr. Definitely worth it for a great view on both sides

Great attraction and cheapest to visit. We were on a tour of Dubai traditional visit by our organizer Daytur company. this attraction was the best one which was reflecting the real image of Dubai tradition and culture... i would recommend it to try once anyone in Dubai. very cheap less then 1$ even.
A MUST DO VISIT AND RIDE. This is a fabulous way to get across the Creek, quick, cheap and fun. Locals and tourists use this service and you see some great characters on board.

Still the Cheapest Mode of Public Transport. I took the Abra recently after several years - crossed over from Deira to Bur Dubai. Amazing to note it just costs AED 1/- for a one way trip. I remember first using the Abra when I arrived in Dubai back in 1972 for 25 fils so 44 years later the price increase is inconsequential.The crossing is quick and efficient but not a pleasant exercise in the summer heat. However, in the cooler winter months, it is ideal with a lovely breeze blowing across Dubai Creek.Full marks to the Authorities to ensure better docking facilities, as well as introducing safety measures to ensure this popular mode of public transport remains at the cutting edge so to speak.
Loved it. Loved crossing the creek for only 1 dirham on a wooden boat. One evening our family of 4 hired an aura to tour the creek for 120 dirhams ... what a nice thing to do.
Great and very cheap. Excellent way of getting across the creek from the Meena Bazaar area to the Diera Souk. 1 Dirham per head.
Abra. these are must have traditional experience in dubai. You pay AED 1 to get to the other side in Abra! Traditional Wooden small abras ferrying passengers to the other side of the canal!

Trip. Not many people use the little boat rides as part of the tour but they should. Not only is it cheap, it is also an experience. It is ideal when touring people from the Dubai Museum to the Gold Souq or vice versa since there are other places of interest along the way.
Photogenic. Photogenic and very relevant to cross the creek. Perfect system of a water designed transportation in a very eficient and economic manner. Don't miss it.

Must try. Must try ..it's in 1dhms only and 2dhms if passengers are less than 10 in number. It is a 5 mins ride only . we took it from deira to AL fahidi and it was a nice experience. The person will try to pitch you personalised trips to make money which is around 120dhms. My recommendation is to take the shared one and enjoy the experience of travelling with localites in there local way.

Creek ride in dubai on the traditional abra boat.nice dock area. The bur dubai abra dock is a well maintained area with free seating,nice cafes and well preserved heritage. convenient to take the abra ride which is a cheap,fast way to cross the creek and explore the traditional markets areas and souks of dubai.
Abra rides. This was a nice and inexpensive way to see some of Bur Dubai . Nice guide , great weather and good scenery. Recommended.

Cheap, Easy and Exciting Way to Cross the Creek. There are two abra stops on the Diera side of the Dubai Creek and we chose this one, because it let us off closest to the Dubai Museum. For 1 Dhr, you can't go wrong! The ride was about 5 minutes and it provided great views of both Bur Dubai and Diera. It was cool because we rode with many locals, and were some of the only tourists on our abra. You can't beat the price, ride and view. It's a must do!

Safe, interesting and old part of Dubai. The dock area before you take an Abra for just 1 Dirham across the creek to the gold, perfume and spice souks, not only had the main souk area where almost every trader tries to sell you a pashmina, but little backstreet where the more interesting shops lurk. The streets are narrow and quite busy, but just off the main tourist drag and you are less pestered here. After my explorations I made my way to the very efficiently run Abra docks to get a boat - most attractive waterfront area with a few places to eat. Worth a most around.
Fun. This is a fun way to see life how it would have been before dubai developed into what it is today. I took the abra across and back for 50 fils each way, so cheap and cheerful!

1 dirham boat ride.. want to experience riding a boat? go to Bur Dubai Abra dock and ride a boat at AED 1 per trip. cheapest boat ride ever though it is near only but the experience itself is pleasurable.

Cheap way to get to the spice souk. Quick and efficient mode of transport to cross the creek. There are 20 people per abra and its quick and cheap. Not delux travel but exciting neverthe less. They run about every ten minutes both ways and run around the clock

A canoe ride in a hi-tech cosmopolitan city. When I saw an Abra for the first time, I was amused to see canoes at work in Futuristic city Dubai. We took a short ride for 1 Dirham each. The ride was pleasant and my fellow travellers were friendly too.

Nice Dhow Cruise!!. Had a lovely time on the Show cruise at the Abra Docks...The Dhow sailors are pretty pleasant and the atmosphere is nice.Not something out of the world...but good enough to relax after a tiring day walking around old Dubai.

must ride for every tourist. At 1 aed, it's a bargain and a great way to get around from spice Souk to the textile Souk & back.A bit scary to get and off as no one will hold your hand, unless you ask, of course :)

Something Different than your daily commute. Pay 1 Aed hop-on in this small boat, they call it "Abra" and u are on the go...experience something different than your daily commute...avoid it during summer...
A relaxing trip. Between Gold Market and Old Market it is a nice and relaxing with local Boat transportation over the creek a great new experience.

When in Dubai, do as the locals do. Well maybe the locals do not use this form of transportation, but it is something that all visitors should try, It was fun to cross the creek via the abras and visit the gold and spice souks.
Great, cheap, freeing. Except for the smell of the Abra fumes, its a nice short ride, interesting old boats along the way to your destination.

Great little boats. We took a small boat across to the gold and spice markets. It was a short 5 minute journey but great fun. Well worth joining the locals on one of these water taxis. It was free also..
Nice. Enjoyed ferry trip. Charge of the same was apprx 1-2 DHS to connect New to Bur dubai. Been shared by 10-15 people.. excellent as can reach in just 5 min..

Not a big fan of old dubai. This may sound quite snbby but I prefer modern dubai. Old Dubai is very crowded almost claustrophobic and it's crazy hard to try and get a taxi if it's the weekend. That being said if you want to get an authentic real life cultural dubai experience Thai would be the area to come

Old Dubai. If you want to get a feel for what Dubai was like 20 years ago and probably 50 years ago too then its well worth heading down here. Take an abhra across the creek to take in the view for a few dirhams. Its an oasis away from the modern skyscrapers and traffic.

Very good place. I visited Dubai few days back and when ever I go I don't miss going to Anes dock and going to the spice market it's really awesome the boat drive is good in the evening...you can take some selfies it's beautiful

Abra Experience. One of the most exciting way to travel or cross a river with just 1AED. Definitely worth the commute in crossing the Deira and Bur Dubai boundary and going to Al Bastakiya.. my favorite place! :)

Abra Dock. we used abra dock to cross the creeck to go to Bur Dubai from Mennabazar area , small boats are there which takes a little money to ride it , but looks very dirty and risky , overall enjoyed the ride

Meena Bazaar, Spice & Gold Souk. This area allows you to see old Dubai and great architecture. The boat ride from one side of the port to the other is 1 AED only. Spice Souk is interesting to purchase food, grains, art, cushions, carpets and clothing. The prices are slightly higher as the inflow of tourists in these markets is alot.

Pop over to the Gold Souk . Access from a small boat near the port for 2Dhs.
A sight not to be missed, visit at dusk to experience the magnificent colour of the gold displays and the light cascading from them. The atmosphere was fun and vibrant, be prepared to barter

Berilliant experience!. For only 1 AED you can jump on the boats and join the locals to cross the creek. Its a fantastic experience but without doubt Fridays are best as its the start of the weekend and the whole creek is frenetic and chaotic but its a "must do" when you are in Dubai!
it is a dock, only a dock. this place might be interesting only if its on your way during a tour; it is a dock where you can experience the old Dubai.
Old charm. The Bur Dubai Abra has maintained its old charm, while trying to meet the demands of the modern world. Its a quick trip to the old ways of the people at at extremely affordable price.
Cheap and nice. If you are just passing Deira by Bur Dubai it is good for you to get Abra experience. It cost Just 1 Dirham and will have nice experinces.

Fastest way tor go to Gold Souk from the Dubai Museum. The Abra Dock ride gives a flavour of the life of the locals in Dubari. It also transports you fast saving you time to cross from you Dubai Museum tour or back.
was there but couldn't find the right dock for the ride that came with the city tour.. not much to say, did talk to a few local people and that was awesome. received three marriage proposals.

old meets new. Here you can board a traditional boat for a cheap ride across the creek. You will see all the modern architecture of the city and you ride will end in the traditional spice and gold souks (markets). Definitely, take this ride!!

Authentic Old Dubai Experience !!. The Dubai of today may be about the gleaming new towers and resorts but the Creek is where this small village earned its keep to grow into the bustling metropolis of today. The Abra provides a cheap quick water taxi between Bur Dubai and Deira. I highly recommend this to travelers who want to see and feel how the real Dubai local travels.
Good Old Dubai!. This is the way to go if you really want to understand Dubai's trading roots. A must visit for residents and visitors.

"Abras"-Another version of Dubai. Abras are traditional wooden boat of Dubai-which is open to sky run & operated by a motor.If you like to see another version of Dubai -Calm,traditional structures...Better to take an Abra from Diera old souk area to Bur Dubai/Al Gubaiba area along Shindagha lake.Travelling in Abra itself is refreshing ...Once to reach opposite side of Diera, by walk you can see....old souks...Dubai Museum(Al Fahidi Fort),Meena Bazar (cheap place for shopping and see n no:of restaurants ),Sheikh Saeed Al Maktoum House , Heritage Village of Dubai,Grand Mosque,Al Bastakiya, and so on...Travelling through Abras are really cheap..its just 1 AED that you can directly pay to Abra operator..Best time to travel is just before sunset...You can even see beautifulbirds flying & floating around Shindagha lake. While travelling you can even see traditional buildings & modern skyline .....traditional abras & modern boats ...

Cross the Dubai creek like locals do.... For less than 50 cents you will share a ride with other passengers in a local boat, from one side of the creek to the other. Either the departure or the arrival is at the gold or spices suqs (bazaars): not to be missed....
Nice. The abra ride - for me was must do - for experiencing a bit of Dubai's past . Its a short ride costs just AED1 , connects Deira and Bur Dubai .

Experience the Abra crossing of the Creek. Authentic way of crossing the Creek for AED 1.00 only (payable on board). A sensory experience mixing floating on the water on a small boat, facing the water with perfect view of Bur Dubai or Deira, seated next to locals and Asian manpower, listening to occasional calls of the muezzin somewhat covered by the loud "tuk-tuk" noise of old motors and smelling their fumes...
Great !. Great value. For 10 dirams you get a nice little boat ride from the souks and you can see a traditional arabic boats.
Bur Dubai Abra Dock. Experience on Abra is amazing, it's just AED 1 to go to other side of the creek. You have to pay directly to Abra operator.
only a dirham to sit and travel from one end to another.. Its quite cheap. It behind dubai meuseum. Meena Bazaar is walking distance from abra. The other end is gold souq,
Good tour in abra. Very clean placeTour in abra very good from bur dubai to deiraDubai sea is very cleanWent with family members for tour in abra

Old part of Dubai you want to visit. Very few spots in Dubai are "old" and not overrated. Abra Dock and close by markets are worth visit. You can easily spend the whole day exploring old Bastakia quaters that are nearby. Nice walking area with little shops and restaurants. Avoid Fridays- too busy
Abra on the Creek. Price hasn't changed for a long time, still only 1 DHS each way. Great place to take visitors to get out on the creek and see some of the souks.
Abra. For sake of fun People of India & Pakistan and also we just called it Abra ka Dabra and it is fun to go in it from bur dubai to deira & vice versa

Catch a ferry to the Souks. The Bur Dubai Abra Dock is a place to visit if you plan to go to the gold souk and spice souk. A short ferry ride called an Abra across from one end to the other allows you an experience to walk through a sheltered arcade flanked by small stalls selling a variety of spices, souvenirs, clothing, jewellery and handbags. Do try to bargain and reap the rewards!
A nice ride. Pay 1 AED and they take for a 20 min ride.. try to go around sunset as the view of sun setting against the backdrop of the river is a sight to behold!

An inexpensive way to see the Creek. It is what it is, a taxi across the creek for 1 Dirham, offering you the opportunity to visit Deria and the places that originally made Dubai a shopping cent before the mega malls. Dubai is no longer a cheap source of goods, but you can save 10-20% on prices from the Marina area. Check your map and make sure you get on the right boat, they go to different places. You can walk down the Creek and see what is exported from Dubai to Iran, Iraq, Pakistan and India.... an eye opener.
Abra. For the amount of 1 AED, you can experience and see the beautiful place of Dubai Creek and how people do their business at creek.
A must to try. Cheap and fun way to cross the creek from one side to the other for only 1 AED !! A way to cross over and see the souks and have cheap meals.

This is one taxi you must use!. One of my favorite places in Dubai! Lovely atmosphere by the Creek both in the mornings and evenings at the Bur Dubai Abra Dock. Abra is a traditional boat used as a water taxi. 1 Dirham to cross over to Deira to reach the Gold and Spice Souks in a shared Abra. Or 60 Dirhams per half hour for a private Abra trip along the creek. Did both. Just loved the experience.

Out on the water. Seeing the old city from the waters of the creek gives a pleasant change of perspective and a bit of welcome breeze. This service used by locals and travellers alike is ridiculously cheap and a great way of hopping form side to side. Fun.

Great trip up the creek and across to the Gold Souk. Great trip up the creek and across to the Gold Souk with regulated pricing except for excursions. Relaxing in the heat and a way to rest i n the rush. Don't miss the spice and gold market just beyond.

Enjoy the souks and old Dubai. I've been there now nearly 5 times. Take the Abra water taxi for 1 Aed per person. It's a 3 minute fun ride with great views across the creek! Stop at the other side for some ice cream. Walk the souks and if you're in the mood buy some stuff but don't forget to bargain! They guys can be quite annoying but just smile and say thank you if you don't wanna buy. Check out the spice, gold and perfume souk. Either go early in the morning or later for the sunset. Have lunch or dinner at the restaurants around the creek area!

Fun, cheap and authentic. Just 1 dhs to cross the river, it's a fun way to get across to the gold souk from Bur Dubai.
It's crazy, it's fun and a must do.

Cheap and cool. These boats run from the old souks to Deira souks (gold and spice). Don't expect boat driver (captain?) to speak any English - and make sure you have 1 dirham per person in cash. You will stand in a queue waiting for a boat - a guy on the dock will direct you - and when the abra is docked, you get on a take a "seat". Driver will "ask" for your coins by banging his fist on the hull. It's safe and clean but the boats are not new. It's a quick trip and super value.
A cheap trip on the water.. The trip across the creek took at least 10 minutes and cost 1 dirham only, about 20 pence! It was worth ten times the price!

A complete different atmosphere . Enjoy a ride on the small boats to go and stroll in the old Dubai It's a real pleasure to discover the 2 faces of this city in such a way.Go and shop in the souk for spices, gold...

Ride on an Abra is a must!. You cannot come to Dubai and take a trip on an Abra across the creek. Get on at Bastakiya Bur Dubai, cross to other side of creek visit the Gold Souk, get a shwarma then travel back to the other side. Cheap enough think its about 10dhs (less than 2 quid). You can also hire an abra out for a full tour of the creek, not sure of price.

Good experience and very friendly people. You can go there for 'Abra' ride experience. Abra is small boat open from all side which carry around 15 people. Abra was used to cross the Creek in old time.Very cheap and need only 30 min. Local are always happy to help you, they will not ask for any huge amount as you will look like British or any other national tourist.

Nifty little area. All the locals are happy to help and no one is trying to rip you off, theres a small ice cream stand selling other drinks and then theres a small stall that sell goods that are over priced but they can easily be bartered down. Felt safe here and no problems getting about

Just go for a ride -only 1 Dirham!. There are a few spots to get a ride on an abra on Dubai Creek. Even if you end up as I did sometimes on the wrong spot it does not matter. Still good fun and good to meet locals.
Abra. Very helpful staff when we didn't know which Abra to take across the creek. There are 2 routes with 2 stations nearby in Bur Dubai.Fare is still just AED 1 each way

A gem. This is by far the cheapest, treat when you go to Dubai, the Abra experience is not something you will forget if you ever go. The view of the creek and to mingle with locals is a fun experience!

Do not consider your stay in Dubai as completed without taking a ride on the Abra. A ride on the Abra across the Creek , esp late in the evenings, is great fun . The ride costs just 1 Dirham , and enables you to go to Bur Dubai from Deira and vice versa . Made friends with two workers from the State of Rajasthan, India during the short less than 10 minutes ride , who after the crossing, showed me around the spice souq as well as the amazing gold souq , The visit to Dubai creek also enables you to experience old, traditional Dubai which is so very different from the city of huge skyscrapers and wide roads that Dubai is . Highly recommended, DO NOT MISS IT .Note: Dubai Creek can be reached via Dubai Metro Station Al Ghubaiba on the Green Line route , 2 stations away from Bur Juman Mall .

trip back to the traditional Dubai. It's as the title says, you can go on a traditional boat to cross the canal from near the Al Ghubaiba metro (about a 5 min walk away) to cross the creek next to the spice souk and the rest of that area. Well worth it and only 1 Dirham to pay per person
Must do water bus ride!. So we took water bus from gold souk to diera for 1 AED!!! It was beautiful ride and my son loved it. You get to see old dubai.Very clean water. Dont miss it.
Give it a try!. If you get to the area you need to give this a go as it was good fun and try what comes from tradition.
Must do . Great way to see the and feel the old Dubai . Cheap too but be prepared for some enthusiastic vendors in the souq when you get off the boat. All adds to the experience
Short stay. No fuss but one of the cheapest mode of transport, 1 dhiram!! Good views, clean blue water. Most of the time abra is loading, so did no queue up even. First class service.

Nice point to enjoy Bur Dubai. If you want to feel old and real Dubai, then visit this place and take a ride, one of the cheapest, may be as less as 1 Dirham as told by our guide. You can enjoy Creek as well as Bur Dubai.
Take a ride. Ithis is where the history of Dubai lies... Take ride in abra and you will love it. It takes you to the souqs...

Nice way to cross the river, cheap!. Easy way to cross to other side,and explore.....Hope that the ticket printer is working, as they can't do manual tickets. The little shop on the ticket side has chilled coconuts where you can get real fresh coconut water!
Experience the Arab way of sailing.... Great Sailing at cheapest fare in Dubai. Its perfect way to experience the Creek along Bur Dubai. Don't miss it....

A bit of old Dubai. We hopped on an Abra on a friends recommendation. It's only 1dhs and gives you a look at another side of Dubai, which I found refreshing. Alongside there are lots of souks (markets) but also a lot of touristy rubbish. Still nice to go and see for an afternoon.
Waw best water ride..!!!. Hi experienced a best water ride with my friends one of the best place in Dubai.. Had lot of fun..Planning to go more such rides..

Another side of Dubai , worth experience it as well. We took the boat/ ferry for 1 AED, just to cross the river, to experience how the workers live in Dubai. You can see the old Dubai area! Great experience
Its a boat ride. Nothing much. At this point you are probably running out of things to interest yourself and your companions . Its a cheap way see a little more from this boring city.

A real experience. My first impression was that this is chaos, but when you looked at it for some time, you see how organized it is, and how well it works, it's an experience to sail with small boats, it is an experience you must try and it costs almost nothing
Traditional way to travel. The abras take you across the creek to the souks , cost is just 1 aed about 20 pence . It's like a hop on boat , takes about 20 people and takes around 5 minutes

My favourite place in Dubai. This is by far my favourite place in Dubai, especially at sunset when all the mosks all call for praying. The whole atmosphere is incredible, especially when you cross the river in an Abra boat. I am so happy that most of the tourists stay in the malls and do not come here, which maintains the aura of authenticity.

Great way to cross the creek - and cheap!. For 1 Dirham (about 20p) you can cross the creek in about 5-7 mins. It is a unique experience, often crowded always with the aroma of diesel, but authentic and as far away from a 5* hotel brunch as you can get. The benefit of being in this area is that you can get a taste of the real Dubai away from the glitz and glamour and you can bag yourself a deal at the souqs too.
Great fun. We travelled on an abra boat from a souk to the spice souk. It was a Great boat ride. You can get a gist of old Dubai. Fantastic. The hustle and the bustle. Soak up the atmosphere.

Old style water taxi. Rather basic method transport for crossing the Dubai Creek. But this is a popular method for the locals for travelling the river and at 1 dirham pp you can't complain.The short journey gives you a view of both sides of the river with lots of other abras and dhows to be seen. We travelled from the old quarter side so we could wander around souks and heritage school and museums.

Sea side Paradise. Its a wonderful place to sit and spend time when you are alone or with a partner. I love the place for u can watch birds and aircrafts because it is on the take of route of all aircrafts taking of from Dubai.
Cool novelty exerience. We took an Abra across the creek whilst sight seeing in Old Dubai. Really cool experience, well worth the 1AED! Take your camera and get some great shots whilst crossing.
Interesting dock. it is in the old Dubai area, can be used to cross the Dubai creek via boat, Dubai is interesting place where various modes of transport exist
Blast from the past experience. Raft boat terminal for those who wants to pass the creek to the Old Dubai. The Raft boat trip which last about 3 - 4 minutes only cost 1 Dirham.

Old Dubai, may it persist. Good view of The Creek and the constant traffic in and out of old Dubai, mainly dhows and the ubiquitous abras that will take you across the water for pennies...better than a theme park!
Nice way to explore Dubai. Nice way to see and explore more. You can also book whole Abra boat just for you for private trip around the Creek river.
dubai in 1/2 day. It was fun seeing the local style of fishing or passenger boats. And the market just opposite, you see a bit of local life here.

Nice. It Was a nice Experiencing Arba Dock, on floationg crystal clear water in a chlled weaher
thoug i suggest whoever visits dubai once must try Arba Dock.

Enjoy the traditional boat ride. In less than 1 dollar enjoy the a beautiful view of the sea with a cool breeze and the traditional house boats made of wood, you can see the jumping fishes while on the move

A fun little trip across the creek to see the Souks. It costs 1 Dihram to cross the river ad you pay the man on the boat directly. If you visit dubai fort and museum first (which cost 5 Dihrams) you just walk in a downwards direction behind the Mosque where you will then find a Souk and the waterside with the Abras.

Very lively and busy, scenic place. We took the Metro to Al Ras as it's not really clear which station is best. Then it's a ten minute walk along the riverside towards the dock and gold/spice souks. There are no signs so just ask someone. The Abra ride across the river costs just 1 Dirham and it's fun and quite fast. It only takes a minute or two and you get to see the old cargo boats etc along the way. On the other side you can visit local supermarkets and shops or sit in the park (on the grass as there's no seats). The souks and many shops around the dock were closed when we visited on a Friday so avoid that day if you want to shop.

Unusual. Dozens of small wooden water taxis that run back and forth, one dirham a trip, simply hop on and experience the creek /river at water level for 5 mins.Leads easily to the markets/gold souk .Something just a bit different and worth trying.

Inexpensive and fun - a bit of old Dubai. After a long day in the sun a trip to the Abra Dock is a fun and inexpensive way to experience what little there is of old Dubai. There is a nice market by the Dock with your usual pashminas, water pipes and other touristy things. The vendors are intense but still friendly. By the docks you can take an aura, a boat for up to 20 people that for only 1 Dirham takes you over to the other side. The trip takes max 10 minutes. On the other side i the gold souk and the spice souk. Not for me but still fun. Go back on the abra and then you can enjoy dinner at the water restaurants. Maybe not the best food ever I had in Dubai but adequate and a big plus for the almost Disneylike setting.

Trendy Bar. We started our even at the Dubai Fountains but no alcohol is served over there. We then moved over to Bar Dubai based on a recommendation and we were not disappointed.Great drinks, great atmosphere and great entertainment!

Enjoy the Abra Ride. It's one of the ways to go across the creek. There are two routes - 1. Deira Old Souq to Bur Dubai and 2. Al Sabha to Dubai Old Souq. On both routes the fare is AED 1 and these are for public transportation. You can also hire the Abras for Private Trips ar AED 100 per hour. Best time for this trip is late evenings in summer March to October and any time during day November to February.Useful Tips: If you are lone male the public Abra trip is fine as you can jostle with other pax who are generally workmen.If you are a couple or family a private trip is ideal and you can enjoy sights, smell and sounds of the creek.If the wind and tide are high, these choppy water can toss the Abra when boarding and de-boarding.
