So be careful with your step.People allergic to diesel smoke should avoid the Abra Ride as it can make you throw up.
Interesting place. Take a ride on the water taxi, only 2 dirham. The souks are very interesting. Nice to walk around spices etc also gold souk.
BOAT RIDE. A great and Simple boat ride for crossing and enjoying the Dubai Creek.would like everyone who visit Dubai to experience once. You will never forget the ride.

The cheapest form of Transport in Dubai. For 1 Dirham you enjoy boat ride, fresh breeze and a view of Deira Creek. This is the only cheapest transport system in Dubai for poor and rich fun-frolic people. Must try once.
True Taste of Dubai.. You can go acroos the creek by abra for just a Dirhem.You can come back the same way if you have another Dirhem.Watch the World go by.

Holy old school Batman!. OK, it only costs 1dhs and it gets you from Bur Dubai over to Deira, to the gold souk. And this is really the way it used to be-on these small wooden boats... kind of awesome that they still use them1

Interesting experience!. It is a very pleasant experience and a cheap one too. It will cost you only 1 AED. We did not have to wait long and we all had enough space to take a seat and enjoy the ride and the view. You should try it!
Takes you back in Time. If you wanna go back in time then head to the bur dubai creek and take a ride on the abra which is super cheap but will give you a great experience.

From Australia. A busy little spot. Always an arba ready to take you for a ride. Coming & going all the time,commuters from across the old gold souks.It is interesting to just sit & watch the action.At sunset a lovely spot. Across the Creek for 1 dirrham.

The Abra experience. It is an interesting activity, it is cheap at one dirham that gets the visitor to ride a local engine boat that goes across the Dubai Creek. The ride is short about 10 minutes the boat holds about 12 people who sit around the engine housing looking outside. The creek is busy with junks going by transporting goods.

Cheap Transport. It was a nice way to get from one side of the creek to the Souk Markets. Water was not choppy and a smooth ride. Interesting to see the old time transportation being used to date and they are preserving some of the history.

One of the best places in town. I did do the crossing from Bur Dubai to Deira aboard an abra for just 1 dirham. But even if you don't want do cross the Dubai Creek, the abra station per se is worth visiting. Sit on a bench or just stand there for a while and watch the hustle and bustle of boats and commuters coming and going. Definitely one of the best places in town for free or for as little as 1 dirham if you decide to board the abra to Deira.

Colorful, Cheap & Traditional!. A fun way to cross Dubai's scenic river in an historic, cheap open boat (only cost 1 Dirham, about 30 cents :) Crossing links various key 'souks' in interesting old quarter.

A different experience . It was a new experience to sit in Abra, unlike the boats in my country, we sat on the corners of a rectangular platform, situated in between the boat. Never saw these kind of boats anywhere else, they charged 1 dirham per person to cross the creek. Definitely a must do if you are nearby and is worth more than what you are paying.
1 AHD, fab!. What an experience, kids loved it, we loved it! Experience Dubai like the locals. Get to see a gorgeous view of old Dubai as your abra moors in

A local and cheap attraction. For sure the cheapest attraction in the city, for 1 AED you can cross to the other side of the creek and enjoy the view of both sides, the birds and the other boats docking.

Great experience . Got a free ticket with the Emirates hop on hop off bus great way to experience Dubai as it was short but very sweet cross the creek in a few short minutes and see how it's been done for years literally rubbing shoulders with the Emirate's
Quickest and easiest way to cross the creek. 1 dirham per person each way. so easy journey takes about 4 minutes. its even the same cost if you travel from the further station up the creek.

Should visit for a quick tour. should visit for a quick tour and understanding of the old ways of Dubai. Here you will see old vessels and items being traded. Also there are boats if you want to take a sightseeing tour
Take the ride. Take a ride for fun. It is cheap and fast service.Well organized and just fun to do. Little waiting and you can visit the souks on each side,. Used by all the locals
Well organised and cheap taxi service 1 dirham (20p). Well organised and cheap taxi service 1 dirham (20p) across the Dubai Creek. Little waiting. Used by all the locals.

Picturesque and quickest way across the Dubai Creek. Day or Night, Crossing the creek on Abra is a pleasure. As you get away from the shores, the noise of the city recedes and you can enjoy the sights on both sides of the creek. Wish they will use slower boats to help tourists soak in the atmosphere.

really enjoyed the stroll through the souk. Spend some time looking through the souks at both sides of the river. The river crossing on a small bum bum boat was enjoyable, informal and cheap. Lots of gold and jewelry shops to look at. As always be careful and remember that quoted prices on a calculator will be at least 3 or four times more than it should be. We stumbled across a heritage restored house from about 1910 on the deira side of the river which was an enjoyable interlude and was free. We did not have time to go into the Dubai museum but this looked good.Do remember that the traffic in Dubai is horrendous

Best value and interesting - must do. Pity about the garbage.. The Dubai Creek abras are a must-do, to see the vibrant activity on the Creek, including the ornate dhows plying between Iran and the UAE. At 1 dirham per crossing, extremely cheap! Pity about the ubiquitous garbage floating in the Creek, and you can see people at the abra wharf letting their disposable packaging and plastic rubbish just blow into the water - some more garbage awareness and management would be a good thing.

Good for 1 AED. For 1 AED the ride is quite satisfying and is a fair amount of time to go from once side to another. Bare in mind the place does intend to get busy since it's a public transport! However, the wait shouldn't be that long and you only need to pay once you're on the ride:)
Very interesting to take these taxis!. At 1 AED you get to take a water taxi from one end to the other - and there is a great local market to the one side.

Looks scary but good fun. I got a water taxi ride as part of my hop on/off bus ticket. It doesn't look as though it would hold a lot of people without sinking but it actually feels very safe once you get on and an experience not to miss.

small trip to cross bur Dubai... i was residing in BUR dubai , but wanted to visit gold souk , so my hotel manager suggested to trval by ferry across bur dubai, its a small ride of 5 minutes but enjoyable , if you plan to visit, gold souk and spice market must travel by this.
price one dirham.

cheap and cheerful. Please bare in mind this is local transport, it is 1 AED to travel across and 1 to come back, the drivers understand tourist take the transport and are helpful but they are not tour guides.
it is a beautiful little trip across the creek and back, on a traditional little boat.
Funny. It's very funny and a wonderful experience to go with an Abra from one to the other side of Bur Dubai. It's really a must and you get a little bit of local feeling in the old part of Dubai

Cross Bur to Diera. Good option to travel from Bur to Diera (vice Versa).
I was surprised to see how organised and clean the Abra system was. And the amazing thing was that in that crowded area - you wont find even a straw floating in the river, very clean aqua water.
Need to go!. Living in Dubai I always enjoy using this, it is a great experience to go on this wooden boat which is 1AED (approximately 18p)!

A simple nice ride. A simple nice ride that costs next to nothing... You'll find this to be less of an attraction and more of an actual mode of transport for many people living and working in that area.

Couldn't Be Easier, and Much Fun. I've taken an abra both on tours and with my visiting family. It's a lovely, albeit quick way to cross the Creek, Bur Dubai to Deira and vice versa, and for only one dirham (~30 cents U.S.D.). Most recently, I crossed with my 78-year-old mom, 12-year-old son, and 10-year-old daughter. My daughter was a little nervous at first, as there is no rail at all, but after the crossing, we all wanted it to last longer. Abras carry about 20 people. You pay the operator (who will often steer with his foot) directly. You can also rent an abra for ~60 dirhams for an intimate trip across—perhaps for a unique proposal.

Enjoyable experience. Besides being a cheap and efficient way of crossing the creek, the journey itself is part of an adventure. Good to see the surrounding landscape from a different angle and be part of the hustle and bustle on the creek . The whole safety aspect of the Abra and the trip concerns me (no life jackets, balance when embarking and disembarking, etc).

Magical - this is the best 20p you will ever spend. For 1 dirham which is worth 20p, you can travel by these fantastic 20 seater boats across Dubai creek. If you would like an Abra to yourself, you can hire it for 20 dirhams.It really is a super way for tourists to imagine old Dubai and it is a recognised mode of transport for local people in Dubai.If you are able to take an Abra both during the day and at night time, then you will have an even better experience. If travelling at night you will see all the building along the Creek illuminated and there are many evening Dhow dinner cruise boats on the Creek that are highly illuminated ........ great great fum. Please don't miss this, you won't be disappointed.
A Taxi Boat ride down memory lane . Ask them how much for a boat ride and they will take you down the creek. Make sure u have a camera. You get to see the old rulers house from the creekside

best commuter transport in town. by far the best and cheapest commuter transport system in town. Fun, authentic and very cheap 1 Dhrs per ride only!!!!
The fastest way to get from Deira to Bur Dubai!
Cross the river like a local. Hop on and off as you please for 1AED a trip. Worth a trip to take in the views and see life go by at the waterside.

A must visit in Dubai. Not only is it a cheap way to cross the river but brings back some nostalgic way in which original old Dubai must have been like. Only takes about 5 mins to cross and costs only 1 Dirham. One side is the spice market, the other is the Indian area. Both sides have market stalls and sellers. Definitely a must see and do !

Cheap and Best !!!. In olden days Dubai was a small village along the both sides of the Creek for a length of only about 3km, at that time Abra's was used to cross the Creek from Bur Dubai to Diera,which was very economical and very effective mode of transport, even now also Abra's are very effectively and costing only 1 dirhams.We went on 06th Feb 2016 and enjoyed a lot, took some lovely photos and videos to cherish.
Convenient and Cheap. I have used this mode to commute as it costs little as 1 dirham and is the fastest way to go from bur dubai to deira dubai and vice versa.

Old is gold!!!. An authentic olden days experience. You can get to the abra station in Bur Dubai and cross the creek in vintage style for 1AED per person in a boat. Of course, this is widely used by the locals for crossing the creek and they almost look bored at us tourists who make this a journey for tourism.. .nevertheless, the experience is fun and almost costs nothing. There is an U-shaped seating in the boat where you sit looking outwards and the guy who sails the boat sits in a pit in the center. This way you can watch the creek and enjoy the short ride.
authentic. We used this several times to get across the creek. It costs one dirham each to cross. It can get busy but it is authentic and all the locals use it.

Historic..... A must do in my view when one isnin Dubai... We took the Business bay Metro line from Jw Marriott Marquis Hotel to get to the Dubai Creek... We have to change line at the Burjuman station and took the red line metro and alight at Al Ras station to get to the Gold and spice souk...which is an attraction in itself before reaching the bur Dubai Abraham Dock.Costing only a measly one Dirham ... But a delightful ride .. Once across ,,, there is more for one to dine and explore as well as part of your planned trip...
amazing. Loved all the culture of the area. The boats filled with cargo going about their business. Lovely to walk along

Great way to experience old dubai. The Dubai creek is the heart of Dubai, where boats used to dock with shipments. It is close to the metro and the Dubai museum. Perfect day is to take the metro to Al Ghubaiba station, go to the Dubai Museum, they explore the textile souk. After you are finish go to the Abra dock and for 1dhs per person you get to go for a 10 minute ride across the creek to the Deira side. On the Deira side you can check on the spice souk and the gold souk. For dinner you can go on a dinner boat cruise for around 65-75 dhs at night. Tons of dinner boats are lined up along the creek you can just walk up to and make a reservation and buy a ticket.

Authentic Dubai experience. so cheap its unbelievable.you can ride to the spice souk the other side of the creek.They will also do a trip for half or a whole hour.you need to remember to bater the cost down if taking a long tour.
Boat ride. Just for two dirhams I could cross the creek on a boat. Great experience, the channel was very clean it was worth it. You can have a peep at the old Dubai and get back.

Reminiscence of old Dubai. Nice to see lot of old ships with tons of different stock weirdly loaded on them. Boat rides along for just one dirham is nice experience. The place has a nice atmosphere compare to new quarters of Dubai.
A must do whilst in Dubai. A great area to wander around, an Abra (water taxi) ride is very cheap hop on hop of 1aed a trip. Saunter around the souks, its a nice way to spend a morning or evening.

Quaint. We were at Mina Bazzar and wanted to go over the Creek to the Gold and Spice Souk. This is the quickest and rather quaint way to get there. 1 Dirham and easy on and off. Bit of a mad dash, but a great way to travel the creek.

Good Experience. This is a good experience for me in the city of Dubai with all the modern facilities and skyscrapers... very low cost 1-3 Dhirams per ride and you can cross the creek within 5-10mins...

The "Water Taxis". We visited the art exhibitors next to the Rulers Court and went to the Spice Souq witch is on the other side of the creek. The Abra Docks have the little boats that takes you from one end to the other for only 1aed pp. It's a nice little boat trip worth doing at least once.

One of the few remaining traditions of Dubai. Taking an abra trip is cheap, fun and can be enjoyed by everyone. As one of the few remaining traditional jobs in a bustling modern city, its something that should be on your 'must do' list while visiting Dubai.
A must do trip!. You must go across the creek by Abra during your Dubai visit. Rub shoulders with the locals on these small boats which criss cross the creek all day. Cost 1 dirham each way
Teriffic value trip. Great value (approx. 20p) trip across the creek in a traditional boat. Crosses over to Deira where you can visit the old souks. Fascinating to see the old part of the city
Water taxi. They are well worth it to get across from one to the other the old town with the suekes spice, gold and textiles worth a visit.
1 AED each crossing. Cost effective, quick and regular boat crossing at the creek very well used by locals. You can take a private tour from here too

A cheap way to get to the Textile Souk. Catching a local 'abra' across the creek was a great experience. The price is set at 1 dirham per passenger. Easiest way to get to the Textile (Old) souk and Dubai museum.
Good for short distance. we used Abra from going to Deira from Bur Dubai.its cheap mode of transport.but a fun. Not recommended during summer
Great experience. We done this as part of a City Tour and it was great fun. Easy way to appreciate the views ofDubai from the creek.

Dock to catch water taxis, well run, cheap & fun to do. This is the water front dock on the Creek to catch water taxis to Gold Souk and Old Souk, and further on to the Heritage Village. It is very cheap to use this transport and although basic is fascinating to travel along the Creek and watch the boats. Many of these boats carry goods onward to places like India, Iran and Pakistan. You can see them loading up both in daytime and in evening. The water taxis travel all year round, though less in the hot, summer months. I would thoroughly recommend this to do as a fun way to see part of the old Dubai.
Must take a ride!. A thrilling experience indeed. Hire your own yatch or simply take a ride for 1 dhiram. Great experience.

Cheapest form of transport in Dubai. Take the Abra across the Creek for 1 AED per person. However, you will get Abra drivers wanting to take you up the creek and back. Up to you if you fancy that, but it will cost you more than the 1 AED ferry crossing!

Small but exciting!. You can always expect a nice and smooth ride from Bur Dubai to Deira Dubai or vice versa from the Abra Dock. It costs you nothing, and has that little 5 mins of exciting journey on the Canal! But be weary of the summer season! Make sure you have enough shade!
Still only 1 Dirham!. Great to get the little boat from the Old Souk across the creek to the Gold Souk. So cheap! A pleasant trip.
Try the local water taxis. To see the old Bur Dubai go on one of the old water taxis across to the spice souk and the gold souk; an experience.

Economically the best. If you are staying in Bur Dubai and have to cross the Dubai creek to visit the various market's or souks (gold souk, spice souk etc.) in Deira, the boat which is popularly called the 'Abra' is the fastest and most economical option with rates as low as 1 diram to cross over.
a nice time out. visit to the spice market & the gold market is a must, it says a lot about the culture of the people.
very good place... we went here around 4 pm.i think this is the best time to go...it take to memories of ancient Arabs..enjoy the ride in abra...
Greta way to see Dubai creek life. At such a cheap price to cross the creek in Dubai you would be foolish not to do this. Can get busy so suggest you do it earlier in the morning.

fun trips. This part of Dubai is simply amazing, we used the boats to get back and forth form the old souk to the naïf souk. and it was so much fun. I highly recommend this to travellers who want to go back and forth the cheap way, once on the other side , the old souk is fun to shop, however one must bargain. You will be amazed how much cheaper you will get your stuff for.

Best Deal in Dubai. Most things in Dubai are expensive (Think 270 AED for a photoshopped picture of you or your family). At 1 AED for a creek crossing, this is hard to beat. This is about as close to the creek water that you can get and still not get wet!!!
Fun. It was a fun way to cross the river, its easy just hand over the money and grab a sit - its quiet a smooth ride so there's no need to worry.

Nice way to see real Dubai. The Abra ride was cheap and a fast way to cross the creek. It felt safe, and even children were not scared. Atmosphere in the boat was cheerful! I recommend this if you are visiting Dubai.
Cheap way to cross the creek. It only costs 1 aed to cross the creek , it seems a quite popular way of getting to bur Dubai as it was busy when we used it . The creek is very busy,

A must do while in Dubai. A trip on the old Abra from one Souk to the other is a must do in Dubai,
Its only a short journey but the best way to travel between the two Souks and a bargain price of 1 AED

Adventure!. When I first seen the abra, I could not believe it is allowed as a mean of transportation. No rails at all, people just jump and seat on a center bench. Safety seems not to be a concern. However, we crossed the creek twice and everything was ok.
must go. everytime I m in Dubai I go to abra. aspecialy at night is fantastic idea.i always get one abra for my self is cost20dhirams and u don't need to share with anyone.
Fast and cheap. I advise you use this to cross from Gold Soul to But Dubai. It costs 1dhs. Instead of being caught up in traffic just go use the Abra. Its well organised and safe.

Different perspective of Dubai. The abra dock is near the souks in Old Dubai. From here you are able to take an abra for 1 dirham across the water. This is also the water taxi, and you experience a ride with the locals (not only tourists). Going across the water in the agra you feel like you are part of the culture, mixing with locals, viewing the old structures and witnessing the hustle and bustle of the ships bringing in merchandise from other Emirates. While you are here, have a cup of coffee in any one of the local businesses and sit back and witness Old Dubai and its center of commerce for the area.

evening spend in a cruise. The evening spent on the cruise along the creek, would be the best to calm down the stress and relax your mind. The boat operators usually take you to a stunning spot, to enjoy a contrast between Deira and Bur Dubai, with one side boasting the modern side of Dubai, while the other end preserves the calmness of Arab land.

The Other Side to Dubai. If you want to immerse yourself in authenticity, culture and rough beauty venture down to Old Dubai. Ride an Abra (as public transport or hire one for yourself). Lose yourself in the markets, inhale the scents and spices. Thoroughly enjoyable experience if you are prepared to be open minded.

Old and Vintage. Once in Dubai, don't forget to visit the old Dubai. and the transformation that has happened. ITs only here one can see the real transformation from old to the massive, gigantic tall building which is apt, all that glitters is gold.
Good experience !!!!. You will love the area and especially you get to cross the creek in a boat (which is useful for locals as well as tourists) in a dirt cheap price.. only one dhiram ...

An experience to enjoy. This is a part of Old Dubai and fun to use the Abra boat service.
At a cost of 1 dirham per trip this is a bargain.
Boats are frequent and the joorney across the creek only takes a few minutes.

Ask where it goes. Very old wooden boats, smell or mazout, not sure there are enough life jackets for everybody, but we crossed the Creek safely. Pleasant. Ask where the boat is going. I wrongly assumed the one we boarded was going to the docks directly in front of us on the other shore. We landed 800m from where we wanted to go. Cost is 1 dirham.
Old Dubi. Bur Dubai maintained it's integrality of what Dubia was before modern Dubai, a must experience. One of least expensive way we travelled in Dubai.

Lots of barely lit boats. Basic to the extreme and usually loaded with workers. These boats are barely lit at night an, with all the other Creek traffic, are an accident waiting to happen. The dock itself is also very basic.

Great Way of Getting Across the Creek. The habras are very old but provide a very cheap (14p) way of crossing the creek and offer great views of the Bur Dubai area from the water. If travelling to the Gold or Spice Souks you can save a lot of time and money by using these instead of having a taxi take you all around which would add at least 5 - 10km onto your journey

Fun change of pace in Dubai. Taking an Abra across the creek is a nice change of pace from the high end glitzy elements of Dubai. It's nice to have a more down to earth and simple experience and stroll around the small streets and little shops outside and away from the mega malls.
Old Dubai. It is an experience to ride on the abra. It feels as if you are taken back in history to the start of Dubai. Done this the first time in 2004 and nothing has changed.
The good old days of Dubai!. I remember my dad use to bring me here in the late 80's and after all that has changed in Dubai over the years this still remains the same! Something that must be seen!

Water Taxi Station. To explore Dubai, Try on Abra Water Taxi, to cross by traditional way from Bur Dubai to Deira Dubai both ways. Wonderful experience along with the Dhow Wharfage, yu can witness trading in Dubai for many years experience.
Nice little ride. Sure the boats look sketchy but it's a fun little boat ride. Only 1 dirham per person to cross the creek to the gold and spice souk side. Had a good time and the drivers were nice

Quick and efficient. Very cheap way of getting from the gold souk to the spice souk. Gives you a great alternative view of bird Dubai. Different abras go to different parts of the creek so make sure it's going to where you want.
Old dubai. Its old dubai, named bur dubai, here u can visit on a small boat tour and its also a nice experience and ecnomical also

Night shopping at the Souks. Very casual yet nice experience to ride those small boats for 1 dirhams (30 cents) and cross over from one side of the creek to the other on a round trip, where the Souks and the start of bargains with retailers. was a bit chaotic for a first timer, but then noticed it was well planned and safe. One issue was finding a parking space for our car just nearby the dock, so we had to wait for someone to be leaving. when parked, it is just few minutes walk from the dock. Nice to try once

Charm and extreme of old Dubai. I regularly visit myself and bring friends to this place, as it is a great start when exploring the old part of Dubai. Despite me panicking a little every time when I board that old piece of food that floats somehow, I would not change them at all.
A different joy. it was a different joy to pass through the canal. it is cheap and also good, A different type of joy to do that
Memorable. Used water taxi to get to the Gold souks. It was a trip to to ;real dubai' Lots of hawkers and a different shopping experience
Water Taxi. This was so nice. We took a water taxi from one side to another. It was such a nice ride with nice scenery. There is a souk there as well. Great stop in Dubai.

Only thing cheap left in Dubai. For 1 aed you can cross over from the dock to the textile souk and come back. Very near to AL ras metro station. You can combine the visit to gold souk and the other souks along with this. We were a little early at around 3 pm and most of the shops for closed. Best time to visit will be after 5 pm.

Very exited!. If you want to see how Dubai was looks from very beginning - you have to go to this place! Its definitely different picture from which I use to see! Amazing place and I really recommend to go there!!
Nice. Another face of Dubai. The history lovers will appreciate it. After all the skyscrapers it's like a different world! A must see! But be prepared that it is not as clean as the rest of the city!
1 AED for a traditional crossing. This hasn`t changed in a houndred years. Cross the water to the other side in a few minutes. A contrast in a otherwise surreal city.

It's fun, it's cheap, totally recommended. This is a must do for every tourist in Dubai. It only cost you 1 Dirham (no ticket required, just pay the boat man) to cross the water and it's fun to ride an abra. The system is very efficient too. Be careful with small children.
Old fashioned hustle. Crowdy, fast moving, cheap and old fashioned way to cross the river between souks. A must do in modern Dubai but don't expect something marvellous.

A must see attraction. I was fascinated by abra's. Amazing and cheap means of transportation. You get to see both sides of the creek. You can understand how the old and new dubai are intertwined. Traveling with the locals is amazing if you speak a bit of arabic or urdu.Abra's are cheap and fun. You can sit back, relax and enjoy the show going on both coasts.

Great way to travel across the creek!. This is such a fast and cheap way to cross the creek. At only 1 dirham per trip it's a bargain. You also get a great view of both sides of the creek. Great experience of the older part of dubai.
Beautiful Ride. Riding the Abra is a must try when you were in Dubai...Its exciting and the view from Bur Dubai Dock to Deira was beautiful.
Old Dubai feel. 1 Dihram ride from one side to another. We boated from Dubai Museum side to Gold souk. Kids enjoyed the ride.

Wow....Its a marvel. This dock is an absolute marvel. It takes you back to an era which you have read or seen in childrens story book.... Its really great. You can take the 1 Dhiram abra (boat) to go across and come back. You can take the abra from here to the old spice souq, and come back here.Here, you can sit back and relax. Get an amazing view of the dock yard. The RTA cruise also goes from here only. There is also a side walk, where there are a variety of restaurants, including Veg options and Indian restaurants too. There are also some shops behind, which gives you good chocolates, dry fruits etc at cheap rates. Best place to shop at good bargains.

Go back in time. It's not too easy to experience a historic ethnic experience in super new flashy Dubai and this is one of the few. You cross the creek to go to the traditional souks for only one AED for a seven minute fun ride with 20 other souls and it's also a lovely trip to literally go up the creek by hiring your own abra at a good value 120 AED for a perfect one hour trip

Wonderful experience. For only 1 AED you can cross Dubai Creek by abras. Abras are small motorised water taxis that can hold twenty people.You can travelling from/to Deira to/from Bur Dubai.There are around 150 boats and the trip time is 5-7 min.You will pay to the abra driver.

Cheapest Attraction in Dubai. This is one of the best parts of Dubai, is to get onto a local Abra which takes you across the Creek to the Spice and the Gold Souk. This is probably the cheapest part of Dubai, it only costs 1Dirham. The ride is enjoyable as you have views of the old city and buildings and some of the old house boats.
Cute & Short Ride but saves on time. Cute & Short Ride but saves on time from Gold Souk to Meena Bazaar. Must njoy great food AT mEENA bAZAAR
Easy way to commute. Great way to commute within the beach resort. The abra drivers sometimes served as tour guides, telling stories about buildings along the resort and their significance.

Travel by Dhow or Abra across Dubai Creek. Wonderful experience seeing all the boats and ships and traveling to the souks on the other side of the "creek" which is really a river. Historically the Dhow Wharfage is where all the boats come in from Iran, Oma, Saudi Arabia and many other neighboring countries to trade and sell their goods. It is a wonderful view of Dubai away from all the modern sights to give you a feel of the way it used to be.
Terrible!. A cheap way of crossing the creek but quite nerve racking. There are so many Abras and dhoe boats travelling down the creek they are dodging each other and the water can get quite choppy.

Friendly atmosphere and great value. A trip across the river is a great way to sample the atmosphere of Dubai and enjoy the older parts of this lovely city. A little but awkward to find but well worth it and costs next to nothing.
a cheap way to experience a boat ride. crossing the creek using this traditional abra was a good way since it was cheap at only 1 dirham per person. about 10 mins ride to cross on the other side.

Great to visit for the history of Dubai. A great location to get a flavour of old Dubai. The old Fort of Dubai gives an excellent history of the city and the UAE alike. The attraction is very low cost and is popular with visiting tourists from cruise ships that dock.
1 Dirham delight. The dhows (little motor boats) take about 20 passengers at a time from the gold and spice souk area (old Dubai) across the river to the "new Dubai" at 1 dirham per passenger.

must do. Brilliant and atmospheric. Great atmospeheric place. A very scenic and colourful way to cross over from the al fahidi area or bur dubai souk into the deira souk area. from a tourist perspective, a must do! do not miss! and only 1 dirham per person
Good. This is the best and ride to the other side by the boat.They are crowded but fun.This ride is very cheap. They have regular frequent dhow trips.

Authentic side of Dubai. A quick trip across the creek on one of these boats is well worth the effort. They are cheap, noisy, smelly and show you an authentic side of Dubai you don't see in your high rise hotel.

Cheapest way to 'cruise around' in Dubai. For only 1 dhs (about 0.25€/person) you can have very unique experience riding Abra across Dubai Creek with these old boats. They take up to 20 people sitting on top of them and they seem to leave the dock when there is enough people sitting in the boat. You pay to driver in cash so it is good to have 1dh coins with you when sitting on the boat.After tiring walk in Souks it was nice to sit down in one of the Abras and watch the creek. It was nice to just ride the boats for being able to sit for second. We went back and forth few times just for fun of it.
go for abra rides. great for catching the famous abra rides which still charge only 1 dhs. this is the old Dubai charm at its best!!

Fun ride. Last week I went to Deira with my family (2 sons 8 n 2 years). The weather was fabulous like indian rainy days. I took kids to Abra. It was fun ride and we all enjoyed a lot. They charge only AED 1 per person. Only problem was little smell of fuel smoke.

Great idea to unwind . This is what we are doing if we were bored in our place where we stayed. Better to roam around at the creek area and drove a cheaper abra⛵️(boat),you can cross the creek to Deira from Burjuman or Rent and tour you around to the Mactum bridge and coming back.

Interesting Place to Visit. A traditional area of old Dubai that has supplied Dubai by sea throughout history. Now you see the wharf lined with electronic goods & hundreds of boxed fridges & aircon units
Board your Abra here. It's straightforward and organized to purchase a ticket and climb aboard for the 5 minute sail across the Creek. Keep your camera handy.
1AED. Is a must do it, for 1 AED, you will being tranferred to the other Side of the Creek by a very old boat (Ferry). It' special
Old Dubai. This is the place to be to see old Dubai. A trip across the creek in an Abra will only cost you 2 Dirhams return. Such a bargain!

Old world Charm in modern Dubai. Abra is the arabic name given to the local ferries carrying people across the creek.Its amazing that in Dubai which is one city with the latest modern technology they co exist peacefully.This dock has got ferries for all locations.Something like a bus station.These open air boats carry you across for the unbelievable price of 1 dirham.Its a must do

Old style atmosphere and interresting people. Loved strolling thru the spice market and the adjoining boat harbor ..lots of old style packing and wonderful wooden boats the smells are amazing.........loved it

Take a trip the old fashioned way and see DXB from a different point of view.. The boats look rickety but are extremely safe and the operators are very polite. The experience is amazing and it's budget friendly too

Cheap way to cross the creek and next to textile souk. We went to the old textile souk and found this abra dock unexpectedly. The little wooden boats charge 1 AED per person to cross to Deira where there is the Gold and Spice Souk. The abra dock is very busy but pretty as well. It has a few samosay pakoray shops nearby and you can eat the hot treats while sitting near the creek. There are a lot of souvenir shops and you can bargain as much as you like.
Old Dubai. It was nice to take an abra (small boat) across the dock to the other side. It was an old Dubai experience.

Fascinating and busy. Take a wander around this busy dock and just be amazed at the frantic comings and goings. Always something going on and to see. Don't forget your camera.Avoid windy days if you want to take a trip!
Worth a ride. Takes you from one side of the dock to another a sort of locals bus, very cheap and gives you a small in site into there life style.
Interesting experience. This was an interesting experience, and a very cheep way to cross the creek. The rides are very cheap and you get to experience how locals travel (used to travel) :)

Nice view from the water!. For a very small amount of money you can have a different view of Dubai, specially an oportunity to imagine how it was in the past. This attraction is located in the old part of the city, sorrounded by original antique houses and beautiful markets, close to the gold suck.
it was a nice feeling. abra dock is a simple travel method that reminds you how waterways can be used efficiently in the jet speed age . nice and pleasant on hot afternoon
Fast and efficient. We took this service every day to cross over to Deirah and it was always quick and easy. Available throught the day. very cheap mode of transport

Good value. Nice boat trip for next to nothing. Lasts about 20 minutes. We just did a round trip at night and came back. Make sure you have all your phones etc. packed tightly in your pocket. I was so scared of losing something.
Love going on abras. Been going to Dubai for years to visit family and one of the highlights is the abras going to the souks ,great atmosphere and love all the bartering,great deals to be had

Short cut to both the Dubai. Just a penny to cross one Dubai to the other Dubai. and few minutes to receive the breeze while crossing by the small sailing boat. but fast enough to reach the other side.

Cheap romance. This was the romantic highlight of our trip. We had been at the gold souk which by the way is not cheap and we decided to go across to the otherside in search of more affordable items. These little boats are not comfortable, have no airconditioning, smell of oil and fuel but are so awesome.After the seeing all the crazy, expensive and beautiful buildings our ride across the waterway brought us back to earth in a hot but amazing way. Our captain was not a very smiley character but what do you expect when he has to deal with the heat of the day and the heat of his boat, but he was an excellent driver and got us to our "port" in no time. I really recommend going on one of these. You just get the view of peoples real lives which are hard and colourful. Always good to mix the old with the new.

Cheap means of transport with excellent facility!. You can use this means of transport if you wish to visit the gold/spice souk from Bur Dubai. It is offered at a very low price of just 1 dhiram and is worth visiting.
Good evening outing. Places is nice & breezy, good for a short evening outing , has a few food joints, Fahidi Souq close by, fun place ad ofcourse the waters :)

The cheepest public transport. Choose this possibility to cross the Creek with some local or indian/pakintan people for only one AED. The aproach of the dock is very simple. Be prudent, there are water taxi too with other expensive tarif. Don't worry to walk here and be a passenger as a local man or woman.

Short cheap authentic water taxi ride. Without a doubt the most enjoyable and traditional way to cross the Creek, between The gold and spice souks, and the textile souk, is in the abras. They take about 20 people, and seem to ferry locals and tourists across all the time. Great experience, good photo opportunity and only 1 Dirham! If you want a longer trip, there are abra trips that go further up the Creek, some with meals, which can be booked for more. You don't need to book a tour to enjoy this area, you can just walk around and enjoy the feel of Old Dubai. This is the only traditional area left.

real dubai. to escape the traffic with a taxi for gold souk and spice souk, get those abra from behind dubai museum, you will cross the creek for AED 1 only per person, you will be seating with local people, indian.its an experience to do, far from the luxury of dubai

Fantastic Ride. Beatiful ride for crossing creek Burdubai to Deira Dubai and vice versa
Not only easy mode of transport but beatiful journet in short time and also cheep(1 Dirham only).
Not only elders but children will enjoy nicely for any number of times.
Thanks to RTA(transport authority for memorable journey)
An experience of Old Dubai.. Earlier,The Abra's were used to transport people from one end of river bank to other.It now serves as a tourist attraction.The ride cost only 1 AED per person.

Best Dirham You Will Spend. After visiting the gold and spice souks, we took the Abra across to check out the textile souk. I only wish the ride was longer. For a dirham, they will take you across the water. Go enjoy a meal or hookah along the creek or opt for a longer boat ride. Either way, you want to check out this experience.

Just for 1 AED. I still enjoy the Abra water ride whenever I visit Bur Dubai. It reminds me that I can enjoy even with 1 Dirham in my pocket :)
Its very nice and will make you happy with the pleasant short ride.
Try this out. For the ease of getting across the creek, you will visit this strange method of getting around there.

The Real Thing. Paid for a boat and driver for half an hour and motored up the river looking at all the buildings. These 'abras' are how the real workers that make Dubai Hum cross the river to go to work and back. Lots of room and probably hasn't changed in years. Authentic.
Authentic trip ! . We have taken the boat for Aed1 per person, amazing tour with rustic boat. A safe tour with authentic feeling and view. Can highly recommend during afternoon / eve.
Only way to go Souk Hopping!. The most lively place to visit the Spice, Gold and Textile Souks on Dubai Creek. Very cheap taxi service, the Abra! Better than a Roller Coaster.
share water boat. the little boat can carry 20 members from one side of bur dubai to other side gold souq. this is cost effective water transport. the charge is 1 dirham(18 rupees nearly)

sailing in a traditional Arab Dhow. If you want to experience anything of cultural and/or historical value you have to visit the old city of Dubai - not the new metropolis. Our Big Bus ticket came with a free Dhow "ride", essentially a water taxi that would take us from one side of the creek (khor) to the other at the cost of AED1 (one Dirham). When we arrived at the creek - there were more options. We opted for a 45 minute sail along the creek at a cost of AED 60 per person. It was idyllic. We sailed along with a soft breeze and occasional sea spray in our faces. Beautiful views, sunny blue sky, calm and serene environment. The only sounds were the Dhow motor and some seagulls above. Bliss!
1 dirham!. Very much worth the ride. For just 1 dirham , you get to see alot of the creek without paying for a cruise.
Authentic Arabia. If you are in Dubai, you think that you are in new york but you can understand where you are if you see Bur Dubai side.
Travel like a local. This is a must to experience local transportation! We went with a tour guide who helped us understand more of the culture.

Great experience!. We got on an abra for an hour and paid 160 Dirhams. The driver was very friendly and told us about the buildings we went past. The boat was noisy but that's just because the engine was right underneath you. It was a bit of fun and would recommend. Lots of commenters use an abra.

Great way to experience old fashioned travel. We took the Abra to get to the gold and spice souk which is on the other side of the creek. It costs just 1 dhm and is a very fun, comfortable way to travel, and you get to experience everyday Dubai all around you. Wonderful ride!

Old fashioned travel. It costs 1 Dirham each way to cross the creek - such a relaxing and easy way to cross over. The water way is packed and full of noise and colour a great way to see every day Dubai

Very authentic. Took this to get across the creek so that my wife could do more damage to my wallet. It's just 1AED. And ard 20 ppl can take the Abraa at one time. There's no safety barriers of any sort ard it...so parents please hold on to your children.
a great watertaxi. In a few minutes you cross the Dubai Creek. Very easy. You can take this abra from the entrance of the spicesouk at Deira. It's very cheap. We even cross the river with a buggy.
enjoy Local boat travel. Hi come dubai and enjoy local travel . view of old dubai . in 1 dhm you can travel in old boats .enjoy rides
Mrs Eriksson, Ödeshög, Sweden. Went by the Abra boats across the creek to see the Gold souk and the Spice souk. Old charmy boats, only one Dirham cost and you pay to the boat driver.
Just a little fun. Good to see that modern Dubai has continued such old traditional ferry service at token rate!! Nice work of administration.
Really fun!. This is a fun experience if you wanna see the old parts of Dubai! I wouldn't recommend it if you don't like being accompanied by tourists only.

Cheap. Cheap only 1aed from but dubAi to Debra however boats are old and the smell is disgusting would recommend to travel only once as an experience but not used as a means of transport to and from deira
Good Journey. Bur Dubai Abra dosk is a good place. You can travel and enjoy this place. Good and clean place. Need to experience this place

brilliant. this was the funniest thing during our visit,we had searched for this place for days,we had got advice from anybody who would listen, must say, the most kind people we ever met,anyway,we eventually found it,at once my wife said,I am not getting on that,after about 2 hours,she said okay,the cost about so low,less than a us dollar for 2,it was so enjoyable,as soon as we got off,the wife wanted to get back on,at all the time we were there,the boats were packed,while we were there we met a group of people from the usa,who also had a great time,we had a great laugh and they told us all about their state Colarado great place this Dubai for meeting people

Old Creaky Boats!. Call this "heritage"," old world charm", but its just how the emiratis crosses the creek in dark ages!!Just board the Abra for a 5mins crossing from Bur Dubai to Deira.Avoidable, if you are not so hard pressed on the word "old world charm".

There IS something cheap in Dubai. This is the best way to get to and fro across Dubai Creek and at just 1 Dirham its about the cheapest thing there i. Good fun, frequent and practical. Not the best if you are unsteady on your feet. Very little concession the Health and Safety, and that's just fine.

Great fun - cross the Dubai Creek just like the locals.. There is a multitude of traditional, rickety, diesel powered craft that ferry people across the Dubai Creek. You are well advised to keep your balance as you board these craft and then sit down all around the raised platform on the boat amongst the locals, who in my experience seem to be mainly of Indian sub continental descent. I paid 1 AED for the crossing. I sat near the "driver" who stood in a well in the centre of the boat and who controlled the engine with his bare feet. I wondered how much he could really see to navigate through all the similar boats criss crossing the river from all directions. But we made it.On getting off I narrowly avoided making a real fool of myself and falling into the water. These craft are pretty unstable so ride them at your own risk. This form of transport is a lifetime away from the ultra modern Metro, Tram and morotways of Dubai. And I'm grateful for that.

Step back into the past... In a good way.. A trip to Dubai isn't complete without taking the Abra across from Bur Dubai to Deira.The constant service costing AED1 - about 15p - takes about 10 minutes and is a wonderful way to see what Dubai looked like before the myriad of skyscrapers.On the Bur Dubai side there are many small souk like areas selling just about whatever you'd like to buy. On the Deira side there is the Spice Souk and the Old Gold Souk.As for the Abras they are great fun and well managed.If you are feeling more adventurous, for AED120 (about 120GBP) you can hire an Abra for an hour for a group of up to 20 people (the cost is for the boat not per head) to travel all the way up the creek past the Sheikh's palace and to where the many trading dhows from India, Pakistan and Iran are berthed and offloaded.

worth a travel once.. This ten mins travel with abra between diera and bur dubai is really a worth and that to at the price what it takes. I respect dubai government to retain this service even in todays scenario where they have metros and camries running as taxi. It indicates the simplicity with which they live. HATS OFF...

Traditional Arab Experience. If you want to escape from the hustle and bustle of metro, bus and taxi and experience the traditional Arab mode of transport at a very cheap cost, I would suggest you to travel from Bur Dubai to Deira and vice versa via the abra.

Fastest transport mode from side to side. When traffic is a challenge and always is, what better way to travel from Bur Dubai to Deira than to hop on a water taxi across the Dubai creek. Brilliant setup, it has evolved over the years, and continues to be a very usedful mode of transportation. Imagine it being a part of life of thousands for years.
River crossing. Excellent way to cross the river about 10p in uk money You can hire your own one out for a trip if you want.
What a ride. This is a must, it is a fast way to cross the creek and quit enjoyable. It can be a little un-nerving at first as you don't feel safe, however that soon passes.
Dubai fun . Really very good. Travelling on boat. They charge u 1 dhiram per person. Little bit like Venice kind. Loved the scenic beauty. A must visit via boat ride.
Fun. Very traditional and Its the cheapest boat ride i ever had, only one dirham. It was fun. Must cross the creek on abra.

The Old World Feel. OK, I mentioned this when I spoke of Dubai transportation too. This is a great trip across Dubai Creek to get the feel of how its been done for decades...before the boom times. Careful not to take pictures of native people as its considered invasive of privacy. The Dock takes you right into the heart of the Dhows that drop off goods from India, Pakistan, Iran and beyond.

Nice river bus. These are river busses that are organised very well. If you are travelling with kids please be careful, there are no barriers around these boats. You can easily cross the river by taxi which is cheap but this is the quickest way to cross this river.

This is actually Dubai 40 years ago. This is exactly where everything started, boats trading with Iran and other countries were docked here, you can get feeling how it was done years back and have a feeling of old trade routes.

Quick and nice journey. This is a nice and quick journey. Keep your hands tight, you are just an inch from water :) It is not luxury, but a great experience in Dubai amonst luxury everywhere. Touch of old dubai.

Taking an abra across the creek. I have taken a ride across Dubai creek several times on my holidays there, it is a wonderful experience to putter across the water in these wooden boats to Deira and take in the magnificent views with the smell of engine oil making it feel so authentic and slightly vintage. I have watched the sunset once on my return and it was so picturesque. I thoroughly recommend everyone to do this at least once.

the way dubai was. for 1 dirham (usd 25 cents!) you can cross from bur dubai to deira(or back) and by crossing the creek you see what was the lifeblook and economic foundation of dubai before the recent explosive growth.
Back after 35 years.. A brief visit but not surprising was rather busy with tourists. In both Souks there was not too much pressure although gold souk not as good value. More tourist driven.

Scary for me!!. My daughter and I tried the crossing from bur dubai to Deira on this dingy boats.. I'm scared of water but my daughter loved it .. it was very quick I think less than a minute and cost little or nothing.. much cheaper than taxis

Travel to another time. 1 Dihram is all that is required to travel an Abra and it takes you to the old parts of Dubai where you get to see all the souks ( Gold , Spice and Perfume ) small eateries provide with delicious food .Meena Bazar is also a good place if you are looking to buy souvenirs on economy ..

Old Dubai in One Dirham. You pay just one dirham to have a ride from the docks to various stations, Best time to visit gold souk, textile souk and other old dubai places and then have a travel on this water.

Dirt cheap thrill in an expensive city. Took the abra to cross the Dubai Creek from Bur Dubai to Deira, and back. It's quite fun, efficient, and super cheap (1 dirham = $.30US!). Can't find much as cheap in this expensive city!
good transport. very cheap and nice transport burdubai to deira very convince and time safe it will take only five minutes only u can travel by bus it will take more than 30minutes
Cheap. these little boat are just quick ways to get across the river there 20p good to do just for the experience old school style.
nice safe area. No crime around,clean and interesting. Cheap ride across the creek which is the real heart of dubai.

Great value!. This is the cheapest and easiest way to get across the creek. It only cost 1 UAE! Short ride, but with great views. This ferry will take you directly to the gold and spic souk from across the creek.

This is how the locals cross the creek. This is located just 5 mins from the Al Ghubiba Ferry station. Abras are small boats used to cross the creek and they charge only 1 Dirham. This is how the locals travel. If you wanna get a taste of real Dubai just cross the creek from Ghubiba to Gold Souk.
Must visit . This is a must visit for anyone visiting Dubai. It's a real insight into the real Dubai beyond all the shiny buildings and malls. One of my highlights of my numerous trips to Dubai

Cheap Ride. For only one AED you can take a ride across the creek to the spice and gold souk. Its and adventure for most tourist to wants to ride the Dhow for a quick meal and shopping on the other side.
cheap ride. excellent for someone wanting to cross the river over to deira..very reasonably priced and quick. would recommend this to anyone over taking a car. boats are quiet old though..
Beautiful. Very easy short 1AED ride across the creek. Nice water views, good close up of passing boats. Not much to say about it, with saying for 1AED well worth it.

Cheap and great way to cross and have a look at the Creek. There are many abras so I assume you never have to way long to cross the Creek this way. It's not expensive and during the crossover you have great views of both shores.
Best way to cross the river and reach the souk. 1 Dirham a ride and the best frequency possible. A cheap, traditional and convenient way to cross the waters. Must try

Great atmosphere a world away fro high rise Dubai. Get an abra across the creek, nice little ride, only 1 aed and the souks on the other side are nice to wander round as long as you are good at saying no, or haggling!,

Good old world commuting. Why cab it when you can abra it. That is the reasoning behind taking the abra to explore the old town of Dubai. Locals of course use abra to run errands, it is cheap, and there would never be a traffic incident that can hold up for hours (read every day peak hour Dubai commute). Most importantly the short ride gives you a taste of the earliest explorers who used the boat to uncover new territories, you become one of them, when you abra it.

For only AED1 5. Very easy short 1AED ride across the creek. Nice water views, good close up of passing boats.
Not much to say about it, with saying for 1AED well worth it.

Beautiful Ride from Diera side to Bur station of water taxi and back. Really unbelievable , very cheap and comfortable ride for just one AED per person , in minutes you touch Bank of Baroda side , do shopping and eat fast food etc and you are back , excellent service , no waiting time.

Take a Sail Down Dubai's Memory Lane. There is very little that is "old" in Dubai, but the dhows and abras which ply the waters in The Creek are one of them. Taking an abra from one side of the creek to the other is still in demand...by usually working men and an occasional tourist for about one dirham (30 cents). If you really want to have an experience, rent an abra exclusively for an hour with the driver taking you up and down the Dubai creek. The mixture of new building and construction along with hundreds of old dhows in various sizes and condition, are a sight to behold.

Take me to the spice souk!. Catch the abra here to take you accross to the old spice souk which will take you back in time to what Dubai was like before the tourists came! Ignore the hawkers tryng to flog fake bags and watches and just soak up the atmosphere.
Abra trip. Had to use the Abra again just for the opportunity to travel across the Creek to visit the Other bank. Good experience.
Very Nice. This is a very nice experience. Its a short boat ride which takes you to the gold and spice souk. Very nice for taking pictures.
Abra Taxi. Abra taxi is a mode of transport to cross the creek, they are very cheap and fast to cross the creek, don't know how the story of name Abra.

Amazing Atmosphere. The old town is the complete opposite to the high life of Dubai, it is more like Bangladesh (home) as the atmosphere is completly different, there is markets around were you can pick up cheap gems and can also haggle prices down! ;)The Abra ride is certainly one i will remember and for only 1 dirham a ride it's unbelievably good value!!
worst place on earth. the full area stinks like rotten fish, not worth the visit, please avoid the waste of time, improvement needed in most areas
a bit of authenticity. Do take an abra from deira old souk to Bur dubai. It's very cheap and the ride quite short but it gives you a sense of authenticity that dubai lacks in general.
abra ride across the creek to get from gold and spice souk to textile souk. 2 dhm each. it was well organised with someone directing you to an abra. 10 minute journey. try and sit on the shady side

An excellent step into the local life. For just 1 dirham, you can take a step into the local Emirati life where life is easy-going and full of vibrance. The trip is quite short and you end up near the gold and spice souks. It also gets filled easily so no fear of waiting for a long time before hopping on one. Not very much safe for small children though as it doesn't have any safety bars. You also get to see the several traditional boats called dhows that still have some people living in them.
Surprisingly easy to navigate.. The abras may look a little dodgy but they really are a wonderful way to get on the water and see a totally different side to Dubai.
Bur Dubai Abra Dock. Bur Dubai Abra Dock manual boating experience with seating next to water is amazing specially in the evening.

A lovely journey, which the locals use daily.... A nice boat ride across the river to and from the Gold Souk. Only 1 Dhiram each way per person.It is an open boat, just like you see in the picture. No life jacketsare worn by anyone, this a daily commute for 1000s of local people per day!!

You must take an Abra ride when you visit Dubai. The Abra ride to the opposite side of the creek costs 1 Dirham and you pay on the boat. Each boat takes about 20 people across the Creek seated on wooden benches. The boat departs when it is full, which is every couple on minutes. The breeze on the Abra crossing is most welcome on a hot and humid day. There are two different Abra destinations from Bur Dubai dock so check which destination you want to visit before boarding the Abra.

fantastic way to cross over the creek from Burdubai to Deira. Great way to cross over fro Burdubai to Deira either way with a few dirhams ..The abra is close to Gold souks on the Deira side and the Al Fahidi fort on the Burdubai side ..Its breezy but could be unbearable during summer months ..i winter months its great to avoid expensive taxi rides ...

Abra trip over to Creek 1 Dirham.. The shops etc were plentiful. I would advise to know what you want to buy before going. Many vendors wanting you buy their watches etc. I would prefer to buy from a shop offering warranty etc.
A eye opener. Becareful when the hit the docks as nd we hen you b osrd or exit the boats lol was fun looking a t a ll the old style buildings had great time
It's the same like Dubai Creek . There are no difference between them. You take the boat from one to the other. But as i reviewed the creek it is a must

great experience. A busy working dock, cheap travel over the water between the souks.
You really experience the true hustle and bustle - great fun.
Why not?. In a city short on history, this is probably the most authentic thing here. It costs a tiny amount, is great fun, fantastic view. I thoroughly recommend.

But Dubai Abra Dock. We took a taxi from our hotel and he dropped us right at the dock. You just get on the boat and after it is filled you give the driver 1d and off you go to the other side. There are no tickets to buy. It's the same going back. Talk about cheap and memorable! On the short trip, 5 minutes maybe, you see other old boats and hear and smell the parts of the old city. It brings you to the spice and gold souks. The venders seem to sell the same things, definitely worth it. Just find a vendor and haggle a bit. We crossed back went to the XVA Hotel Cafe after for lunch.

What an adventure in $1. you are thrilled to ride this boat type thing with no bars around you and the asian drivers yelling and fighting among themselves and manovering the Abra from one point to another. We enjoyed it so much we took multiple rides for the sake of fun. Its truly enjoyable.

Convenient water taxi. Something which I would expect to be for the tourists seems to still by used by many locals. Boats seat 20 people and leave when full. 1AED each I think. We didn't wait long got a full compliment and were soon chugging along the creek to the spice souk. Not really a must do, but a great way to cross the creek of you need to.You can hire the whole boat for a tour if you wish

A must visit. If you are a tourist reading this the Abra station is a must see, especially if you are a keen photographer. There is just so must to see and take in. The atmosphere is amazing and people are still using the Abras as a way of getting to and from home/work so there is a real authentic feel. Take the trip and enjoy the dhows on the other side of the creek (Diera side) a good budget afternoon, no need for a tour just take a taxi to the Abra station around 3 pm and the Diera side will start coming to life around 4 pm. Please bear in mind that most of the Diera side closes for the afternoon so from 1 pm onwards it's best to wait until 3 or 4 pm. Once over the other side of the creek I'd highly recommend a dhow trip from one of the operators.

Cheap treats in Dubai. Want to feel the pulse of Dubai..recommend a walk here and then a ride across the creek to deira side on the abra (small boat crossing). Walk around the other side and then find just off Nasser square two shops that make shawarmah.( if I recall well one restaurant is Shiraz and the other in Hatam -both are just behind the aero soft showroom near Deira creek side ).Return back to start but this time take the water taxi.Cheapest fastest mode of transport and great healthy cheap but yumm food too.

Really Worthwhile. Before travelling to Dubai I read a recommendation about taking a ride on an Abra boat. These small boats look quite unstable but they are not. They offer a lovely, calm way of travelling across Dubai Creek with the cooling breeze in your hair. We paid 1 Dirham for a ride and I would recommend seeking out the boats by the Creek when in the old part of the city.

something different to do in Dubai. must try for first time visitor to Middle East just for novelty sake. cheap and cheerful but avoid weekdays during office start or end time. also try to do this during the cooler months or else you may be tempted to jump into the creek for the heat could be a killer.

Water Taxi in Dubai with transferotel. You can book your abra , water taxi and ferry in dubai from the Dubai Creek ,Dubai marina and Bur Dubai to visit and to see all the beautifull places in Dubai from the sea .
A great, easy and cheap way of crossing the Creek. A great, easy and cheap way of crossing the Creek. You pay directly at the boat with on Dirham. They are placed all the way down the creek.
I love it!. the real way to see the old city cheap Dh1 per trip ride takes you across to gold souk and back and amazing place to take pictures I love it.

Very cheap, well worth it!. If youre in the area...which Im sure you would be as a tourist seeing "old Dubai"' then it's definitely worth a trip across the creek. It takes you from A to B quite quickly (faster than by taxi!) and costs around 1 aed per person. It is still used mainly by loxal workers so you get a feel for the real area. It's best in the evening and gives a great view of surrounding mosques, interesting buildings, and is quite atmospheric.

The Real Dubai. If you wanna see a real Dubai,this is the place to visit.The best time to be around is from Nov-April. It's too hot in the summer. You really wanna enjoy the atmosphere here,have a drink in one of the cool restaurants by the Creek.
Fun Ride. Had a fun ride crossing teh creek to the spice souk. The Abra was very clean and looked after with pride by the driver.
Abra taxi. 1 AED cost.. and get amazing views of creek.. just get connected to spice souk with fabric souk.. must try
Nice ride. One of the few places in Dubai where you can trully enjoy a cultural experience. Boats are not slow and a light breeze helps you enjoy your ride while having a cool view at the city.
Old Dubai. Crossing the Creek on the abra, for only one dirham, is a great exprience and affords you a glimpse into how Dubai used to be before it became a global mega-city.

Olden Era Impression in Modest city. you will love while walking through narrow approach road passing through old styled souks to reach this place.The 2 hindu temples are located here only near the museum. Again a great place to click pictures & have abra ride operated by RTA.After walking distance of 10 min on creek will reach a place where you can see big Dhows. Hasn't changed in 100's of years. Easy access via the Hop on/Hop off bus. Bus stop right beside one of the docks. Interesting to see how the locals use the Abra's for day to day travelling to/from various locations along the creek
Unique feeling. There is a certain unique feeling to crossing the water on an Abra for only 1 AED per person. The area, if you can deal with the salesmen, is also interesting.
nice. This is another part of all Dubai. The abras are very nice vehicles! They even have honks. I found them, lovely and they only cost one dirham!

Great way to cross the creek (if it's not too hot). This cheap and classic way of crossing the creek is favoured by local workers but for a single Dirham, it can be a fun way to see Bur Dubai from the water.There are several docks along each bank of the creek and figuring out which abra will go where is quite difficult.If you look foreign, you should also be aware that you might be targeted by street hustlers trying to sell you an overpriced ticket.The current cost is one Dirham, no more.
The best 1 dirham you'll spend in Dubai. A great way to cross the Creek and a must do for any visitor coming to Dubai. The bras run from Bur Dubai across to Deira on a very regular basis.

uthentic boating in Dubai.. 1 AED to cross Dubai creek only ! A very authentic way to be transported in Dubai. It is old, it smells oily but you can only love it. For a few AED more, you can ask the "skipper" to take only you onboard and navigate the creek up and down for 30 to 60 minutes. Great for families or for romantic couples.
Amazing at night. Really a nice romantic tour you do in bur dubai at night in a small electric boat. A must do .... the mall inside is well organised but expensive to buy from.

The real Dubai. Fantastic way of experiencing the 'old' Dubai. Pay one dirham to go across the creek to travel to either the spice and gold souq, or textile souq. If you don't know what to do, just ask one of the people with an RTA logo on their shirt. They will gladly help you.
joy ride. fast track to the opposite side of deira, cheap rides and unique style of transportation. great people.
1 Dirhams Cruise. Don't miss the experience of crossing the creek with just 1 AED. Fun. Daily commutation of working class people.
Best way to diera from bur dubai creek.. One of the best way to travel and have a nice view of Creek. And its only 1 dhs only. I love to travel through these boats.

A must do. After getting aboard, I wasn't sure if we would sink or catch fire. After a few minutes I realized we would probably sink due to the constant ramming of other boats and the dock while actually trying to get into the slip. I have taken many trip now and enjoyed them all, well worth trying. Lots of fun if you can keep your arms and legs inside at all times.

Give it a go - loved it only 1 dinar. Used abra to cross creek from gold/spice souk and it was quite an experience. Only 1 dinar each for 5/7 minute crossing to other side. Good sightseeing .Usually have 10/12 people seated on each crossing. Give it a go you do not get much for 1 dinar in Dubai.
streets & boats. its been great time spending in Bur Dubai with my friends from my native. It feels our own streets & boating from one place to another with 2 dirhams each way makes you crazy..
Interesting and awesome. One of the most interesting activity to do in Dubai, very easy on pocket. A must try for everyone who visits this city
Awesome. Cheap. Night lights. Fantastic waters. This is must see area and Abra is a must for anyone visiting dubai.
Great Experiance. Great experience watching the hussel and bussel go over to other side and see the boats getting loaded its unreal how much goes on one

Must go for dhow cruise. Good experience sailing on dhows! Its a good experience. The one with dinner is not really worth it. Just a simple ferry from bur dubai to dear would provide a great experience too.

Brilliant fun. This is one of those "must do's" when in Dubai. I know the beaches of Jumeriah, The Palm etc are rather far away from Bur Dubai but if you can drag yourself away, go down town and take a water taxi across the Creek and experience the hustle and bustle of the real streets , markets and Souks. The people are very friendly and these taxi's are brilliant fun. Hang on to little ones as they do go at a pace!

A great memory. One of the most memorable things we've done. Took this ride as part of the Dubai tour & just loved the airy feel sitting on this tiny Abra. Not sure it's the safest mode of transport but it's so cheap & a real must if visiting Dubai.

Dubai Creek Trip. Dubai development has started after the major dredging and widening of the Dubai Creek in early 1970s. Daily thousands of people are using Creek for transportation in between Deira & Bur Dubai. Fair is cheap and its a part of public transport system. Boat journey will be interesting. As a part of tourism promotions now Cruise services also available.
Nice evening visit.. This is a must thing to do in Dubai. Take one of the traditional Abra taxi's on the creek to see the hustle and bustle of the historical area from your boat. Very, very cheap!

Cgeap transport to cross the creek. Nice cheap transport to cross dubai creek...
Get ready for smoke and gasoline...
It's a part of the deal..
Price... very cheap..
Boat Trip. This is not highly recommended, but if you are at creek you can just go around for a while in the boat at Abra Dock.

A must do!. We took a trip at night with our children. It gave you a sense of what "real life" in Dubai is like. The view from the water was lovely and we then spent an hour or two wandering around the souk before we took a return trip. I would highly recommend it.
across the creek. the ride accross the creek is about 5 minutes long, it's something traditional and a nice experience.

Bustling, busy, but lots of fun!. This dock is very busy, with big tourist groups constantly lining up to catch an aura to the Deira side of the creek (where you will find the Old Souk, the Gold Souk, the Fish Market, and much more!). It costs only 1 AED per person for the ride, which lasts about 5-10 minutes, and they quickly move all the people waiting, with abras (small boats) constantly docking to take people. Overall, it is well organised. You get on the boat, and pay either the driver or an aid. Men and women sit together (there aren't any 'women only' abras or anything). One thing: OH&S is not a priority here - you step on to the boat from the dock, and the boat itself has no barriers or anything. So if your balance isn't great, be sure to hold on to someone or something when getting on and getting off - and keep tight hold of your goodies, lest you accidentally knock them into the water! People's sunglasses and hats frequently fall into the drip. You will pass boats overloaded with goods, preparing to go to Iran, India, and other places. It is a fascinating look into a somewhat hidden element of Dubai trade. Highly recommend!
Wonderful experience. Wonderful experience among the modernity of the beautiful city dubai to try Abra as a traditional water taxi from Bur Dubai to Deira crossing Dubai Creek
Taxi Boat. This is a must see in Dubai, you pay around 1 aed to get from one place to another and you will enjoy the expereince and traditional area of Deira and the creek.
Nice. Nice place to spend the evening with a friend and a coffee. Breezy ,has got sitting area. But quite busy on wekends
Great. Great way to travel across the creek. A must for everyone visiting Dubai. You can travel very close to dock area by Metro.
Feel old times!. Did Dhow cruise. but this Abra Dock area is different. They have small ferries called Dhow.. which shows u Deira area from water. Nice feel of old times.

A very enjoyable experience.. Everyone who visits Dubai should take an abra across the creek. It is one of the things myself and my husband do every time we need to visit Diera. We park the car and take the abra. It is especially good at night time. It is just a short walk then to the Gold Souk.
Must do. 1 AED to go across the creek or if you pay a bit more you can get a private tour of the creek. Lovely change from the sky scrapers.

one of the best way to see Dubai... any visitor to Dubai should try this traditional boats across the Dubai creek to see the Dubai in a different angel...keep coins in pocket before boarding and it will only cost you AED 1.00 per person.

Local transport to cross the creek.. We asked our bus driver to drop us at Meena Bazaar from where we walked to wards the ABRA TAXI stand near Bank Of Baroda. Abra Taxi are the boats to cross the creek . It charges only 1 AED to reach from Bur Dubai side to Deira side . The creek is a salt water lake which divides Dubai into two parts Bur Dubai and Deira. It is an experience to sit in this boat . Never Miss it if you want to understand what Dubai is.

best 1 dirham spend in Dubai!. Crossing the river at night is an experience everyone should try. Walking by the old wooden freighters, with trade goods ready to be loaded, then taking the abra over from the gold souk to the Al Fahidi side, and then walking in to the garment souk and seeing the Hindi temple, is as far away from the malls experience as the moon is.
Abra boating. Abra boating is a shortcut place to go dubai gold Souk. Cheaper to travel from one to other side of dubai.with good scenery on both side.

Best way to cross the creek and experience this part of Dubai. Very convenient to cross the creek, only 1 AED and boats leaving all the time. I went in the evening so it was a great view along the creek with the lights of the boats and the buildings.The area is very interesting too.

Nostalgic Dubai. Here you can feel old dubai.boat service by 1aed only.its a huge water body.which help the old business line by water body.You can enjoy dhaw cruise.you can book it by 60aed for evening trip for 3 to 4hrs.

1DHS and no more.. River boat taxi. Pay 1 DHS per person. They'll take more of course so have coins ready. It's a bit confusing as to which taxi to take but just walk down the pier and get in one. No need to buy a ticket. Just get on the boat and give the driver a DHS coin when he comes to collect just before launch. Easy as pie.

GREAT SHORT SAIL.. Great way to soak up the atmosphere of Old and new Dubai, a trip across the creek costs about 10pence or you can hire oan Abra for your own trip down the creek, we cross here every time we visit Dubai, great views of the old wooden Dhow boats which still sail from here to India and beyond.

Enjoyable. Where can you cross a creek for Dhs 1 ( 0.30 cents ) for visitors I think this is a must do trip...you can see the old Dubai...then cross the creek and go to deira side and visit the spice souk / buy spices...
best transport. Best way to cross the river and see the lovely views at the same time. Leads you to the souks efficiently and cheap. Good history lesson too
Abra Ride. It was really fun crossing Abra, it was bit hot sun but still we all enjoyed the ferry ride, water , sun and a group of friends its was nice.

Fun trip across the waters. The trip on one of the traditional boats are very cool and for me Nostaligic.. it reminds me of Dubai when we were kids... though my dad had not taken for "Safety reasons" . Every time i visit Dubai and have time .. i do a trip.. The cost for one person to one side is only one (1) Dhs.
Great Traditional Ferry Boats. I've always liked going on the Abra boats. It's just a short hop across the creek, but you get to see the dhows, the commuters, get a flavour of old Dubai.

Cheapest method of transport & comfortable... Great way to go across to the gold souk and back as it only costs a dirham. Very comfortable and only 5 mins to the other side. Better rates when changing money in this area too.

Boat trip from Bur Dubai to Deira. Enjoyed our boat trip from Bur Dubai to Deira.

A gentle and enjoyable way across the creek.. Quick and inexpensive way across the Dubai Creek. Costs 1 Dirham and a nice way to cool off slightly from the blistering heat!

Sailing on the abra. We used the abra boats to cross over to Deira and return back for fun. My little daughter was also with us and she enjoyed the experience. For AED 1/- per trip, it gives a feel of how people used to cross over in the old days

Abra Dock. the Abra dock in the older part of Dubai, bur Dubai is fascinating for it is from this place that one can hop onto an Abra for a ride.

10 minute only. when i was in dheira,i dreemed if munisipality start bharge service accross,then i will corss it with my car to save time and money.yes only for 3 qr less than 13 minute took to cross.and reach bur dubai.view was thrilling like dubai

Step back in time. Dubai is a mega city full of everything you could imagine. Futuristic clusters of skyscrapers etc. Its a nice refreshing change to see an old area of dubai.Dating back to a time before the oil money hit I found it all quite humbling to be honest.Simple lives were led and most started the day from here either fishing or pearl hunting.A lovely way to remember what was once here.
