Nice. Nice if you like to walk around and see yachts. Makes you feel rich just to be there. The marketplace next door is more fun. They have parking for camels there.

2 worlds. what a contrast.. looking at water level you can imagine "old" dubai then you look up and see the new dubai. One of the few cheap things in Dubai so make sure to include it. Also check out all the old boats tied up in the port still being used for cargo

See the past of Dubai. It is a part of Dubai where you can get an idea about life in the pre-oil times of Dubai and you shall visit that to have the complete impression of Dubai, which is not only the Skyline and big towers.

cheap ride. I think this place has lost its 'cultural' touch or its old roots. It did not really feel like we had gone back in time. Would have loved to see a more local way of life here. was good for the 1 dirham ride though
Cheap!. Very good & efficient way to get across the creek & cheap too think we paid 3aed to cross and it took about 10min better than taxi in traffic!!

Old Dubai. It's nice to see all Dubai has got to offer but don't forget to visit old Dubai too, comparing new and old Dubai is great and seeing the dock and all the shipment of product into Dubai and the creek

Small trip of traditional Dhow..... Its a smaĺl trip of Dhow or boat which will take u to old souq of Dubai ... it will cost only 1 Dhs per trip... u can also book one Dhow for 50-60 Dhs for one hour trip....

Only AED 1 for efficient transport across the Creek. This is one of the most efficient forms of transport I've seen in this modern world. So quick and efficient, and a Great experience. These guys miss each other sometimes with centimeters but everything works and this system has never failed us before. Will continue using it.

PuttPuttPutt? Yup yup yup. this is an interesting visit as its unique to the area and connected to the gold souk. nicer during the evening while avoiding the sun, even though risky for small kids as your sitting on the edge of the boat. but still worth the short ride putting down the waterway.

Bur Dubai Abra Dock: An Old Traditional Transportation. Bur Dubai Abra Doc is a must see place for every tourist visiting Dubai. The word "Abra" is derived from the Arabic word "Abara" which means cross, which is traditionally used to describe the crossing of the see between the the two main parts of Dubai: Bur Dubai and Deira.  The journey in the traditional boat takes between 3 to 4 minutes, and the fee is very symbolic (1 UAE durham per person). If you wish you could also hire a boat for on hour or so, but I am not sure of the price or such a journey, but I don't think it would be high.  Every time I visit Dubai I use the Abra, which makes me feel happy and recall the past days.
Abra Tranport. One of the historic and amazing transport service with the cheapest fare eveer...Great experience and fastest way to be in Deira...

Very fast way across the canal. We were shooping in old and gould souk and then we wanted to go across the canal to see the Dubai museum - the walk itself is not so long, if you can bear the heat. So abra was a very convenient way of traveling. It is so cheap and really nice experience. You can hang out with the locals and feel the breeze from the water in canal.

must try. This is truely an experience! I have used this abras (only 1aed per drive) a couple of times and when my family was here, we just rented a whole abra for ourselfes, I think it was 20aed per drive, which is also really affortable.
Worth it. This was the last day we spent in dubai and it was a great way to end the trip. Very relaxed. Cheap and great to see the old city from the creek
canal transport at Abra Dock. convenient way to reach from one bank to another, ticket is also reasonable and well maintained dock
boating q. good place to visit in crowded area of bur dubai.. ull see lot of indians in this area..ull find traditional boats ..

Step back in time crossing the creek. A wonderful, cheap and unique experience is to ride the abra across Dubai Creek. For just 1 dirham this must be one of the cheapest rides in the world...and most scenic. On one side is the old souk (market) and on the other the magnificent gold souk.
Must travel while going to Dubai. one of my most favorite place at Dubai, a small boats are ready to take you across the creek very amazing to travel and see both side specially at Evening and night!

Worth taking a short ride on a abra. Good thing to do whilst in Dubai, taking a abra[small wooden boat] from Bur Dubai to Deira.It cost 1 dirham per person for a ride across the creek and you end up on the door step of many old souks.Great traditional old style boats and you get to see such beautiful scenery.You can also get a boat just for you and your family for half or 1 hour but we din't bother with that.Awesome Indian street food on the Bur Dubai side, must try.

Should be on the to-do Dubai list. To visit Dubai you really do need to do this. Its a nice ride across the river, great photo-ops, plus its close to the gold/spice/fabric markets that are worth exploring too. Evening is a nice time o go as the temperature starts to drop and the food and shops re-open for the evening.

Nostalgic Glimpse of Dubai. Whenever I have visitors from overseas one of the 'must do' experiences is taking them on a trip across the Creek on a Abra, and then on to the Gold Souk which is walking distance away on the 'Deira' side of the Creek.Whilst it is not spectacular as with a number of other Dubai visitor attractions, it remains part of 'Old Dubai' and still provides, albeit briefly, a different view and perspective on Dubai.This is an opportunity to view some of the original aspects of Dubai before all of the glitzy towers and shopping malls were created.It provides a glimpse of how things were just a few decades ago.Well worth a visit.
The local taxi. Thoroughly enjoyed travelling on the Abras. It gave an insight as to how the locals travel. A cheap and pleasant way to get across the creek.

Authentic Dubai. This was another of our favorites in Dubai, crossing the creek in the Abra. The Abra (water taxi) will get you from downtown Dubai to the Souq. The area itself is well worth checking out with loads of spice shops and fabric markets. Even if you don't really need to get across the creek, you should still get on a water taxi just for the fun of it.

Abra ka dabra. Enjoy an evening stroll in Bur Dubai and get on the abra for the price of Dhs1. Great way to see the old parts of Dubai and experience simple things.Be careful though some areas have not so pleasant hawkers who do wolf whistle.

Got to be done. This short trip across the creek on an Abra is just the thing to do, we get the taxis to drop us off at the Abra Dock, go across for one Dirham, then go into the Gold Souk then we do it in reverse when we have finished shopping.
Like travelling back in time. Really nice to see the hustle and bustle. Good insight to how people crossed the creek in the olden days. Very cheap ride across and back.

Bustling with boats!. The Bur Dubai Abra Dock is a great experience. Lots of Emirates and tourists alike scrambling onto several wooden abras, wanting to cross the Creek. The atmosphere is fun for the tourists eager to sample the local culture. Here is a good place to start. An Abra ride is essential.

Nice in the bright day!. The dock stations are within 200 m from each other. The boat will go slow so that you can catch the moments in your camera/ mobile. It's just one Durham one way.
Don't get scare of the boats or water as it's quiet safe and enjoyable.
Fun experience. This is just plain fun. The boat (Abra) ride across the river is 1aed. They are a great historic and cultural experience. Enjoy.

traditional journey. the best destination to see the heritage and past of dubai and get some traditional merchandise
it might be a bit hard for people on crutches or with a disability to get on the abra(small boat)

Crossing. We did this to see what it would be like. Do hold on to something as it can get a little shaky stepping on or off.
I loved the natural wooden boats it brought the authenticity to the whole experience. Do try it if you are there.
Only 1 Dirham each takes 5 minuts to cross over.
Try it!. Truly exciting experience, wood built Abra boats will take you around the different Dubai souks at the price of 1 AED

Nice place to chil. Nice view by the sea looking at the traditional trading boats. Feeling that you've been tranfered in the past. Like to go there durring the weekends during morning time. Feeling very relaxing. Think it's a must see place.

cheep n good expirience. good expirience of in old style boat n it only cost 1 dehramit start from many place n every place end at diffrent location but not to werry they all r near to each other but go once
short boat trip. nice short boat trip on the Creek ...people are using the boat to cross to the other side, but it can be also an interesting activity to do if you are around.

Glad to have done it. Not that it is the biggest excitement in my world, but was good to experience a way of normal living in Dubai. They helped us oldies on and off the boat. Interesting way of getting a breeze in the heat of the day.
cheap and cheerfull. Travel with the locals .no frills but very cheap.easiest way to get across to the Souk markets.1 dirham each way.

One of the highlights of my trip. I really enjoyed using the abra to cross the creek. For 1 AED it was dirt cheap and very good value for money. It's such a lovely thing to do and I could imagine if you hired an abra for an hour would be a really chilled out way to see more of the creek area.
Like & recommend!. Joyful short boat ride with cheap fare. Friendly staff running the boat did help the elderlies getting up and down. A good means of transport.

Go at sunset!!. So a really inexpensive trip as it how locals travel across the waters. It is a beautiful experience, and was quite mind blowing to be travelling across a sunset. A very short trip, but cheep and cheerful all the same. Gives you an insight to the side of Dubai that we don't see.

a fun side trip. an excellent way to mingle with the locals and it is only 1 dirham to ride over to the other side. we were on old dubai side and caught a abra over to the deira side and walked through th espice souk to the gold souk.

Unique experience . The is on of the very nice attractions during the winter..
Transport by the ancient small boats between the two parts of Dubai..
Connecting the two famous old down towns in dubai, Diera and BurDubai..
Lovely and worth to try
Easy Access. Its really cheap and convenient. It saves a lot of time by connecting abra to creek. Meanwhile you can have a good view of some boats and get some good air.

Hot sunny morning to cruise. On last day of our holiday at Dubai we decided to take Abra (water taxi) to cruise along Dubai creek as many people are advise us to do. So early in the morning around 8.30 am we arrived at Abra station and started to look one to hire for cruise. We noticed that all price to use Abra as public transportation or for private use were already regulated by government. If you use it as transportation together with others you'll pay 1 AED, but if you'd like to have the boat yourself for 1/2 hour cruise is 60 AED and 1 hour 120 AED. We took 1/2 hour cruise since it was hot (38 C) as it was on summer. The ride was worth though as we could see the other side of Dubai, not just desert and wide dusty road but also huge river, housing complex, boats from Iran and other part of Arab region. We also crossed by one of the palace owned by the King. It was fun and I guess it was also a good closure of our holiday at Dubai.

Abra ride. In May when we visited Dubai we got to the abra port and paid for an abra ride. They asked for 60 everywhere in this port. Finally I barghained for 50. We were on the abra 2 persons only and the ride lasted about 50 minutes. It was very cool but after sometimes a bit boring as the scenery wasnt so interesting in the Creek. If I had known that I would have ridden the abra with other people for just 1 dirhem. But I dont regret of course. I recommend a 1 dirhem ride if you want to be part of local people!

Cheap and more interesting way to cross the creek. Boat taxi's only 1 dirham each way. Tour trips more and takes you around the creek but you can see most attractions land side. Boat taxi's run all the time and not too long a crossing
Abra ride. Booked an entire abra for my family. The price included a 1 hour tour of the canals. Guide Muhammad was friendly and knowledgeable. Kids loved it!

Interesting for tourists. Interesting place for tourists. A fun way to travel across the creek with locals for just 1 dirham. `old shops to browse through & a restaurant serving arabic food overlooks the creek.

A favourite winter destination for me and my family. I am a resident of uae but i always find the time to revisit and ride the abra most especially since my young son loves the experience. For as little as 2 dirhams, you get a back and forth trip and you get to experience the nostalgia of old dubai. This is a good mini adventure especially since everything is already new in dubai and this brings back the old.The dubai abra dock is very near to other museums and old houses so it is a package deal trip with other tourist destination in the area. Also, during the winter time, you can bring old stale breads or even fresh ones and you can feed the sea gulls by the dock. This is a very entertaining activity so make sure to bring plenty of food for the birds

was alright. went on a night to enjoy cold breeze that just wasnt blowing...don't go during summer...extremely humid....pretty cheap ride from bur dubai souq to deira souq and back (2 AED). didn't explore the souqs much....plenty of such trips keep going on and on...docks can get congested...very colorful cruises add to the beauty of the dark night!

the heart of old dubai. take a trip on an abra from bur to deira, costs 1 dirham. and you can see the creek, which was what dubai was until about 30 or 40 years ago. an entrepot and some pearl fishing.
Good Experience. It had been a wonderful experience moving from one place to another in a boat. We have the gold souk at the other end
Boat Ride. It had been a new experience moving from one place to another in a boat with charges of 1 Dirham per person for one way ride.

Excellent and different. Worth combining with a trip to the creek and a wander around. We have been a few times and its so different to the "5 star" Dubai was make sure we take all our visitors there. At 1 dirham per person a ride the cost is minimal for the view and the adventure. Mind your step when you get on and off and try and take some small notes / coins with you.

Relaxing view of the Creek. Our family decided to take a private 1 hour trip up and down the creek and we asked to be dropped off at the spice souk on the way back. The ride was smooth and the view of the old fishing and cargo boats from India and Pakistan against the backdrop of the modern architecture was fabulous. We left the dock just before sunset and had an amazing view of the sun setting behind us as we made our way up the creek. I would highly recommend doing a private 1 hour trip up and down the creek on the local abras.
Cruising via ABRA for 1AED fr. DEIRA. Nice experience to be in a FLAT boat (abra) to go visit the gold/spice/textile SOUK ( market) with a fee of 1AED... Plus most of the LOCALs take them across .
Real Dubai atmosphere. Take a visit down to the Abra docks and you see some real life Dubai atmosphere. Organised bustling, plenty of Abras available, worth a cruise on the creek.
Dubai mirrored in the Creek. It was nice to have a cruise in the night and see the simmering lights of Dubai and reflection of lights in the water of the Creek.
a different walk from rest of dubai. it was great to walk through it, more of an old city part than the regular high rise midtown parts of any town

TRAFFICLES RIDE IN DUBAI. An easy way to cross the Creek from the Dubai Museum area to the Gold and Spice Souks.It is also a cheap way to get from Bur Dubai to Deira, without having to go through the traffic to get to Deira and the cost is only one Dirham each way.It is also a wonderful experience that one should try at least once.The entire journey unveils the textile souk and various art galleries ending with the gold souk.

Authentic Experience. We took the Abra in the evening and crossed from the spice Souks to Bur Dubai. It was a great experience to see all the lights on the shore line as well as the lit up floating restaurants on the creekThe cost was 1 Dirham, be sure to have this ready when the driver gets to your seat as the collection is quite efficient!It takes roughly 7 minutes to cross the creek (depending on which Abra station you are going to) This is definitely something I can recommend to do when in Dubai
Well worth while. Excellent views of the creek. Went on an abra as part of an Alpha tour. This too was most worth while as it gave us an over view of what to visit - 5hrs 150 Drh each

It only feels like Dubai once we cross the creek on an Arba. We like to do this every time we come to Dubai. Is a great contrast to the flashy, modern, expensive and commercial part of town. Coming down to the creek, catching an abra for next to nothing, then going over to eat at our favourite river side restaurant - sure sweating a bit but enjoying the scenes on the river = love watching the big boats go past. We did one year pay a lot more for a private ride all the way down the creek. It was really interesting but not cheap to do. If you are only coming to Dubai once, then do it for certain.

An essential Dubai experience. We used the Abras a few times during our recent trip to Dubai as they were an easy way to get across the Creek from the Dubai Museum area to the Gold and Spice Souks. The cost was only one Dirham each way, collected by the "driver" in a walk around the deck once we had boarded and were seated - suggest either having the right money or small notes. The boats depart once they have close to a full load of 20 people, which seems to be every five minutes or so, at least when we were travelling. Most of those using the service seem to be "locals" and tourists will run the gauntlet of being approached for private tours - just ignore them and get on the abra currently being loaded up, unless you really want to do an extended tour up the Creek. Comfort level is low, as you simply sit on the edge of the cabin housing, and you can get an odd wiff of engine fumes, but the trip only takes five minutes.

Just awesome. It is a cheap way to get from Bur Dubai to Deira, without having to go through the traffic to get to Deira. It is also a wonderful experience that one should try at least once.The trip is short, therefore for those who experience sea sickness, this should not stop them from trying. I also tried it in the evening, and I found it to be much more wonderful at night time as the lights nearby gives the place a soft glow.Anyone going to Dubai should at least try it once.

A glimpse of the old dubai. If you're interested on experiencing how the people in dubai used to travel between Bur Dubai and Deira which is separate by Dubai Creek, then the Abra is a must to do. The place is not that easy to find if you come to dubai for the first time, but if you ask around you will find the place, it's better if you took public transport as parking can be an issue although there's a public parking space just in front of HSBC building but this too usually quite busy. If you park in front of HSBC, then on the way to the abra station, don't forget to stop at the small shawarma join on your right side, the spicy one is quite nice. Then you can wait for the abra at the station until the gentlemen by the gate ask you to board the abra (he will count the number of people to make sure there's enough room for people to sit). Once you're on board, just enjoy and don't forget to take a snap on the scenic and maybe a selfie. The cost for the trip is only 1 dirham, which is quite cheap for the experience. You will then stop at the other side of the creek, if you're interested to go to the spice market, then it's just a stone throw away.

Great way to cross the creek.. A real taste of Dubai the trading city to get onboard the abra and cross the creek next to the trading ships over seen by skyscrapers and souks. amazing value and a great way to cool down!

nice scenic Ride and cheap commute. Been staying in Dubai for 8 years ,and Ive been using this mode of transporation quite a lot.From 2007 when I first came here ,it was famous among traders,locals,tourists and residents travelling from Bur Dubai to Deirah.From Al ghubaiba metro and bus station where you can find a main hub of trsnsportation ,conveniently distant to Gold souk,Dubai museum and Souk.Very cultural place ,very safe and popular.Its a must try!

nice experience. Abra is a very cheap and native way of transport. It is a must experience if you are in Dubai. From Gold Souk/Deira to Central Dubai, cheapest and fastest way to travel, a safe and super experience. Also, enjoy the skyscrapers whilst you have the ride
Old Dubai. been going to Dubia for last 25yrs, and the Abra trip up the creek at night is very atmospheric and reminds me what old Dubai used to be like

Good but height problem for a little one!. My wife and I took our son to Wild Wadi. He is 4 and a half and loves water parks. The lady at the entrance charged us for a child but the more expensive price as we thought he would be tall enough for a few of the faster rides.When we got in we discovered he was about 1cm too short so it was the wave pool, lazy river and kids splash area!This was the only down side. The food there was good but very over priced.Will go back now he is taller and will decide if it's worth the 200AED each or not!!
Beautiful Skyline view. Even if you have no work on Bur-Dubai side, its a great experience. I would normally just sail there to enjoy the skylines of Dubai from the middle of the waters

Into the Dubai mood for 1dirham. If you don't have time for a long trip, step on a local abra to cross the creek for just 1 dirham and you feel part of the ancient Dubai. Be sure to have coins with you.

Nothing more authentic in Dubai. To me this is the best option if you want to shuttle from Deira to Bur Dubai and vice versa. It is the only true authentic thing remaining from the old Dubai. For just 1 dirham you get the phenomenal experience of crossing the Dubai creek and enjoy easy access to the souks on both sides. I definitely recommend doing the crossing during daylight and at night. Ok, there is no comfort and you seat side by side with the other people crossing (each boat can embark around 20 persons) but each time I go to Dubai with visitors I enjoy my ride on the creek and just can’t get enough. Avoid the guys proposing private rides, it is much more expensive and the impression is the same.
Water taxi across Dubai Creek.. For just a few cents you can ride across Dubai Creek from the souk area to the old part of Dubai. Fun experience and a different view of Dubai.

Nice to Walk around. Bur Dubai Abra Dock is vibrant, traditional covered Arabian market lined with fragrant spice stalls and jewellery shops. The boat is made up of traditional wood. The entire journey unveils the textile souk and various art galleries ending with the gold souk. The Bur Dubai Abra dock is said to be the most memorable cruise ride ever.

Cheapest Attraction in Dubai..... Connecting Bur Dubai with Old Deira, the Abra dock its one of the oldest means of transportation of Dubai and by far the cheapest. For a few coins, you have the experience of crossing the creek in a small old boat in what is for a lot of people a way of commuting. Its something very touristic but very enjoyable and, at the same time, its the fastest way to go from the Deira Souq to the Bur Dubai Gold Souq. There will be people offering private rides for more expensive rates but that depends in your wallet and desiree to do it. For me, when I used to have visitors, I would always take them here and everyone enjoy it....A must in my opinion...

Authentic ride . Each time I have family and friends visiting from abroad I take them here as it's a very different experience crossing the creek especially since its only 1dhs. You have to squash up a little and sometimes u have the odd person staring at you. But it's nice to experience the old dubai
Enjoy the Abra ride. We took the abra ride to cross the creek and go to the gold and spice souk. Very cheap even these days and fun to enjoy the old modes of transport!

Must do!. Abras are traditional water taxis. They take people from Bur Dubai to Deira and from Deira to Bur Dubai. People use them to go to work and tourists to get from one side to the other and enjoy the creek! It's fun and very cheap!

Abra ride..cheap n enjoyable. Abra ride is a really fun part of the creek . You can go to Deira side for shopping and come back within half an hour. One dirham per ride.....specially in evening the Dubai skyline looks beautiful.

Old look of Dubai. If you want to experience the Abra ride then you can just hop on the Abra for 1 AED and it will take you from Deria to Bur Dubai and back in 5 minutes. You can sit besides the local people and experience the charm of old Dubai. The boats are not well maintained.
bur Dubai. Vuisiting Bur Dubai is must. there is a huge Gold Market thereat and also other small shops selling kesars etc.

Cheap enjoyable ride. It is used for crossing the Creek for the locals, fare cost only 1 dirham one way, worth it. Evening time, you can see lights of the surrounding buildings and the small cruise boats going through the Creek. You can go and see Deira area where you can visit the Souks.

Good transportation option. Don't bother with Taxis if you can get there via an Abra. They are quick and offer a great view of the creek and the lives of locals. I used them a few times and they accept the Nol card also, if you got one for the metro! You may have to fend off offers of creek tours near the docks.

Fun and cheap . I enjoyed the trip very much. It's just one dirham to get over the creek with a great view. I can't help to compare it to the value for money of HK's star ferry. However, in comparison this one smells a lot more of petrol.
Great value. What fun just 1 Dirham to cross the creek in a little Abra boat with no sides and no proper seats. A must do but only for the able bodied!
Good views. Gives a scenic view of good old dubai.. a must try for all who visit dubai... great contrast to all the high rises in dubai
This is really fun. Watch the locals travel up and down the creek, Eat at the waterfront restaurants and walk along the riverside into bur dubai
Just do it.. The Abra's ply the waters of the creek, taking mainly Asian workers from one side to the other, however it is the tourist thing to take one over just for the hell of it.

Taking an Abra across The Creek is the most authentic experience you'll have in Dubai. This is a must do - crossing The Creek in an Abra (a traditional water taxi) is something locals do every day as part of commuting from home to shops or work ... and it is incredibly cheap (unlike almost everything else in Dubai). We went back and forth many times, on both routes.BTW, just show up with coins in your pocket, they load you and the abra goes as soon as it is full, which usually takes less than two minutes. No planning required.The abras are a remnant of old Dubai, and the most interesting thing in Dubai (except perhaps the culture clash between traditional muslim / Arab / nomadic and western values, between excessive wealth and immigrant guest workers) ... but I digress. This is my number one attraction in Dubai - followed closely by the fish market (and not by the gold souk), the Burj Khalifa and the indoor ski area (Ski Dubai).
Good cheap way to get across. For one Dirham (~$0.30AUD) you can get from the markets on one side to the other, close to the bus and metro station, good views as well.
Bur Dubai. A finest market place for jewelry and clothing. A nice place to know about old Dubai, its culture & development.
a very nice way to spend a 10 minutes away from concrete high rise and noisy roads. It is a very nice water taxi crossing the Dubai Creek in 10 minutes with a wooden boat. It is very pleasant.
Nicest. Bur Dubai is one of finest market place for shoppers and with localized jewelry experience and Indian stuff also easily available.

Cheap boat ride. You could cross the creek for a dirham and visit the souks on the other side. Just a short boat ride that locals use and its cheap. The views are good. Not a must do as a stand alone attraction, so combine with something else.

Look. It's really worth to be there for few minutes as it good view and give u idea how locals travel and do things. So along with worth a looks it give u good view and a scene along with idea about local travel and so. So try to find some time and spend few minutes.
Fun. Enjoyable way to travel the lagoons of Madinat Jumerieh. Hotel guests get free abra rides all day/night but visitors have to pay.

Worth a look.. For a taste of how local travel has been done for a long time, its well worth a visit, but it can be a bit hectic depending on what time of day you go. A great way to cross over the creek if you want to visit the gold souk.
great cultural experience. I always bring visitors to Dubai here, for 1 dirham you can take an authentic abra across the creek and the sites and sounds are lovely

Different and Traditional . These wooden boats are used for the journey between the two main parts of Dubai..
Really different and unique experience
Very nice to try
So safe
Very cheap
Excellent . Great value easy travel. Very hot and limited shade so go in the afternoon or at sunset. Easy to find. Nice photo opportunities.

Different experience. A must visit to check out the heritage of Dubai.
A ride in the abra is a must of the creek.
Make sure you don't go on a Friday/Saturday as this place is packed with laborers.
Old and Fascinating Dubai. Nothing much to explore. Beautiful old face of Dubai. To be visited during the day. Club it with Souks...

Can't Beat this view for only 2 Dirham. Instead of paying tons of cash on a dinner cruise, buy a shawarma and sail across the creek in a these small dhows for only 2 dirham. You get a beautiful view of both old dubai and the creek. I rode this going across to the spice souk several times. One of my most memorable experiences in dubai. A must do but I recommend around sunset, that's when you get the best photos.
Cheap, Easy & Cultural. For 1 DHS you can get from Bur Dubai to Deira where you will find the Spice & Gold Souks. At night you cam see the beautiful tour abras light up beautifully.

Diera to Bur Dubai and vice versa in the shortest time possible!. No visit to Dubai is complete without getting on the Abra's. Thanks to the NOL card, you can pay for your Abra rides apart from the bus and metro.

Dubai as a business hub by Dhow. Could see a lot of abra's and dhow's loading and un loading goods. This could be seen to a long stretch. One could imagine how Dubai flourished as a major hub and the beginnings.
A Nice little tour. This was a nice little tour to get from Bur Dubai to Deira. Cost only 1 AED each. visited the souks and then abra back again.

A good hangout... Had been to a cruise in Bur Dubai creek..Its a weekend getaway for those who do not want to spend too much on tickets..Just take a walk along the creek or wooden boat ride..an experience worthwhile. For your vehicle..the RTA has facility of multistory parking just opposite the Bur Dubai station.

'A DUBAI MUST DO'. When in Dubai one of the cheapest attractions is crossing the creek on an Abra. It is cheap and affords one superb views of the creek and many passing Dhows. It also enables you to get to some of the older and more traditional parts of the city.
Authentic. With so much new in Dubai, this is a vestige of the old way of life. And for only 1 dirham for the ride (just pay the boat driver), you can't go wrong.

New Look on the other side of Dubai👍. Experience the Abra cruise from one location to another using coins only AED 1 however the drivers have a beautiful smile and they even reconnect to utilise the entire Abra with your loved one, very unique place of the old city of Dubai view great views and cool breeze.

Traditional Dubai. Spend a day in this traditional, old part of Dubai. Wander around the souks and hop on an abra to get a taste of how things used to be before the high rises started appearing. Very cheap to hop on a shared abra to cross the water but they're also available for private tours lasting around an hour. Well worth it.

Enjoyed this area. It's a nice little tour of the creek and step into the old Dubai markets. Great photo area. The ride is free going over if you have the hop on hop off bus pass, and very cheap anyway for the return.

Economical mode of transport. this has been in Duba since forever... its the quickest and most economical mode of transport if you would like to get to the other side of the Creek..
the Creek seperates Deira & Dubai...
Very good. It is very cheap to travel by the boats across the Creek, and it is a great opportunity to take some photos and see the city from the water.
good ride. its a good ride for 1 dhs, from one side of the river to another. the oldest mode of transportation in the modern dubai.

Traditionally Emirati. Abra is a traditional emirati boat. This mode of transport in Dubai operates to ferry people from Diera(old trading commerce of Dubai) and Bur Dubai(Old Dubai Capital) viz-a-viz across the Dubai Creek. Just hand AED 1.00 to the ferry driver and you'll have a 5-minute ride enough to experience the old Dubai way. Depends on certain location you wanted to visit there are several stations on both sides of the creek. Spice souq, old souq, dubai museum, twin tower, rolex tower is just around the vicinity. So have a tour...!

Travelling on an Abra. We liked the traditional method of crossing the Creek, it was very cheap, 1 dirham per person. Didn't like sitting in the blistering sun until the abra filled up before, departing.
Photo Opportunity. Plan a ride on the lake in an Arbra whilst the water and light shows are on. You will be able to get a magnificent photo of the Burj Kalifa.
Cheap and great.. It cost only 1 dhs and it transfer you to the gold souk. It is a 10 min experience, and it is great. You can taste a little bit of the Old Dubai.
Easy. The easiest way to get from one side to the other one. Cheap and worth doing it. Great experience. Anytime again. And we were able to take nice pictures.

Bur Dubai Abra ride cost only AED 1, go over to Deira side for an experience of a public water taxi. Bur Dubai side of the Abra dock, is a great place to take pictures. Also to experience a ride on the Abra for only 1 dirham, to get on to Deira side (visit to the Spice and Gold souk). Close to Meena Bazaar area and within walkable distance.
nice. I liked the dock and the view...it really fit in to the old dubai style. but since we didnt had much to do over there just snapped some pics and went on our way!

best enjoyed at night. this is one of Dubai's hidden gems.....
take a stroll around the spice souk in the afternoon and then head here for an evening ride across the creek
there are plenty of abbra's so you wont have long to wait to enjoy 10 minutes or so of gentle cruising.
and all of this fun for 1aed!!!

travel with the locals. Just hop on the Abra at any stop and ride to your destination with the locals. Cheap and efficient. You will be squashed in though.If you are going on a river "cruise" which is a little longer wear a hat in summer!

Fun thing to do.. On a hot day, Get into a abra, take a ride along with the water spraying in your face and looking at basically the not so new Dubai. It's a cool thing to do and basically much better than 30 minutes spent at a spa relaxing.
exciting. the walk up to the abra itself was picturesque and quaint. the architecture is true to the are and culture and ride itself took us on a panoramic view of all Dubai has to offer
valuable. A very good and cheap option to go from Diera to Bur Dubai. Authorities should consider renovation the docks and services offered at docks

A wonderful experience! . It was lovely to go on the abra. We went at night time and it was all lit up and gorgeous!! Once we got off the dock there were lovely market stalls selling lovely clothes and souvenirs! They can spot a tourist though and will definitely try and over charge so make sure you haggle!!

Very typical. If you visiting Deira and Bur Dubai at the same day, it's a nice idea to cruise the river with those water buses. They are very typical used by the locals and cost only 1 Dhs. Interesting.

Open boat cruise. The Abra dock has the old Arabian style boats called Dhows. It's only a dirham to travel to the opposite side of the creek. The other side has the Gold Souks, Textile Souks, it has narrow streets with lots of souvenir shops and clothes, lamps, cushions tea sets etc.Where the docks are there are a lot of eating places aswell as souks and heritage centre the old dubai and where the Sheiks lived. There are boat cruises available. Also the dhow cruises offer evening dinner cruises. There are a lot of money exchange places with good rates. The cruises are great,very relaxing. We drank lots of coconut water available. I didn't like the smell of the strong diesel coming from the boats.
Abra Dock. Another must for tourists to have the chance to have a look at this beautiful city from another point of view.

Must do for 20p. It's 20p for a quick trip across the water (takes about 10 minutes) and to come out of fancy new Dubai into the Spice and Gold souks. The souks are great, if you're happy to engage with a bit of barter, but either way, the little boat trip is a treat, so I'd recommend this to anyone with an hour or so to spare.

Great way to travel. My husband and I used the Abras to cross the creek after visiting the old Dubai and the souks. It was about 18 pence each to cross the creek and it was wonderful to see all the boats and abra boat taxis. This area is very different to the new larger than life buildings and malls of the modern Dubai. The creek is wide and it would have been great to have had a creek boat ride, but it was a little difficult finding out exactly where to go. Hopefully on our next visit.

Best 20p spent. Absolutely loved this, felt a real connection with old Dubai and very refreshing compared to all the modern buildings we had been surrounded by. When we went we were the only tourist travelling with locals. We did get a bit confused as to where to go prior to getting on but everyone was very helpful getting " the tourists" to the right place.

boat ride in Bur Dubai. after having Darshan in the temples in and around Bur Dubai we went for a boat ride which is considered to be one of the cheapest mode of transport from Bur Dubai to New Dubai. you can see the stark contrast between old and new Dubai in this boat journey. suggested to take this ride of around 20 mins in the night time to enjoy the lights reflecting in the water and also see different sizes of boat well decorated with colorful lights which is a feast for the eyes. functions can also be booked in such boats as a package and i am sure it will be fun

The other side of Dubai. This is the other side of Dubai, away from the ultra modern buildings. This is a photographer's delight. The Abras crossing the Creek with their multi culture passengers offer endless images for the pleasure of the eyes and the lens. Serenity is the feeling which comes while watching them.Most interesting also is the sight of the bigger colourful vessels which are loading cargo for India.The Creek is a unique place to visit.

Quick, very cheap and nice way to see 'Old' Dubai. Even though I have lived in the UAE for half my life, I had not really visited the Creek area before! This was a great way to see it and to cross between souks on either side of the Creek. A must for people wanting to see Dubai away from the malls and landmark buildings.

Convenient and cheap way to cross the creek. At just 1 dirham per person, you can cross the creek and take in the views along the creek in less than 5 min. The quick turnover of abras mean you almost never have to wait to board one. The driver will collect the fare from you prior to departure or during the trip.
Enjoyable!. Enjoyed it to move to the other site from the village, so cheap, good experience, Visited the spice souks also.
Real Dubai. A great way to leave the new, modern Dubai behind and get a glimpse of what Dubai used to be like. Spend a Dirham, get on one of abras and cross the creek, you wont be disappointed!
Really nice. Went across the creek on the dhow. Lovely experience to see a different part of Dubai. Visited the spice souks also. Great fun haggling. Very enjoyable

Amazing Tour. This is one of the excited things which you can do during visiting Dubai. A tour in a small dock in Dubai Creek with your family. The good thing about it that it is cheap and not expensive at all

Great experience. If you are in Dubai you really should come here, it gives you a feel for how Dubai used to be before all the new development stared. It costs 1 dirham to cross(20p) and is great fun.
Excellent boat trip. We went from the gold souks over to the dubai museum area, dirt cheap and a great experiense. A must do.

See what it used to be like.. The last bit of authenticity in Dubai. You must take a ride across the Creek and feel the vibe. The rest of the city does not offer much unless you just like shopping in malls and driving cars all day long.

Traditional Culture Preserved. One of the oldest modes of travel between bur dubai and deira in Dubai is small plank boats which take you across the dubai creek and what is important is they only charge 1 dirham for the same. As it being oldest mode of transfer government has subsidised it. Do visit the dock as its an harbour which connects golden route from south east asia to europe
excellent, must do. the water is really calm and wonderful to just take a ride over to the old Souk. buy an Nol ticket for easy travelling

excellent part of seeing old Dubai!. Take these small boats across the Creek for only 1 dirham. And old Dubais is very interesting on both sides of the Creek. Easy, fast, reliable, cheap. A must see for history buffs!
cheap as chips. Very cheap. costs 1AED to cross. Watch out though the abra drivers try to get you to go a longer route with them and it costs a lot more.

Bur Dubai. Cheap to visit, not much to see, a lot of little shops and stalls. All shop keepers really stare at you and hugling is must if you decide to buy anything. I purchased a cashmere scarf. The shop keeper price was 80 aed but got it for 30aed.

Catch a glimpse of old Dubai. A stroll along the Bur Dubai Abra Dock provides the opportunity to catch a glimpse of old Dubai. The colorful dhows no longer run exclusively via sail, but rely on Diesel engines to transport passengers and a wide variety of merchandise. We saw appliances, loads of rice and people ferried across the Creek between Old Dubai and the souk side of the waterway. For only 1 AED each way avail yourself of this unique mode of travel. For any fan of Monty Python alum Michael Palin and his around the World on 80 Days Series, the dock will look familiar as this is where he booked his Dhow segment of his journey.

had gone to abra. we sat in boat ride one dhirams to go other side bur dubai you can take picture enjoy boat ride in bur dubai there is site seeing govt bus also it is name by rta in bur dubai there are boats take for 1 hour ride 300 dhirams in the boat restuarant is there

Different!!!. The Abra is a different experience and takes to through the Dubai-That was. Everything including the people you float with is simple and leaves you with a fulfilling feeling. The wooden boats now run on diesel costs you 2 dirhams and the NoL card doesnt work here. It happens to be the same route where the traditional dhows run in the evening- creek area. Birds flying very close to the abra and entire skyline is very pleasing. Also, you could just sit besides the dock and have a drink at the restaurants and enjoy the sunset.

Great atmosphere. One of the best places to visit, a welcome change from all the attractions of New Dubai.Must do is the abra ride over to the spice souk, only 1 dirham! If going by metro get off at al raas.

nice to see for a balance to the luxury shopping and outings. it was a nice contrast to see something outdoors and simple as opposed to the luxury living style the city offers in terms of shopping malls and exotic restaurants

Nice and pleasant. You get close to all of the historical Dhows and can get up close to them. The best bit is the ride across the creek on the Abra for 1aed each way you can't get any cheaper than that.

Abracadabra. What an amazing experience I love doing this every time is go Dubai and never seem to get bored. This time round I docked the government boat which cost 3 dirhams and it was empty, it was lovely the driver gave me a full on history lesson about Dubai and pointed out all his local knowledge. It was so lovely and such am amazingly traffic free way to travel in Dubai. This is a must you need to try it!

nice ride across the creek. for the low price of 1 dirham you can catch an abra across the creek for a nice bit of old Dubai experience it a nice way to travel across and back while you sit with the locals and take in the views

The only place where you can ride in 1 Dirham. These abras are part of the tradition of city. The docks are ok and Arbas are worth a ride. Open wodden boat with heavily polluting diesel engines but still fun.

Charming!. For one 1 AED, you can already cross the historic Dubai Creek from Bur Dubai to Deira. Another 1 AED and you can get a ride back. We took one at night, and it was such a lovely evening ride with the beautiful sight of the bright and colorful dhows also sailing along the Creek. It is definitely a must-try in Dubai.

Authentic Dubai experience. This part of Dubai called the Dubai Creek is a really great place to get the feel of old Dubai. The Abra boats are very interesting and for 1 dirham it is cheaper and more exciting, and better than a taxi ride to the other side where you get off at the Gold Souk. You cam arrange to have a private tour on your own Abra not sure of the cost but I would suggest rather cheap compared to a larger modern boat. The walking path that takes you to the boats goes through the old souk and there is a huge amount of shops to make your way through, this also adds to the adventure.

Fantastic experience. Me, my husband and our 17 month old son went to the dock and went on an abra for 1AED each! We went across to the gold souks. The journey lasted a few minutes and we took our son in his stroller. We'd definitely recommend people did this! We got there via the metro and managing to find our way walking!

A must in Dubai. A trip with the Abra is a must when in Dubai. There are people standing on the docks trying to get enough people on the boat, and when they have it they cross the Dubai Creek. This trip is almost for free, you pay only 1 AED per person. We made this trip, and a private round trip. For the private tour we paid 120 AED for both of us. Also really cheap for one hour round trip. The driver gave us almost a bit a guided tour because he told a lot about Dubai and from the area where he was driving us. A unique experience!

An Abra Anyday!!!!. After leaving the Dubai Museum, my family and I walked a short distance to the Bur Dubai Abra Dock, where we chartered an Abra for 30 minutes for AED50 (approximately £10). We had a very enjoyable and relaxing boat ride down the creek. It felt sublime experiencing old Dubai so soon after our museum visit. We disembarked at the spice souk and ventured on to Palm Diera on foot. Definitely a must-do if in Dubai.

Old times charm. Dubai's history is centred around the creek. Before modernisation creek was the hub for trading, dwelling, pearling and fishing trades. Take a ride across the creek on wooden abra boat. You can combine it with museum visit. Its located in meena bazaar that offers great shopping for gold, indian textiles and other knick knacks. Nearest metro stn is Ghubaiba. The abra takes you to gold souk on the other side of thecreek. You can sight old dubai homes with wind towers on both sides. Good fun for dh 1 in shared abra and 120 for exclusive ride.

Nice. Charming old Dubai. Take one to visit the souqs on the Deira side to avoid parking hassles. Hop on one even if you dont have to. 1AED/pax. Couldnt see any life jackets though (maybe its hidden?).

Boat ride to remember. This is one of the best kept secrets in Dubai. For about 120 Dirhams for an hour, you can rent an entire boat for a ride along Dubai Creek. We found the ride to be very relaxing with beautiful views of the various Souks and mosques. if you are short on time, you can take the one way ride to cross the creek for about 1 Dirham. The ride across takes about 5 minutes.

little venice?. the abra ride is nice and so cheap ( 1 dhm or 30 cents!!!) its a nice ride especially on a hot day, since the breeze is so cooling. It is fun to see the wooden ships along the creek and imagine how life would have been like. The only way to go from Bur Dubai to the gold/spice souks.

So full of character. Took a trip on an old Abra on the creek it was lovely taking in the hectic life and sounds of the area where you can see bothe old and new sights a lovely relaxing way to spend an hour or so highly recommend and it is so cheap.

Older Dubai. You can find Dubai Metro, Taxis, Dubai Buses, Exotic Cars at all the hooks and nooks of Dubai. Bur Dubai offers you an experience which is fun enough and explores the traditional way of Transportation in Dubai. At just 1 AED per ride, This is cheaper than anything else. The docks are an experience in itself. It's hassle free as well.The ferries can be a bit noisy and fumy for some.I would recommend to have a ride once if in Dubai and you might get a taste of How Dubai has evolved.

Fare price has not increased!. This must be the only expense in Dubai which has not gone up with inflation or greed! The fare remains at one dirham. I guess because a dirham coin is easy to transact and people of all backgrounds use the Abra. What a wonderful way to cross the Creek. However, you can hire an Abra for a private "sail"! Haggle over the price. Remember always that the skipper has a family to support somewhere in Asia. He is not a sheikh!!

Definitely worth it!. We stayed in the Sheraton creek hotel and an abra dock was minutes from the hotel, great value and took us the the souks in minutes. Like a private cruise as we had the abra to ourselves! The creek area is lovely and definitely a visit.

Cross in old style. do take a dhow from Abra to visit the Spice and the gold souk across the creek by hopping in these boats. The chtges per person is one Dirham to cross the ccreek and land in Dierra. from Bur Dubai.

Cheapest fun time on a boat. The abras take you across Dubai Creek from the Bur Dubai area where the textile souks is to the Deira side where the gold and spice souks are. The five minute boat ride carries about 15 people per boat and only costs 1 Dirham (27 cents). Best deal in town!
Pleasant. took an abra in the evening with my amily. they charged us just 20 dirhams which would have otherwise cost us a lot more

the best boat ride in old dubai. After visiting mins bazaar mum and I jumped on to the abra with great glee. Could not believe fee of 1dirham. It gave us the best views of old dubai and it was the best ride ever. It took us to the spices and gold souk in just under 8 mins. The Abras do get crowded at times so you may wait in line 5 to 10 mins. But worth it. We then crossed back and went for late dinner in mina bazaar which is the Indian shopping centre restaurants
I like it. I like the atmospheric and the markets around - the facility was basic but a very cheap and good views around

Abra on the Creek. This where you catch the little Abras across the Dubai creek, depending on which side you start, There is the spice and gold souk one side, and the old renovated souk and Arabic restaurants on the other. I always take my visitors there and the Abra is dirt cheap, leaving the dock every minute, so no waiting.
Catch a boat to the gold area. Whilst visiting the city with an expat local he took us over the river on these boats to see the gold shopping are, worth a look and the trip was pleasant!
piece of history. walk into the old world charm at this abra dock, take a tour of the city at a reasonable price and soak in the surroundings, all at one place

Boat Ride for 1 Dirham. It is a must visit and experience places in Dubai. Take the abra (boat in Arabic) to cross from one side of Bur Dubai to Deira and pay only 1 Dirham. Takes 10 minutes to reach the other side. Good experience. Can take the same to come back to the origin.

This is an old Dubai ). It is a lovely place to go as a couple. Old Dubai. Make sure, that you bargain with boat drivers, if you decided to rent the whole boat just for yourself. And this is the best thing you can do to make it romantic. Buy some popcorn, which they sell there as well and then you can feed seagulls and they will keep following your boat during the trip. The rental price should be around 30 $ for 1 hour ride.
nice traditional experience. take a traditional abra ferry across the river to the gold souk, and spice souk. great photos at sunset

enchanting. The Abra ride across the creek is just a dirham per head. The place is dotted with small cafes and shops selling all kinds of touristy stuff, but its clean...and its safe. So a great place to sit down, do nothing, except perhaps a couple of Abra rides up and down the creek, sip some jasmine tea, listen to the periodic 'azaan' from the nearby mosques and (as the sun goes down) soak in the lights of old Dubai as they simmer in the creek waters. Enchanting!!!!

A great experience. Here you can see old wooden dhows which look like they have escaped from a pirate film loaded with goods, destined for a journey which seems impossible. A very different experience yet one which reflects the try working life in Dubai.
FUN LITTLE AUTHENTIC BOATS!. Liked: For 'coins' the sail along the creek to the Spice Souk - felt the Arabic culture from a bygone era Disliked: Getting onto the Abra (boat)

Meena Bazaar!. I went with my colleagues on our free and easy day during our company trip and we took the abra from the other side, Deira Old Souq station to Bur Dubai station for AED1 only (one way). The ride was short but breezy. The abra excreets a strong petrol smell when departing from the docks so best to sit further away from the engine. You pay for your abra ride to the ticket collecter on the abra itself. He will be sitting/standing in the middle of the abra. There are 4 stations altogether where each station leads you to different part of the Dubai Creek such as the Gold Souk, Spice Souk and Textile Souk - which is Meena Bazaar. Do drop by Meena bazaar for some good pashimina shawls (100% cashmere) for as low as AED10 each. Really good place for all knick knacks and anything local including souvenirs.
Great. Crossing the abra is again great you get those small ferrys at 1 drm each worth the experience, you can also take a cruise

a trip down the Creek. A great idea to show visitors a touch of " Old Dubai".Rent an abra for an hour and sail past the Dhows full of electronics on their way to India,Iran and Africa.A lovely way to spend an afternoon before a visit to Deira and the spice and gold souks.
Abra Ride - Water Taxi. Charges you 1 or 2 Durhams to cross the Creek to the other way. Must do for experience. Saves the cost of the Taxi too. But the experience is Awesome!

Didn't care for... Right across from infamous "Gold Souk", which is pretty exhausting.. having to have been "harassed" and "haggled" all day.. The dock was very busy, with lots of boats and cargo / old wooden cargo ships.. Wasn't really very appealing.. just took some pics and left..
Fun. Take the abra across the creek for a few pence. Great fun and are run by old washing machine engines. I go back and forth several times.

Great experience. I was a bit dubious about these boats in fact I did have a bit of a wobble but it was great. Went to the spice souk and bought some lovely fresh spices to take home. Would go again for sure 😄
Need to do the river crossing!. Well worth the 1dhs for crossing the river! It is something you have to do in Dubai! An experience that I would call original, not lots of money pumped into it!

Highlight of our Trip. Having visited all the major attractions in Dubai, I was a little suprised that crossing the creek on the abras was the highlight of my trip. There is something magical and timeless about it that I cant really explain. Don't miss it.

The Original Dubai. Not much left of the old Dubai but this is it. A cheap means of travel across the creek - shared by locals and tourists alike. 2dhs for a journey. the dock is a hive of activity and good place to watch people. Close to the textile area and enables you to cross to the gold and spice souk's.

Accient Treasure. Loved to Travel in public as well as personal transport in ABRA.
Shared boat charges 1 Dhs per head. Personal Caharges 40 Dhs for whole Boat no matter how many travel.

Nice Experience. I have been living in Dubai for the past 3 years, but when i used this transportation i felt alive more than any other activities. then i discovered that it's a way of transportation for many people rather than a touristic activities :)it's time saver, cheap and tradition. it will cost you only 1 Dhs to cross the Creek and save more than 45 min including parking.then you can cross from Bur Dubai to Deira and walk toward Gold Souk, old market and feel oriental side of the amazing Dubai
Culturally Abra !!!. Abra rides between Deira and Bur Dubai fascinated me!!! It was amazing!!! worth a ride!!! Cheap convenient and makes you feel like hop skip and jump!!!

A must visit place. If you are in dubai...This place is a must visit without fail...just pay 1 And to reach the this place thru boat....its an awesome thing...This is an old place dividing the two places by river...

1001 Nights. Old and new together, sitting on the docks, having a lemon mint iced drink, you feel as if you return back in time, when old wooden boats carried the treasures of the orient and small, fragile abra transported busy merchants from one shore to the other. The shouts of the seagulls, the calling of the merchants, the turquoise of the sea and the sharp wind gives you the feeling of out of time.

An absolute must do when in Dubai. Taking an Abra across Dubai Creek is truly an authentic local experience. Run by the municipal transit authority, the Abras are still used by thousands of residents to cross the creek. The cost is next to nothing and it is a ton of fun. We stayed at the Sherston Dubai Creek and there was an Abra station a five minute walk away. We used it to get to the Old Souk and back as well as to the Gold Souk. During the late afternoon "commute" it is absolute mayhem as dozens of Abras shuttle people back and forth - this is best the best time to experience it.

Just historic value Nothing special. its located at a historical old place in the creek at the dividing line between the two , near the rock is a folding bridge which is worth seeing once , But dont think if u miss this place you missed something really historical which was not to be missed , Thesedays construction is going on so even u not go here u will not miss something !!! this is one of the old historic local ferry dock

Relaxing. This was part of our tour. The nice part is that there were only four of us on the boat. It was a nice, slow ferry ride where you could catch a quick, up close view of the merchant dhows that Moore along the creek. Ours took us over to the spice souk where we could have a look-see. I would do it again.

A touch of the old Dubai. Here you can imagine what it was like before Dubai became a tourist hub. One of the last places which has genuine flair and where you mix and mingle with the locals (not Emiratis of course). Side by side you sit next to a laborer or a shopkeeper - the abra isn't much used by tourists - and need to shout a little to make yourself heard above the noise of the motor. Above all you feel the wind in your hair, smell a multitude of scents and odors, move up and down with the swells - a delightful experience.The Abra crossing from Bur Dubai to Deira is not only cheap - 1dhs - but also convenient because there is something to see and do on both sides of the creek.
Cheap and quick. It is a cheap and quick way to get to the other shore in 5 minutes for less than 0,50 EUR. If you go there at night, you can take a nice photos from the shore.
gives u a feeling of local. good experience...mostly used by locals...just 1 dh to cross the creek..good view from the abra water taxi deck

In Dubai You have to use Abra. Dubai Abra is something special as the Creek as whole. Abra system is interesting and also effective and You need it if You will see the most interesting part of Dubai: Souqs An abra takes 20 persons and it leaves when all the 20 are on board ,normally every minute.And the cost is only one dirham =25 cents.In Bur Dubai there are two abra stations after the Rulers office in the bur Dubai covered souq The Qhubaiba metro station is the nearest metro.The most western abras leave for The Spice souq.There You can walk through the souqs also to the Gold souq and the next abras to east for a little more "up" to near The Baniyas Square.

A trip back in time. this has to be one of the cheapest and best experiences anywhere in the Middle East.AED 1 gets you from one side of the creek to the other. There are souks on either side and it truely is a step back in time. Goods are being unloaded on the creek quay and delivered to many of the tiny shops lining the alleys of the marketplace.It's bustling, lively, colourful - I loved it.The boat trip Takes just a few minutes. The boats are open sided and you just hop on and sit down. And if you are a little unsteady there is always a gentle and polite gentleman to give you a little help.It's a stark contrast to the malls but great fun
Best dirham you can spend. Walk on, sit down, pay the driver a dirham, and you're riding with the locals, in old Dubai. Fantastic!

Old place which needs up gradation. You can take a ride in the Arba boat and see the view of old dubai. It takes only one dhiram to cross the dock. You will see many boats and people hustling their way in and out. A cheap way to reach the gold souk

Feel like in the old days of Dubai. Very traditional and only for 1 dhrs. I loved it and amazed with the traffic. You can see a lot of old style boats. The view from the water is also worth to see. You can visit spice souk and buy some saffron. Then the old town and the gold souk.
Full of character. Our taxi dropped us off to catch the Abra across to the souks. Highly recommended, very cheap, great character, chugging down the creek!

heritage. I would not say that there is something great here. Just that some how the city is able to protect and still living back to it old days. the best part is the mode of transport is still very efficient and used by people to commute and as a tourist attraction as well. the best part in the evening is the when commuting one can see large flock of birds passing by the creek. Can be done as a one time experience. The most important of all is that it cost on 1 AED only.

Old World charm. When you visit bur dubai you feel overawed by the old world undercurrents running through it and Abra dock is no different. apart frombeing the cheapest transaport mode from bur dubait to deira, it is a great view to take in the sea side dubai and how it used to be all those years back

My favourite thing in Dubai. A ride in an abra is undoubtedly one of the highlights of a trip to Dubai. These motorized, traditional little boats will whisk you across Dubai Creek quickly and give you a unique perspective on the older parts of the city. It is quite a fun experience and at only 1 dirham per trip it is the best bargain in the city. If you are catching the Big Bus hop on hop off tour, get off at Stop 5 (Old Souk) on the red route, catch the abra across to Deira Old Souk station, walk along the quayside past the dhow moorings to Sabkha abra station and ride back to Dubai Old Souk and back to Stop 5 via the Old Souk itself.

Great local transport. It's only 1 Dhs. You get a cool river ride across the Dubai Creek, get to mingle with locals and local river traffic. You can watch the dhows go by and even some big yachts. It's a refreshing little sit down trip. It's also the easiest way to get across the river when you're sightseeing from one side to the other.

Quite an experience. The bargain of Dubai - a 1Dirham Abra trip across the creek. The Abra can be quite crowded but that all adds to the experience of the trip across the busy creek. Gives good views of the dhows being loaded for their trips back to India etc. A must do if you are visiting the museum of Dubai & the souks.
LOCAL EXPEREINCE AT ABRA RIDE. We used local shared abra ride to cross over from Bur Side of Dubai to Deira Side to see spice souk and Gold Souk... It was nice experience to sail in this..
Do this. . It's refreshingly cheap, what else is in Dubai?! Really lovely just jumping on with the locals and you have great views. So good we came back and did a creek tour on one.
Peaceful. The old creek is charming, where goods are offloaded from large wooden boats. A trip on an abra is a must!

Only a Dirham. The abra docks are a must. It is only one dirham. You take the abra a short distance across Dubai Creek from Deira or Bur Dubai. The Deira side terminates near old and Spice souk and Bur Dubai in the historical district. There are lots of abras going to and fro and they are easy to ride. They offer a photo op of the creek and the dhows.

You'll Know You Aren't in Kansas Any More. "Saffron for only 50 Dirhams!" If you don't like the jostle of a market, you won't enjoy the old dock area. But if you can tolerate lots of sellers urging you to look at their wares, you will love the area. The abra (a small taxi boat) costs just 1 dirham (27 cents) and you can cross from the gold and spice souks to the textile souk. It's different; it's fun for people of all ages. Take the metro to get there and add a second adventure.
Heritage Sight. You can enjoy the heritage sight once you are at this Dock. The beautiful very well maintained buildings and the Old Souk ( market) will certainly win your heart.

Nice way to see Dubai. Another more traditional way of Dubai life that is worth taking a spin on. Again avoid doing this on an organized tour - you are too rushed and don't get the chance to linger and people watch which is half the fun of it all.

Just transportation. Abara it's not amazing and not bad, we can say it's just transportation to cross the lake, and in the same time it's fun, it coast 1Dhs, but no need to pay 125Dhs to take a tour for 1 hour

Fun, even for people watching.. Our hotel was nearby so we took the abra to Deira, walked around the Gold and Spice Souks, then returned to the Bur Dubai side.Some people tried to stay on the boat in an attempt to take the return ride for free. They were told that they would have to disembark and get into another abra. At 1 dirham per person per ride, it is not a financial hardship to pay the fare again. :-)The next day, we sat on a nearby bench and watched all the activity for 30 minutes. Twice, we observed men tossing stale bread to the seagulls. In the evening, we walked past and observed the abra activity for 10 minutes. Not as busy as the daytime, but still amazing to watch passengers climbing into the abras with barely any light.

The real Dubai - not to be missed. 1 AED per trip compared with 75 AED in Madinat for an Abra ride. The chaos is part of the charm. If you negotiate, you can hire your own Abra for an hour cost about 75 AED. They will take you the full length of the Creek up to the bridges.
Great place to walk around. We actually got to it from the underpass near the Gold Souk and had the whole waterfront walk pretty much to ourselves

soooo cheap. Brilliant was to cross the creek in the souk area. We caught the metro from the Mall of Dubai to the dock (station was very close and convenient) where we hopped on an abra. It cost 1 dhirum which is about 20p. The boat we were on had 22 passengers and it was comforting to see that safety was well catered for, there were TWO life rings so no worries there. the crossing takes just 2 or 3 minutes and saves an awful lot of time driving and trying to park in the souks.

Great way to cruise the river. Just a great little trip across the river. A great contrast to all things huge and flashy in Dubai. There isn't much that you can do for under $1 but thisd is one thing.
Good to travel by abra. Abra station dock is situated in bur Dubai on the bank of Dubai Creek. Very easy travel from Bur Dubai to Deira. ( Gold souk).

Not that great. It is a short trip, the Abra are boats run by diesel, so expect some smoke while you are sitting in it. However, I think you should try it because every tour guide is talking about Abra.
You can get through it to Old Dubai Souq.

Refreshing... Board and Abra near Al Gubaiba Metro Station to do a to and fro between Bur dubai and deira , bur Dubai has Meena Bazar and Deira has Gold Souk and Spice Souk. Cost 1 AED but you can just do a round about to enjoy the old dubai through waters.

Experience It!. One of the few cultural remnants left in Dubai, besides being a fast and effcient way to cross the creek it is also a great way to experience Dubai like the locals. That being said the cost is 1Dhs per/person make sure not to pay anymore than this!

Take a ride on the creek. If you want to ride on an abra this is great, for jsut a few dirhams you can cross the creek, better than spending a lot of time and money on a creek cruise if you just want to experience the abra ride!

Great afternoon out. We loved going to Bur Dubai and going on the Abras (wooden boats) 3 of us paid 20aed each to have one to ourselves and got a lovely cruise down the creek for 30 mins. Old Dubai doesnt get enough credit its stunning and full of culture. Souks are there to do a bit of shopping and bargaining its definitely worth a look when on holidays in Dubai.
Fun. Really enjoyable & cheap! Ferries fantastic value, great views of the city and historic attractions from the water.

Across the Creek. Go to Bur Dubai Abra Station in order to take one of the darty little boats across the creek and to see the Gold Souk on the other side. Riding an abra is the best way to see the creek and it is like 30 cents....

Excellent Value. This is great. Only a little charge to cross from one side of the Creek to the other. You can see the Gold Souk and then the Spice Souk, stop and have some fabulous food. Good place to pick up the metro too....

Sea breeze . Must go there and ride on of these abra .. It's crossing the creek between the historical village that includes the museums ,restaurants,cafes,and the houses hotels.. From that area you can travel to the other side of the creek old markets spices ,antiques,gold,and other things.. The abra an old wooden boat. passes you through the gulf breeze at this time of year.i love that so..

Go Abra!. You havent really experienced Dubai if you havent done this! Nostalgic and so cheap, we ended up at the Spice Souk and did also the Gold Souk as it joins up. Try the camel milk chocolate pebbles at the Spice Souk stalls.....they are unique and good!
Lovely. It's just lovely to take this watertaxi. For one dirham you can watch the city from the water and it looks lovely! Cheap and authentic.

Authentic Experience. We hired a local abra for an hour and putt putted up and down the creek, soaking in the atmosphere and taking lots of photos. Our driver was very accommodating and spoke enough English to point out a few things - great fun!
Ride an Abra. Must do while in Dubai. The Creek is a great area to visit and the Abra boat ride is a must do. Especially as it only costs 1 dirham.

A pleasant ride. I took the abra for the locals, which is 1dhs. The ride is smooth. It takes a few minutes to cross from one side to the other side. It is interesting to sit on a plastic platform while the captain stands in a hole in the middle. It offers the opportunity to take pictures of the Abra for the locals and the tourists. The only pity is there are few cafes or restaurants on each side of the creek.

Perfect. It was really funny to use a really old boat to transport across the river just for 1 dirham when you know that everything else in Dubai is very modern and expensive. It was so good we went there twice.

Quaint Dubai. We did a few Abra rides across from Bur Dubai to the Deira side to do a trip to the Souks (Gold/Utensils/Spice Souks)The rides still cost 1AED a person and lasts for about 5 minutes but its a wonderful way to ride the creek as well as to get a flavour of the non-glitzy side of Dubai The Abras are used daily by thousands of workers to get to their locations and back.Watch out for the Dhows ferrying trade across the Gulf as well as the planes taking-off in the background (guess the runway is close by)

Well worth the journey. The abra (boat) ride cost DH$1 per way and the journey takes 10 minutes. This is a much cost effective way than chartering an abra to cross from Bur Dubai to Deira. The Bur Dubai station is right outside the Little India and there are two Hindu temples and stores selling prayer items, well worth the walk along that area. The Deira end meanwhile is within reach of the Gold and Spice souks which is well worth the walk to experience the typical Arabic market. Try this activity early in the morning or right before sunset to have the most magnificent views.

Short ride but fun. A 5 mins ride of the abra"عبرة" with only 1dhs. You can go to Deira's Old Souq by abra. Nearest metro station is bani yas then 2 mins walk until you reach the abra station.A lovely view before sunset when birda are flying around the boat
short and fun. The abra are small boats that take you from bur Dubai to Deira. cheap fees but its short and fun trip.

Cooling breeze from the water.. This is a fun way to see old Dubai and to catch the breeze. Just turn up and the attendant will direct you to a boat that is about to leave. Despite being open sided they feel very secure and the passengers are counted on so there is no overcrowding.

Cheap way to cross the creek. If you plan on going to the gold souk, Festival city or Ikea you will need to cross the dubai creek and the best and cheapest way to do it is the Abra boats. Getting to the dock is a bit of a hassle since no buses or metro goes close. So its either taxi or by foot. We walked some narrow lanes and got to the dock. There was a short line but moved quickly since there are plenty of boats. The ride takes about 5mins and costs just 1 dirham.

A cheap adventure. The abras are really fun and very cheap. Just turn up, there is a board telling you where they go and line up. When the boat arrives, jump on, sit down and pay the driver once you have left. Try and have the correct money. Its not very comfortable and not a great idea for those with mobility issues or very small children.
Memorable trip by wooden boat. We came on the sunset and for 100 dirhams rent an abra for 30 min. trip. We enjoy very nice sight-seeing of old and new Dubai during sunset.Very memorable trip.
The best way to get to the Gold Souk and Spice Souk. This is a must do activity in Dubai. It only costs one dirham per passenger and is a fun way to get across the creek.

A must visit to dubai . The abra are small boats that take you to and fro from the two banks of what divide old dubai - namely deira and bur dubai. They have been doing this for a nominal fees of 1 dirham for the past 25 years unchanged.The thing about the abra is that there are vast number of business and whole sale markets on either side and back in the 70s and 80s these places didn't have any bridges or tunnels so the abra was the shortest way to go around It is still popular with people commuting across as well as tourists
Fun adventure. Get on! Have a ride. Make sure you have a dirham to hand or get your change. Very very Dubai. An absolutely must. Trousers advised.

If you visit Dubai go on an abra.. A traditional boat for crossing the creek. We live in Dubai and always go on the abras. Great way of being on the creek and seeing the spice souk, take an abra across then are the textile souk. Buy some souvenirs.
Abra ride. 1 AED for abra ride - can't complain at that!!!Taken over to the old souk area and typically Arabic mix of vendor "hassle" etc but all part of the fun of the day...

Local and cheap Creek crossing. Being in old Dubai, you definitively need and have to cross the Creek. The spice and gold souk is in Deira, and the Dubai museum and old Bastakiya quarter is in Bur Dubai. What better way to do it as locals on a traditional abra. It's very cheap (1 dirham pp) and fast, around 5 min.Besides that, you can hire a whole abra for an hour or half hour Creek cruise for a reasonable price (15 to 30 Eur). It is definitively worth it and nice.

Short Abra ride. Make sure that you find time to go for a ride across the river. From the markets to the Dubai Museum and the Bastakiya area. While it was not extremely hot, it was nice to have the breeze off the water across the face.

Great fun and culture. Love this penny ride across the river ducking between other boats we do this every time we go to dubai. Spice souk and gold souk on far side and all the boats it's just another world and worth a visit as a contrast from the pristine malls and beach areas

great value for money. loved using this - great way to see the city and so cheap. They are safe, easy to get on and off. There is a timetable and map at the abra stAtions - you can see all of dubai using them if you wish

only one dirham. This is the cheapest bit of sight seeing you can do in Dubai. Take an Abra across the creek for one dirham, the boats fill up quickly and as they cross the Creek you will see the real Dubai at work, far from the glitz of the high end malls. Spend a few hours walking along its banks, and then take another ferry back. have your camera ready amazing photos any time day or night, and what can you do with one dirham coin. Its the best value in Dubai, and you get to mix with the real locals who are very friendly, and want to know where you come from. If you have time cross during the day and again at night, spectacular when the sun sets.

boating in Dubai.
