Abra DUBAII took a relaxing journey to discover Madinat Jumeirah.You can access the tours from the Souk Abra station near Tuscany at Souk Madinat Jumeirah.I have maximum enjoyment and good photo shoots when I was visiting Madinat Jumeirah on - water taxi - Abra tour.I did some pics when we passed through.Abra tour gives the spectacular view and the different angle of the Madinat Jumeirah including the famous Burj Al Arab, Mina Al Salam and Al Qasr hotels.Boat operator explained every detail where we passed, and he was very kind.Abra tour of Madinat Jumeirah, I recommend everyone to use.I will come back again and again.The Fee for an Abra tour is AED 75 per adult and AED 40 per night per child.

Frequently used, love it!. Parking in Deira is a nightmare. So having a next to empty paid parking in Bur Dubai and dozens of abras to take you to the other side, is not just a tourist attraction, it's actually the best option if you want to go from one side to the other. I absolutely love using them

Bur Dubai Abra Dock. This is the nearest a tourist will come to seeing the original old Dubai. Colourful boats and souks.Must take a trip across the creek to see the spice and gold souks. The boat ride costs pennies but hang on tight as there are no safe seats.

Well it was more than we ask. It is something to do and captains of old boats were very handy to stop as there is a difference between dock and boat.Try in night as well as morning.Only 1DHS per person

Great Public Transportation. I love taking the abras across the Creek.Abras are public transportation. They ferry folks from one side of the creek to another for 1 dirham (about 30 cents usd).Every time I have been on an abra has been an adventure. The ride is generally smooth and uneventful. At first it can look like pure chaos on the water with abras ready to smash one another any moment, but this is a well tuned dance with these drivers. They know what they are doing and drive these 'water taxis" just like any other driving in the UAE: chaotic and nerve wracking at times.Docking will either be a smooth entry or a wild moment of bumper cars between the abra and the dock. I am still not sure which one I prefer. And getting off or on the dock or abra can be an adventure. They roll that agra up to the dock and sometimes you gently step off and other times you hurl yourself in the direction you want to go while the abra and dock are bobbing far away from each other.For one dirham- it is well worth the ride.

Loved it!. Don't miss this little boat ride across the Dubai Creek. It's loud, and busy, and a load of fun! You leave the gold and spice souks and the textile souk and Dubai Museum are across the creek. Neat little experience!

Well worth the trip over the Creek. Very interesting to watch the wooden boats being loaded up with just about anything. Cars, washing machines, fridges, televisions, air conditioning units to name a few, you just hope that they get to their destinations without capsizing as they always seem to be overweight.
Cheap and funny. The best and the funniest way how to see both sides of the creek is to take a water taxi - costs only 1 dirham!
Worth the AED1!!. definitely worth it when youre in the area. not very safe for people who are disabled. lovely in the evening.

Very convenient way to cross the creek. After visiting the Dubai museum, we wanted to go to the Spice and Gold souks on the other side of the creek. The abra is a must experience and in just 1 AED you get to cross the creek and reach the souks. My toddler thoroughly enjoyed the abra ride.

Busy. The Abra ride across the Creek should be experienced at least once and for only 1AED it is worth it. Getting to the dock is like running through a gauntlet as you have to pass the "do you want a copy Luis Vuitton bag, sunglasses etc". The actually Abra Station is busy and smelly from the fumes and full of seagulls, but that's what makes it interesting!

Complete contrast to new Dubai. We took the Big Bus Tour and got off at the Dubai Creek to visit the Gold and Spice souks. The crossing by Abra, which is a traditional wooden boat, is a worthwhile experience. The Abra takes about 25-30 people sat back to back in the open and cost 1AED. The Souks are on the other side of the creek and the contrast is vivid in that this is traditional old style Dubai. Worth doing.
Brilliant experience. Been on these 2 years running now and would thoroughly recommended its a great Arabian experience to travel on one of these boats. Drivers very knowledgable and friendly.

A nice refreshing boat trip over the creek.. Costs only 1 dirham.takes about 10 minutes and is fun and a genuin trip. There are few restaurants worth visiting in the areas on both sides of the river. On the south side you might find an ok restaurant facing the river if you enter the souk on your left (with the rive in your bsck) and then first left in the souk.

Well organised. Got on the abra here to cross to the spice souk. We were really impressed by the organisation. An RTA employee was telling people were to go to board the abras, he channelled us to the one that was departing next, all very organised although from afar it looked chaotic. One dirham to cross the Creek is amazing value and the whole experience is so atmospheric. An abra is an open sided flat boat so care needs to be taken getting on and off particularly. Makes you feel very close to the water.......which you are! Hold tight!

Must Visit. We went there while visiting Spice Souq. Turned out to be a wonderful experience. We crossed from Bur Dubai station which is a shor walk from Dubai museum to Deira side ticket is only 1 Dirham and kids are free!! While alighting I asked the guy operating Abra if I can hire it for 1 hour. I was quoted 100 dirhams and then we went for a great tour of Creek. Views are excellent with lots of birds (ducks etc) in water which fly while boats are crossing.We enjoyed the views there are lots of places of interest to see while ride. We went till airport terminal 1 (as per boat driver) and came back.While touring I observed many families did the same hiring Abra for a ride of creek. We also saw couple of cruise (Dinner cruise boats) operating.Overall a good experience.By the way make sure you have sunscreen as it can be hot even in December.
Old school style. its nice that there is still some tradition left in Dubai. The Old Souq and taking the abra across the creek are nice experiences for visitors and residents of Dubai.
Open Boat! Abrah!. This is a must try, at Dubai. Costs only 1 Dhs for one side travel. You can even 'charter' an Abrah for 20 Dhs!

A must visit !!. The cafes on the side of the road look like those in Europe and you could forget that you are in Dubai when sitting in them. The Yatch rides are great fun and so are the cruises. Added bonus is the long line of sports cars driving around in the area.

Oldstyle. When you come here, take and try Abra to across spice souk and gold souk.
It charged only 1 AED and you can feel this old transportation style is amazing!

An experience. . On our 'must do' list whilst in Dubai and certainly an experience. Went across the creek to the spice souk and gold souk. So disappointing. On top of which there were no nice places to eat, no rest rooms, facilities in the area were sadly lacking.

Olde Worlde Meets Modern Dubai. Very interesting afternoon. Was looking for the textile souk but was told I had to cross over the water. Besides which it was Friday and the market would be closed. We did go to the Afghan stall and purchased two silk and one polyester shawl and local arab wear for £100 - being of Turkish extraction I haggled. Fun. Long walk before crossing the water for 1 Dirham!

Something worth a visit... This is specially for visitors to admire the creek with full-on activities of the local abra's in operation transporting passengers from one side to the other.... It's cheap & cost effective way to cross the creek, plus saves a lot of time in traffic...

Bur Dubai Abra Dock 14. I were in Dubai last month (November) I stayed both old Dubai and new modern side.. anyways abra dock and its area were very different and traditional although surrounding areas and shops feels like u are in India where a lot indian restaurant and clothing stores etc.. boat ride from one side to another just a dirham to gold souk/bazaar is great treat for gold lovers. and again plenty option for food. Visitor to Dubai its worth a visit :)

Fun. These Abra water buses are a bit hairy but a great fun experience. Something simple and timeless in this city of the future. A great experience to cross the creek in the same way as the original inhabitants of Dubai did. A good way to see everyday life here

Best place to relax and enjoy in winter. Amazing feel we entered the area through dubai museum thru the galleys of hindu and sikh temple and to the abra area were we got a place. Veiwing the creek amazing viewc cruise and abra boats fill the creek we bought amazing hot snacks from the famous snack shops and had a relaxing time

Nice Abra Dock near Bur Dubai Meena Bazaar. Its a place where you will feel fresh ... good food.. Abra ride ..and yes not to miss the great coconut water taste... beatiful handicraft shops .... irani and afgani spice shops

Worth a visit. If you are in Dubai for a few days, don't miss this one out. Nothing particularly exciting but you can have a nice little boat ride around the creek on a wooden boat, for a very low price. The souk area behind the docks is full of guys trying to sell fake rubbish scarves etc to tourists. Avoid that if you can. It might feel like a middle east experience but in reality, its lot of poorly paid asian guys selling fake junk. Don't get drawn in unless you are looking for a fake watch ofcourse. If you want some authentic arabian clothing, there are plenty of other shops where locals actually get their items from.
Combining heritage with modernity ...... Old style boats motorized to make your travel across the creek faster and cheaper - at just 1 Dirham, it's a very interesting experience.
Authentic other side of Dubai. The other side of rich Dubai. Really authentic and the world of the indian/ pakistan workers. Friendly people who like that you are interested.
Abra Dock... With just 1 dirham u can take a ride on little steamer to commute from Bur dubai to Deira and u can enjoy scenic beauty of Dubai..

Exciting trip. Not much to see at the port itself, but a good way to experience authentic small boat ride across the creek for just 1 dirham. But be warned, they don’t cross straight across, the creek, so plan your journey and where you are going to end up in advance.

A good way to know their culture. It is a good way for tourists to have a different experience of knowing their culture there, the price is cheap too. Occasionally you will meet the locals or foreign workers who use the abra everyday and being very impolite and shoo you to the side so they can have more space to sit.

Enjoyable. The oldest and most economical way to travel across the creek. Amenities are minimalistic, but the journey is rewarding.... reminds one of the Gondola of Venice. The evening rides are the best when its cooler and you see the city lit up. A walk along the wharf is also recommended... you may stumble on something surprising.... you never know.

In sharp contrast of modern Dubai. My Kid liked the boat ride very much. Nice way to go across from Bur Dubai to the old souks of Dubai ( spice souk and gold souk ). They charge only 1 Dirham for a boat ride across the creek. Hard to believe that there is still a old Dubai in midst of all the skyscrapers of Dubai.

Not a big thing but maybe the only thing local. Really a big contrast of this little ride (water taxi) compared with the high towers, the lamborghinis, the ferraris and Palm Island, etc. A good way to get across the creek.

Creek trip. The Dubai creek area is a place to come to see real working Duabi. A trip on an Abra is a daily event for many people. This is not a tourist thing, it is the quickest way for locals to go back and forth. At 1 AED per person, it is worth doing. They can be hired for individuals or families to do a a personal trip, pricenegotiable. Otherwise, it is just an easy way to explore both sides of the creek.
Good old Dubai . A safe, clean and relaxful water trip!was easy on and off. They even stopped and took us to a restroom on the other side. A fun way to see old Dubai.
BIG CONTRAST. It was really a big contrast as you would think Dubai is developed but you still can find some traditional means of transportation. We loved the ride on the creek.

Old Meets New in Dubai. In the last 15 years all that has changed with the abras is safety. What a fantastic way to get across the creek and an experience. These are not only a tourist attraction but a legitimate mode of transportation in Dubai. Well worth a ride and while you can rent them for a tour why not just do a few different crossings to get a taste of Dubai and its people.
Wonderful. Abra is a good experience and cheapest form of transport form bur Dubai to Creek. Traditional Arabic mode of commutation.

The Boat Ride, Dubai Review. One of the attractions at Dubai is the evening Boat ride. We can book the tickets in advance and the ride with food, magic show and cultural program are quite entertaining. The entire family and especially children will definitely like it.

Amazing Historical Look. The Abra Dock was simply awesome. Everyone there is helpful. You have RTA kiosks set up as well. Just 1 AED and you can get on to the other side of the creek. The place is clean, pure air no pollution. Lovely people and lovely place to sit and watch people moving in Abra

motor boat journey. The Old Dubai with the dhow in the creak. We crossed to go for roadside shopping for curios in Bur Dubai. We had lunch an Sri Lankan restaurant. Good food. Good place for buying and prices are negotiable.

There is a traditonal side to Dubai!. The little boats (Abbra's) that ferry you across the creek are just great fun. Small boats 1dirham a trip and they connect the old souls on each side of the creek. A really worthwhile day out to get a feel of what old Dubai and the traders did. Great local food too.

Thrills at AED 1. I loved the experience of a yesteryear's boat ride across the Dubai Creek from Deira to Bur Dubai Museum on the Abra.. the traditional Dubai ferry boat... and all for AED 1 !!! It cant get better than this...

Slow as she goes - Water Taxi. I love to be at creek side and this is still the cheapest and fastest way. Lovely way check out what is in the area from Dur Dubai to the Deira in a short ride. If you do not mind the water it can be one of the safest journeys you will find. Sit back and relax enjoy the ride, You must try it ONE TIME.

Great Experience. It costs just 27 cents for a ride across the creek and takes about 15 minutes. The dock area is neat and so are the abras or small boats that hold maybe 20 people. They leave as so as they are full. Viewing the old part of the city on both sides of the creek is well worth the trip as well.

Very beautiful place to hang around. Like to ambience and restaurants which are on the creek side.Very beautiful place to hang around. you have lots of seesha options with relaxing time with the breeze around
Amazing way.to cross the creek. Very cheap.andbwell.worth it. This.is a must do for Visitors. You can get off to see the textile market of Dubai. Very traditional boats and surprisingly clean

Interesting old fashioned Port. The old wooden boats being loaded with all mod cons being shipped to Iran.All the loading being done by hand no cranes hereJust muscle.Get on a trip up the creek on an Abra,worth the cost.

1 dhiram open boat exp.. Truly this is amazing deal to enjoy open boat exp...weather is fantastic...take the ferry ! This is a commuting channel for public hence to have exclusive boat for yourself; take a speed boat from creek or check at RTA counter and fix for less thro' agent to enjoy 1 hr ride with your family. Do remember to carry refreshments to enjoy ride!

Lovely thing to not miss in Dubai. You can take it at day time as at night, the scene is very nice, you can have a walk by bastakia area the renewed market before taking the abra to the old gold and spice market, the Abra is not to be missed for those whole love authentic trips and area

fun way to travel. Crossing the creek in an Abra is a must, costs about 20 pence per journey, 1 Dirham, takes a few minutes , let's you enjoy the views, and the breeze. Not suitable for wheelchair users, and you would need to hold on to young children as there are no seats or safety rails, but an experience not to be missed

quaint. The abra is a motor launch used by the local to cross over to the old city. The dock have been made more systematic and there are a couple of people over there asking everybody to stay in queue. While the tourists comply, the locals, usually laborers, simply jump queue and rush in. Its not something extra special, but if you want to visit the souk, you will anyway have to go via abra
Good place to take a boat from. Watch old Dubai from the inside and get around at the same time. The boats are comfortable and too not expensive because a lot of people joins at the same trip.

The old history of Dubai makes a presence. We took an abra across the Creek and even if the rida was short the views was good as you saw the old parts of Dubai. Travelling with a abra was also a nice way of transport yourself - but be prepared for crowded boats.

Mingle alongside the locals. This economical boat ride from Bur Dubai to Deira and back allows you to view the comings and goings on the Creek. Once at Deira, you're close to the souks. The promenade on both sides of the Creek is worth walking.

Must try. A visit to Dubai is not complete without a trip on an Abra across the Dubai Creek. It is very cheap and the sights and sounds of the water are great. You board with tourists and locals alike for the 10-15min journey (depending on which dock you are bound for - although all of them are relatively close). Definitely recommend it.

A definite must do in Dubai. Abras are traditional boats that get you across the Creek between Bur Dubai and Deira. Each ride only costs 1 AED. It is a great (and cheap) way to take part in the local culture. Chill out by the Creek and watch the boats go by. The docks are located very near the souqs - traditional markets - on both sides, Bur Dubai and Deira. Half a day's worth of activities for next to nothing. Great for budget travellers.

Abra - cadabra!. You don't need a magic carpet to fly back in time on the Dubai Creek. A one-hour trip (you can also go for half an hour) is 120 dirhams bit we got it for 100 and an abra to ourselves. A leisurely trip down to the floating bridge and back is a pleasant and innovative way of enjoying Dubai - and not expensive. The skyscrapers are magnificent viewed from the creek and passing the small, decorated dhows is a pleasure - and then there are the large ocean-going dhows with prows that rise out of the water way above you! The new juxtaposed with the old! It is a delight.And, of course, you can cross the creek with the locals for 1 dirham - a true bargain!
Cheap fun. For just a dirham you can get to the other side of the Dubai Creek - and in the meantime feel like a local... great!
super. you have to try it !!! It was nice.. 1 person 1 dirham.. super price and nice experience.. you dont need wait long time ... it was nice

Best Fun Experience in Dubai. This is a must for visitors. 1 dirham buys you a trip across the Creek, but it is the organised chaos with boats loading up quickly and going back and forth across the Creek. You need to experience this to believe it. Put to one side any fears of falling in, boat collisions, and sidling up with the locals and take in the absolutely amazing atmosphere and great views. The crossing only lasts 5 minutes, but it is so well worth the 1 dirham.Note: there are two parallel Abra crossing routes about 0.5km apart. Take one of the crossings, walk along the dockside 0.5km, and take the parallel route back. Fridays are really busy with the foreign workers having their day off to meet up at the Abra crossing on the Spice Souk side with their friends and make phone calls home etc.You can also book an Abra to just take your party down the Creek but do not know price. This is a more genteel way to experience the trip on an Abra.

This is Dubai. Visited Dubai 7 times and cant believe I haven't been before , its just magical . We took a tour for half an hour up the creek it was wonderful. I really felt so relaxed , it was lovely to see the working boats . Next time I visit I will be sure to come back again .

The best and the cheapest attraction in Dubai. This experience is a must for all travellers to Dubai. For one dirham (18p) you can take a boat trip across Dubai Creek between 07:00 hrs and 23:00 hrs any day of the week. No reservations are necessary as the boats leave every two minutes (there are many many of these boats on The Creek). Each boat holds approximately 20 people and this is the mode of transport for local people as they go about their daily business.The views of a working city are fantastic from these boats and at night when the lights of Dubai are blazing, it is an awesome feeling to be taking a trip where the weather is still hot late at night and lots of different types of boats are festooned with lights as they travel up, down and across The Creek - it's quite magical.DO NOT MISS THIS!!

Relaxation and time traveling. its very nice experience to ride, safe. and like to ride again and again
it bring you to old times ;)

Fun Tourist Thing To Do. We hopped in the Abra after visiting Dubai Museum on our way to the Spice and Gold Souks. If you're in Dubai, this is a must-do tourist thing. We took it at night, which was enchanting. Perfect weather, lots of lights lining the horizon, with a drop-off exactly where we wanted to be. A nice little evening adventure. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Chaotic at peak times but fun. The abbras are the main way of crossing the creek. The docking area is chaotic as people jostle to get onto the abbras. Health and safety forget it. 1 dirham for the experience is money well spent. They give easy access to the spice souk and gold souk which are only a few minutes walk from the far side of the creek. Gives a good view of the skyline while crossing.

1 Dirham boat stop to Gold souk. It is boat docking place and locals/tourists wanting to hop on a convenient 1 AED shared boat ride to opp bank Old souk thru which Gold souk etc can be reached quickly and cheaply . Boat services can be availed early morning to late night
Great Adventure. We visited the Spice Souk before taking a wonderful Abra ride across the Creek to visit Hindi Lane and the Dubai Museum.

Hot as. Wanted to experience the abra as it's close to the museum. Unfortunately the museum was closed so we took the abra across the creek anyway. Nice and cool on the water and a bit of fun in 45 degree heat!

Give it a try!. A great way of getting to the gold and spice souks using a transport method that goes back generations - and costs a pittance. A gentle drift across the creek an a simple craft - perhaps not for those that are nervous of water or could possibly have a disability that may impair them getting on and off (although there is plenty of help on hand for the latter). Some years previous to this trip (2003) we hired an abra to take us up and down the creek - really worth the trip at night (cost is amazingly low)

Interesting. Great way to get from textile souks to spice & gold souks. It costs 1 dirham, takes 5 minutes & you get a clear view of both sides of the creek, worth seeing as a contrast to the technology in the rest of dubai.

1 AED ride. One of the oldest transpiration system in dubai.. and one the easiest and faster way to reach deira from burdubai.. if you are tourist ride is worth to explore and in case resident best way to avoid traffic by paying just 1 AED..

Authentic Visit. Felt like I was transported back in time seeing all these Abra's lined up moving up and down the creek. It was in complete contrast to Downtown Dubai's ultra modern image. It gave you an insight into how Dubai originally was and that in itself was an experience that I will always remember. definitely worth a visit and for the price, a truly worthwhile experience.

Do It Only During Winter Time!. Never ever do this during summer time.
We ended up dripping when we left the boats.
It was a different experience, knowing we only paid 1AED to cross the river (one-way)!

Pleasant cheap boat ride. We crossed from the textile souk to the gold and spice souks about mid morning. The ride is not straight across the river as we did get a short ride along the river. We were riding with the locals and enjoyed seeing the other type of boats moored along the riverbank. We did watch a lot of the abras sailing across the river one evening which was very interesting as they were crowded with passengers and in danger of colliding. It only cost 1 dirham each way so good value.

Best 1 Dirham spent in Dubai. When in Dubai you must travel on an Abra at least once. They cross Dubai Creek from Deira to Bur Dubai in just over 5 minutes. Bur Dubai Dock is busy and a convenient stepping off point to explore old Dubai and the Bastakiya quarter. Here you will find Dubai's oldest buildings dating back to over 200yrs old. If you look closely you will see some bricks are made from coral.

great rides. I use to use the abra's in the past a lot. The olden ones when we paid 25 fils. I liked the simplicity and convenience how to cross from A to B.The rides are still one of a kind.I don't like the new boots crossing, as they are very modern and I love the old Dubai style. Arabic - local heritage that's important to keep alive!

Just try it. It's fun!. I never thought to see this in Dubai considering it's a well developed modern city. But this touch to Dubai's culture makes it a more amazing place to be at. It will only cost you 2 dirhams for a ride! And it's best to do it in the afternoon or after sunsets so you can see the nice Dhow (traditional sailing vessel) passing decorated with fine colorful lights.

A must do. Escape the malls and modernity and experience the old Dubai by finishing your Bur Dubai Souk stroll with a boat ride accross the Creek to the Spice and Gold Souk on the Deira side of the Creek. It's a fun ride on a traditional water taxi and it only costs 1 AED! It also presents amazing photo oportunities.
Great view of old Dubai. The view is fantastic, Do a stroll around the area and look for spice stalls and other interesting shopping places get at a normal price rather than the tourists hyped price.

Abra Rides.... If you wanna see old Dubai and how people use to travel prior this is it..A Single trip and cheapest means of Transport from Deira to Bur Dubai and vice versa. Yes, it costs just "1 Dirham" to travel.Try travelling during the evening to enjoy the cool weather and also see the Old Souqs light up and feel the real heritage.

A Must Do at the Dubai Creek. For only 1 dirham each way, an abra water taxi takes you across the Dubai Creek from the textile souk to the gold souk. It's fun to be out on the water in the early evening when it is busy and the abras are crossing in front of each other. Great "old Dubai" experience.

Have a ride. Abra taxi is a wooden ferry which help you to cross the creek, it runs from dubai creek and take you to the gold souk and vice verse. It is very cheap and fastest way to cross this distance. It is a fun ride , if you are here have a try.
Do cross the river. Do go and cross the river on the traditional wooden ferry... Great fun and an original way to experience the atmosphere of the Creek area.

very nice. very nice experience in this. Like wood structure.
feel you are in old time traveler.
i feel it is not costly.

plenty of action!. This area is definitely a must see if you want to experience the older side to Dubai. Granted the place isn't steeped in history but the dock area is fascinating. Take a trip or two on the wooden Abra taxis sat amongst locals and fellow tourists costing 1AED for a single trip across the river to/from the gold and spice souk side. On the northern gold souk side are the big wooden dhow boats lined up stacked with fridges, freezers, carpets, etc. Best time to visit is around sunset when you can stroll along the river in cooler temperatures and watch the locals loading up the boats. Head back over to the south side and visit the cafe which overhangs the river where you can watch the boats go past. The museum is also not far from here which is worth a visit.

Abra ride rocks!!. We travelled by Abra when we wanted to buy some gold from the market! Abra ride is very cost effective and it will cost only 1 AED per person plus the experience is amazing. Abra dock was close to our hotel so we walked upto the dock and took the boat. The journey took us only 30 mins to reach and again the surroundings were very beautiful. We saw rare species of birds flying around with some amazing Dubai infra.The abra drops us very close to the main market with minimum walking distance. Must visit abra not only to save money but also for the experience!!
Must to do!!!!!. When u visit dubai, must be go there. Because you can see man made of river. They call creek. And you must be pay with nol card or take one boat to check the veiw.

"Experience some old Dubai". Not far from the Gold Souk is Dubai Creek where we took a ride along the creek in an Abra for half an hour. It was a relaxing way to see the old and new Dubai, we had the whole Abra to ourselves for a small price which is agreed upon before the ride then you pay at the end. It is a great thing to do that is not fast paced.

Highly recommended!. We took a round trip around the creek which is definitely very nice to do. The tour was private for four persons, if I remember correctly it was 120 dirham for four. It's great to have a look at the modern and older buildings, in a beautiful boat with a cooling breeze.

Definitely a must while in Dubai. The abra boat rides are a must while visiting Dubai. It will make you feel like you are in another country unlike all the fancy hotels. The textile, spice, and gold souks/markets are all in the area.While riding them you will get transferred from one side of the creek to the other for only 1 dirham. Do not pay more than this. There are several boats along the creek that will try to sell you on a group ride for 60-100 dirham. Just walk down the creek towards the ocean and you will find the proper abra dock at the end of the textile souk.
Fun. Great experience to do in Dubai. We did it as part of a tour. But they are very cheap and leave the docks once full. They carry about 20 people.

Old Dubai for only 1 AED. This is a must for visitors. AED1 buys you a trip across the creek but it is the organised chaos that you need to experience. Put aside any fears of falling in, boat collisions, and sidling up with the locals and take in the atmosphere and marvellous views. The crossing may only last 5 minutes, but it is so worth the AED1.TIP: there are two parallel abra crossing routes about 0.5km apart. Take one of the crossings, walk along the dockside 0.5km, and take the parallel route back.

1 AED and fun worth a million. I do this as a ritual when ever I go to Dubai.they have abras ( small boats) with a dim light which take you across the creek and its an experience for sure.I would rather do this as compared to a dhow cruise.

Authentic Ride. The abras located in Bur Dubai is a great authentic way to get wonderful views of the area. It is also a cheap form of transportation for crossing the waterway to the gold and spice souk.

History. The whole placing is buzzing some abra boats which can either take you across the creek or a tour of the creek. 1dhs or 20dhs both great value. Look out for the big wooden boats which sail to Africa Asia etc. They had brand new fridge freezers lined up waiting to be loaded. It got me thinking if this was glasgow the freezers would have a "walked". Go see this place it reminds you that the "old dubai is still Ali e

Unparalleled views of the creek. First of all, this only costs 1 dirham. You pay during the ride.The abras were frequent and only took about 5 minutes to cross the creek. It's a great way to experience old Dubai and is still used by many locals. It gives you amazing views of the creek with old Dubai on one side and newer buildings on the other.The boats have no boarding plank so when getting on and off, if you're with someone, I found it best to help each other on and off. The abras also have no sides but I found the journey to be very smooth so I never felt unsafe. So long as you stay sitting you should be fine.

Dubai Creek: Experience Old Dubai by Abra. One of the most authentic experiences to explore the Creek, a wide saltwater inlet which divides the two main city centres of Dubai - districts of Bur Dubai and Deira, is on board a **traditional Abra**.Enjoy an 1-hour ride up and down **Dubai Creek** and discover its surrounding areas. It is a very different experience comparing to all the skyscrapers. Dubai Creek is the **heart of the old city** providing a perfect snapshot of Dubai’s amazing contrasts between old and new, traditional houses, wind towers and minarets mixed up amidst the modern development and glassy high-rises.
quick and efficient. get a flavor of local travel, the water taxi costs 1 Diram per trip, loads and unloads quickly and the crossing takes 5 minutes.

Worth a trip. For one dirham you can cross from one side to the other. Depending when you try and cross it can be busy. One of the few 'old' Dubai features left in this kingdom. They will probably soon replace them with high speed boats!

TIME TRAVEL. This place takes you to back to 80s-90s.The place is hustle and bustle with traders,shoppers and tourists.Great to find a place still retaining its old essence in the middle of fast growing high rises in Dubai.The Abra ride itself is an experience which will take you to old days.The price was only 1 AED to cross the creek and now a days i can even use my NOL card for water taxis.

The real Dubai. Both the Bur dubai and Deira Abra sides are special. It gives you a feel of how Dubai really was. I am born in Dubai, so maybe once a while I do visit the Abra to remember my old school days with friends, as to save money we used the Abra for 50 fils to cross from Deira to Bur Dubai. If you have extra days in Dubai, you can visit, but for anyone not from Dubai, I suggest go to the Dubai Marina Yacht club. Or maybe if you are visiting the Gold Souq in Deira, you can stop by here.

Great. Been there before and went there again, best part of Dubai. If you want a bit of old amongst the new then this is the place to be. Take a ride on the abra around the creek and take in the views especially at night.

Ancient and new Dubai combination is seen and felt here. Beautiful Abra ride on the creek, reaching the spice market and gold souk too. Lovely perfumes to buy and spices too. Good local clothes shopping can also be done, lots to see about old Dubai.
Loved it.. It's a short ride across the creek but it's breezy, you get a great perspective on the new and old parts of the city and it's cheap!

Nice. Very very tipical, a "real" thing in Dubai.
For just 1 aed, you can cross the creek on this wooden boat.
During sunset time these 10 minutes are even more charming.

a lovely walk. Visiting dubai is an experience that everyone should try atleast once. Although with such high humidity i hated walking outside in dubai this was one place where i really enjoyed walking along the dock. A serene place and very different to the hustle and bustle of the dubai malls.

Nice trip down the creek. I hired an entire boat for myself for AED150. It was a long and nice trip in the evening. When the wind stopped blowing, the heat became oppressive. Take a bottle of ice cold water - to drink and also to wash your face with, if you go during peak summer, like I did.
Great views. See the pics.

No visit complete without an abra trip. Travel by abra to see the creek, mingle with locals not selling anything and feel the breeze on a hot summer day. An experience we love when travelling here on holiday. A longer trip on a private basis can easily be arranged, try and get an owner who speaks good English to explain the sights along the way.

Nice way to see hidden parts of the city. Nice, inexpensive way to cross the creek and get to the souks. Traditional method of travel for the locals, this also serves the tourist as a nice alternative to taxis. Cooler on the water and more scenic for sure. What you accomplish in a few minutes on the Abra would take a taxi 15 minutes by road.It is a nice reminder of the roots of the emirate culture.As you can see from the photo, it is an open wooden boat with no creature comforts, but hat a way to travel!!

Difficult to find the Dock but worths the experience. We got out of the metro and finding the exact place to take the boat was difficult.Once there, is a trip for 2 dirams (super convinient) that takes You across the creek. Very nice wiews of the city.You must visit the souks (gold, textiles and spices) when doing this trip.

A slice of reality in the glitz. Apart from the extremely intimidating walk to the dock (vendors at every turn trying to entice us into their stores) the ride on the Abra was a way to see a more gritty Dubai. It was interesting, reflective, and so inexpensive. It is not a contrived tourist trap, but a genuine way that people travel across the Dubai River.

Something Different. On our first visit to Dubai over 30 years ago this was about the only area to visit. Today it hasn't changed much and is a real experience. My husband and I love this area but my 13 year old son did not like it at all. He found the locals and all the shouting and haggling very intimidating

Simple Short Nice Trip. These wooden Abras remind you of India. Recommended for people who enjoy simple things. If you come from Bur Dubai, choose the jetty that takes you directly to the Spice Market.
Dirty but good. Water is dirty but we enjoyed a water taxi ride, be careful when jumping into the boat you might fall :)

Hollywood Tailors in Bur Dubai. we were over in Dubai for the Abu Dhabi F1 and thought lets come home looking smart so 2 mens suits i got a 3 piece grey pin stripe French cashmere wool mix 2 shirts to my design under £400 dare say if you are local your deal could be better but not by much we did ask around , my mate got a linen suit for a Caribbean wedding plus shirts not sure how much ...but measured Thursday fitting Friday holy day Saturday so picked up on Sunday Excellent work ,worn it a few times fits like a glove the area is busy busy but don't be put off its safe as houses, they do bring you lots of free cups of Tea

Great experience. Another must whilst in Dubai we hired one to our family 60 aed for 1/2 hire along the creek they dropped us off at The gold souk the other side where we had a look, but if you are going over, pleas be ready to be hassled by people trying to sell you fake goods. On the way back we paid 1 aed for the taxi back across which was fun too being on with all the locals. Kids loved it to.
The feel of OLD Dubai. Best place for cheap but wonderful shisha, arabic food and just sitting down staring at the dock. One of my favorite places to have coffee in Dubai.

Great place to see Abra (water taxis) and barges. It is a hive of activity. Barges loading with all sorts of good (e.g. fridges, TVs, washing machines, rice) to deliver along the Creek.we went on an Abra to the other side to the Spice Souk and gold Souk. it was fun.
Great ride. After the gold and spice souk we took an abra for 1/2 hour up the creek and got the driver to drop us on the other side where we went to the fabric marketsCheap and interesting
One Dirham. I enjoyed take this one dirham shuttle from a dock to another.It's the quickest way to cross the bur dubai.

Experience old Dubai. We took a wander through the Bastakia Quarter, making our way eventually to the Abra Dock (after exiting the Souk) where for just AED1 p/person you can cross the Creek on one of Dubai's very local, authentic water taxi's. You just hop on and pay the captain :) The journey takes approximately 7 minutes to reach the other side and is such a treat to commute with the locals as well as have views from the water. It was a definite highlight for us and would recommend it to anyone.
Fun shopping. Very enjoyable way to do your souvenir shopping, traders are very witty and will give you a great laughter, while picking up some good presents.

Don't go unless in good weather. It's a moderate place where u can have a walk by the water, but dont go unless in winter or good weather because of humidity and high temprature u wont enjoy at all.
Arround you can find some crowded markets .. local styles .. as well as some cruises for dinner.
great to visit. Brilliant - worth the visit - there are tours that take in this area along with the water park and others

Gem of Dubai!. Well this place is for Dubai what New york and London dock is for their inhabitants.its gives such an exhilarating view of both islands of Dubai i.e. Bur Dubai and Deira. There are food court on both side of the docks and its very cheap traveling between the both due to economical RTA ships running every half an hour. Gem!

really different from the city. it was an eye opener, rather dirty and very dark !, the abra across the water is rather scary and only costs approx 20p. The souks was a bad experience, the shop owners will constantly grab you to enter their shops and i was even pointed in the chest area ! i could not wait to get out

calm and quite place to chill. its an open deck with shisha parlours i your vicinity...its close to the very happening local street market of dubai- the meena bazar. Centrally located with good quite water body.
you can view the dhow cruise and enjoy the ride as well with affordable and averance expense. Or just grab a sheesha and enjoy the evening by the bay :)
Fabulous water taxi and ride. A safe, clean and relaxful water trip!was easy on and off. They even stopped and took us to a restroom on the other side. A fun way to see Dubai.

Have to get on an Abra at night.. We found ourselves walking around Dubai and getting directions to point us towards the Dhow Wharfage which we wanted to see. When we got there we decided to cross the creek in an Abra. At night it is quite a surreal experience. You can feel the nice,cool breeze as you can see the bright lights of the city while you sit with men getting home from a hard days work. I found it a very pleasant, peaceful experience at night. When we got to the other side we were in the souks for a bit of bargaining!

Great local experience that's easy on the pocket. 1dhs for one way, 2dhs for return... we happened to take a ride from the old gold/spice souk station just as the sun was setting and it was pretty magical

Enjoyable. Loved the busyness of the old working dhows being laden up with spices, white goods etc. Enjoyed the fort and archeological museum. But there was nowhere to buy a snack or even a drink of water and it was 42 degrees!

It's good.... It's a good experience but be careful especially if kids are along with you as the safety measures are missing & also take care of your mobile or anything in your upper pocket as it may fall in water if u bend ... If u visit the creek don't miss it. A visit in the evening is more pleasant as you can see the decorated boats n even take a ride in one of these. Visit to dock is free but not the abra or other boat :-)

Take a private abra. Take a trip into the Arabian Sea sea the tall towers in the small boat the floating bridge which separates in to two parts making way for the dhows to make their way out of the UAE they charge 120 aged for atrip which will last 1 hour and it's worth tel them we need a private abra

East Magic. Enjoy your tour behind Creek bank in old souk with East Magic and historical place
don't forget to try local boat for 1 ADE between the two banks
Lovely lake.. Went for and abra ride at dusk, very pleasant ride with nice breeze and very nice surrounds. Quite expensive for time spent on lake, but worth doing.
Easy and economical. The best way to reach deira from Bur dubai and vice versa is Abra.Its very economical and easy to access.

Do not miss. Loved this experience! The abra can hold up to around 20 people, has a loud noise when moving but has to be done. Used by both men and women to cross the river. Has to be done at least one. So convenient, easy and cheap (1Dh) to use. You can look at the other abras as you cross them as well as the ships carrying goods. There are ships on the dock where people seem to be living in them as well. You have to do this.

Absolute must in Dubai. For a few dirham, quick trip across the Dubai Creek, but the best experience is hiring an Abra for an hour (for as little as 120 Dirham) and cruising up and down the river at sunset, taking in all the wonderful sights and sounds of this fascinating part of the world.

Back into History. The ride is pretty cheap at just AED 1 per person from one side to another. Near to Dubai museum and just after the meena bazaar. But you will like this ride, it takes you back into time.
Bustling and Exciting!!!. Only tried the abras at night, but very exciting, noisy and bustling. A great way to cross the creek and take in all the souks noises and exotic smells.
great boat ride. For 1 dirham (about 16p) you can take a ride along dubai creek, cross over to the gold and spice souks, a great and cheap way to see this part of Dubai

Fast and cheap way to cross the creek. I walked from the start of the dinner boats to the Abra Dock, Old Souk Station, which took me though part of old Dubai Souk, as the sun was setting which was beautiful, it took my 20 minutes to walk. The Abra's are really easy to use, look for the next vessel boarding, walk onto the boat, take a seat and pay for the crossing, which takes about 10 minutes. If you're heading to the gold/spice souk cross over the road the spice souk is on the right, for the gold souk, first junction turn right. There are a number of stations along the creek, I only explored a little. By the time I had finished exploring the 2 souks the traffic in the area was really bad, and there were no taxis, so I took an Abra across the creek and found a taxi a lot easier on the other side of the old souk. I had limited time to explore as I was in Dubai for business, I found this a great way to see a lot in a short space of time.

Vultures!. The off street sellers literally attach you to sell illegal, fake products. Even if you say no, they follow you and preach their tantras 'gucci, prada, chanel, handbags, watches, sunglasses'. Its funny but also annoying when you actually want to shop around!
just great. We love using these water taxis, easily the best and cheapest way to get up and down the creek. A must do when you are in Dubai

Fabulous way to see the sights. Where else can you get a 15 min boat ride for 16p ! ( 1 Dirham ) used them everyday and discovered the delights of the Fish Market, Veg/ Fruit Market and the Perfume/Gold/Spice Market ( Souk)

Go local. The cheapest way to take a (short) cruise on the Creek. Just 1 Dirham (AED). Get mixed with the locals and go from New to Old Dubai. Make sure to have change or small bills. Even if you lost the abra before you there will be another one in no time.

A MUST VISIT IN DUBAI. If you are visiting Dubai, please make sure you have time to visit and cross the creek in an Abra, an experience not to be missed , visit the spice souk and Gold souk at the same time.
It shows that most things change but certain things in life will not change-Abra crossing is one!

Just relax and enjoy. It's 300 years old creek anf Dubai's old trading center. Very clean. Just spare some evening time, sitting in a tea /shawrma corner and relax for 1-2 hour. You will feel fresh. I storngly recommend.

Abra ride on the creek- must do!. We have been many times to the creek now, and it is a go to destination with our visitors. The old boats take you across the creek for a couple of dirhams. It's a great way to see the old part of Dubai. The souks can be reached easily from here, the textile, gold, and spice souks are a must see. It's nice to go in the evening around sunset to see the area all lit up!

Delightful & Enjoyable Experience not to miss .. Absolutely worth. Do not leave Dubai unless you experience this most existing & fun filled tour from Bur Dubai to Deira Dubai. Before visiting New age Dubai Marina , Jumeiarh Beach or swanky Sheikh Rashid Road take tour to this lovely & most economical transport to visit Gold Souk & Spice Souk(Market) It gives firsthand experience of local way of life in Dubai. Boats are simple and hardly takes 10 minutes to cross back waters. Charge is unbelievably low @ 1 AED. It is used by locals & hoards of foreigners visiting Gold & Spice markets. Both markets also represent old Dubai architecture, culture & ambiance with wooden arched celling, mosaic flooring, lanterns etc. Spice market is interesting with large bins filled with colorful spices, nuts & dry fruits lined up outside shops, which you can happily test or buy if you want. Gold Souk is all Glitters with tons of Gold ornaments, vessels on display, even if you do not want to buy, it is great spot for photography. All in all visit to these old markets by travelling through Abra is delightful experience
must do in town. Evening is good time to do the abra, which is the wooden boat to cross the creek. The whole families enjoyed a lot. It cost only one dram also there are interesting souks round.
An enjoyable experience, takes you back in time. An enjoyable experience which actually reflects the beginnings of Dubai and the journey this amazing city has taken over years.
A must-do while in Dubai!. What a great way of getting away from all the glitz and glamour and experience Dubai like the locals. It's a great way of getting to/from the Spice Souk and Gold Souk.

Cool Experience. Why not try it out? It's only 1 DH to ride the Abra! It was a nice experience; I took the Abra just for the heck of it, with no where really to go. It was obviously a "local" sort of thing to do as well. Pretty dingy boats, but the seating area (uncovered) was still seemingly clean. Fun! Don't stick to cabs; try the Abra!

The Piece of the Real Dubai. The surrounds of the creek in Bur Dubai has changed over the last 15 years but not enormously so. Yes there is now an Abra Docking Station and has been for a few years now which makes it easier to board and and leave the Abra, but the price remains the same and the purpose of the Abra remains the same for people to cross the from Deira to Bur Dubai by the quickest route. The silk Souk in Bur Dubai is worth the visit to soak up the atmosphere, don't forget to look up as well as looking around, the ceiling is amazing,. Don't be enticed to by stall holders to buy illicit counterfeit goods , they will take you around the back streets which is very interesting but the goods are rubbish at highly inflated prices. Lots of lovely places to eat at such cheap prices, be adventurous and give them arty.
Authentic way to see Dubai. We took an Abra across the river to see the Gold Souk after visiting the Deira spice market only 10 minute journey but a way to see the river.

Worth a visit.. for a dirham you can cross the river to the other side, nd get yourself to the Deira spice souk. The boat ride is idyllic a huge thrill. no need to purchase a dinner tour, Across the water, shopping is cheaper than at the spice souk next to the gold souk.

A Ride worth Experiencing.. You go to Dubai and you cannot miss the Abra Ride from the Docks.Just a one Dhiram cost and they take you accross to Diera. You have to experience this ride to ensure you visited Dubai

abra trip. we hired an abra for £10 for just the four of us and sailed up and down the creek at sunset, ending up in Deira by the spice and gold souk, lovely evening! The abras are a traditional wooden boat that cross the creek and costs 1 dirham! The souks have an unbelievable atmosphere and its like stepping back in time with the small alleys, smells and noise,merchants trying to entice you into their shop, cheap prices and fun experience

Great Cheap Fun......All tourists should do this. If you like boats, want to see boats and to see how the "locals" get around, cross the creek - you've got to ride an Abra. For $1 Dirham ($0.30, thirty cents USD), you can't beat this short boat ride. On a nice day, I would even recommend chartering an abra to take you up and down the creek. Its a great way to see the area, see the dohws being loaded, and some interesting architecture. Far and away the most fun for the least dollars to be had in Dubai. Great fun.

Take the Abra & cross the creek, Just 1 Dirham. I would say this is just an average experience. nothing special. But I f you want to experience the traditional abra, than you should try this. Just get down at the baniyas square metro station. In less than 5 minutes, you will reach the other side.

Fascinating, a "must see" when in Dubai. Abra is a form of transport for Dubai residents. However it is indeed a most fascinating sight for tourists. Traditional wooden boats cross the wonderful Dubai creek. Fantastic sites and sounds. Definitely a 'must see" when visiting Dubai.

Tourists must avoid it, or try only if you want the experience. in 1 dirham Its the cheapest mode to go from one side to the other side of the creek. They take you on a traditional style motor boat. At the end of the trip which will last only 8-10 mins you will have to pay 1 dirham to the skipper, there is no ticket. and its a shared ride.

Old world charm. Old fashioned wooden (motorised) boats, used to be the lifeline of dubai. Get there at sunset and take a trip in one of the (non touristy) RTA (govt) Abra's for less a dollar. It a lotta fun to ride it across the creek and after the trip sit around the dock or go bargaining at the street shops around.. Nothing fancy but worth a trip

Glimpse of Old times.. If you are visiting Dubai, you must make a trip between Bur Dubai and Deira in an Abra. For a very nominal amount(less than 1/2 USD) you enjoy a trip across creek and have a feeling of Old Dubai.

Fun and cheap way to cross the creek. Nice way to cross the creek together with the locals. Did it by myself without following the Big Bus Tours instructions of using their Wateride tour, definitely worth it and costs 1 or 2 dirhams.

Great fun!. The abra experience is great and ony 1 dirham to travel acros the river to another abra station. They are traditional boats and you get a real feeling of old Dubai. They only go when they are full although we never had to wait - it seems really organised and disorganised at the same time. You must try it.

Love it!. For 1 Dirham you can cross the river by Dhow (boat), well worth the experience but please be aware there are two (from what we saw) spots to catch them which take you to two separate spots on the other side - but dont panic both within walking distance if you get it wrong.

Yesterday's charm. My 5 years old daughter loved the place with the so many abra's. We started our ride from Bur Dubai side to Deira on a traditional Abra and then on the return took the RTA Air-conditioned boat (Though it was very comfortable, but my daughter preferred the old traditional Abra).Would definitely take guests to this location for a ride across the creek for a good experience,

Taste of 'old Dubai'. EVERYONE thinks of Dubai as all 5 Star and shiny, but this is a side you definitely have to see.For one dirham you can cross Dubai Creek, a thriving waterway lined with commercial activity.Either side has souks that are worth visiting for souvenirs - or stuff you genuinely need. You'll be encouraged by tradesmen wanting to sell you everything from lamps to scarves - and fake designer watches.The dock is always busy with the buzzing wooden abras and passengers and it is worth getting aboard just for the experience. There's also a great restaurant nearby that hangs over the water and does great, inexpensive Arabic food.

Bur dubai abra dock. Bur Dubai mean mainland city is a historical area of Dubai u can also say it old city it is located on the south side of dubai creek bur Dubai and dera is the two sides of Dubai creek which are sperated by each other because of water in between them abra is a boat a traditional boat powered by diesel engines it only takes 10 minutes to cross over the water it is fast and cheap abras make connection between the old district and diera the fee of abra is only one 1 aed it is very cheap.

Inexpensive and a nice experience. The abra's are nothing but a wooden boat which ferries from one place to another. There are 2 routes for the abra's near Bur Dubai/Deira, that I am aware of.More details about the routes can be found out at the RTA portal. The charge for a one way ferry is just 1 AED pp and it is a short ride of 5-9 minutes from Bur Dubai to Deira and vice versa. So you can plan your itenary such that you can roam around the Souks in Deira and then plan to go to Bur Dubai and visit Meena Bazaar, Al Fahidi street, Dubai MuseumTry this mode of transport :)
Experience it once. We took the kids to experience the water taxi..we got on at the Deira side and off the Bur side. It is a very short ride but something to experience.

Just sit and watch the world go by!. To cross the creek in an un-hurried, fun and traditional manner then jump onboard, pay the pilot a dirham and 'Abra-cadabra', you'll find yourself on the other side of the creek (after a few minutes...)
This is an experience that is definately worth a crack if you are in the creek area!

A Unique Experience. Dubai Abra is in fact a water taxi running in Dubai Creek,takes you from Baniyas to Gold Souq,Bur Dubai and Creek.Boats are very traditional .It costs AED 1 for one side .Its a unique experience and must do thing at Dubai .

A380s, Metros, Queen Elizabeth, and THE ABRA. You could come to Dubai in a A380, drive a chauffeur driven car, stay at the Armani or Burj Al Arab,take the metro but your trip is not complete without the short trip on the abra. Abra are small open boats which ply between Deira Dubai and Bur Dubai. It cost just AED1 for a trip. Each Trip will carry 20 passengers sitting on both side of the boat. It is the most enjoyable short boat trip with the boat rocking and wind and water spraying on your face. . It is fun, cheap and the fastest, easiest and cheapest way to cross the creak. Both sides are the busiest area and going by car will take you a minimum 2 hours during peak time. Try it and you will enjoy it. The landing side of bur dubai is where you get curious and you are now in the famous textile market of Dubai

A must do. A much over used term but I think a a quick trip (and back) along Dubai Creek in a water taxi across to the other side is a 'must do'For a just 1 dirham, spend a few minutes in the cool breeze watching other vessels coming to and fro. I think it was just 40 AED to hire one of your own to take you up and down the creek!Check out the tons of goods, fridges/freezers/TVs being loaded, stored & packed precariously on colourful large wooded boats about to make there way across the ocean to trade in India, Pakistan & elsewhere.A great way to relax for a while & just observe.

Nice.. although a little boring after awhile. enjoyed it to start with but after 20 minutes we were ready to head back to dry land. Lovely boat operator and excellent value for money. Well worth doing.

Dhow Cruise. Dhow Cruise is famouse here to spent a wonderful time with your spouse or a family. a worth of spending time and to have Arabian food on board.A Bridge ( which is automatic) is a good thing to see as a Good Creativity by ARAB PEOPLE AGAIN.. WELL DONE

Not quite what I was expecting.. Being called a 'creek', I was expecting something like a canal..! This waterway is huge and quite interesting. We went on a boat trip and the staff lifted my disabled scooter onto the boat for me.Glad I saw it.
What fun!. This is a must. A very cheap and different mode of travelling and what a fun way of getting from one side of the river to the other. Go on I dare you!!!

Romantic Evening. The Dow cruise starts off from this location, but even if you are planning on taking the cruise, it a nice place to go about taking an evening stroll. there are many outdoor restaurants along the creek, which offer arabic food, seafood and hookah options. The Dubai museum, Meena Bazar are all places along the creek to check out. Do take the Water Taxi which costs around 1AED to experience the cruise by the creek.

Good to visit at least once!. Great to visit the Bur Dubai area for a little bit of culture away from the madness of Dubai!
Hire out an Abra for a different experience along the creek especially whilst the sun is setting.
Okay. If you have never done water taxiing,then you will like it. I found it okay,our experience of Bangko's boat was more exciting than this one.

Reserve a Dinner Cruise Boat. At night this place comes alive with colorful cruise boats and I would recommend taking a dinner cruise. The food is good and the views at night are amazing with all the lighted boats.
Water Taxi. Easy and cheap way to cross and avoid the massive traffic. Disliked the boat rocks & one could fall into the water, not drown.

Not to be missed. One of my favourite places in Dubai, taking the abra across the creek is always fun and exploring the souqs on both sides, plenty to see and sounds and smells to experience especially in the spice souq.
nice view. i love travel in river and i really like this. It make me feel comfortable and relax. i took many photo here. should go here
Love this place. Out of the glitz and glamour of new Dubai, this is so refreshing and quaint. One of my favourite places in Dubai.

Take a traditional boat along the Creek!. We really wanted to see a bit of the old Dubai & this is the way to do it! For a very small sum you can ride an "abra" water taxi right along the water, with views of mosques, souks, museums etc. Our boatman even let us have a go at steering (tho' he regretted letting 2 women drivers take the wheel!) Well worth a try.
Lovely way to cross the river. Extremely cheap and a great way to cross the river on the traditional Abra's. Definitely a must when visiting Dubai.

Excellent view of Bur Dubai and Deira. We took the abra from Bur Dubai to Deira during the Dubai City Tour and it was an excellent experience. The water is clean and warm (although I understand that swimming is not allowed).

Exploring the Dubai heritage. Taking a walk along side the creek and exploring the Dubai heritage is such a nice feeling. And we did ride the Abra to cross to the creek's other side. It is real fun and worth trying. And if you are in a mood to do some shopping around and settle on the prices by haggling, there is no shortage of outlets to practice!
For 25cents you can't go wrong. This is an awesome ride for cheap where you can enjoy the view of some landmarks from water. Visit the spice souk then cross to visit textiles and the museum.
A must do while in Dubai. We stayed in Bur Dubai as it is much quieter here. We walked to the creek from our hotel, then took a walk around this area, then took boat ride on an abra across the creek

Don't miss the water taxi (Abra). Just 1 AED to ride the Abra from one side of the creek to the other and you can see both sides. The entire area is surrounded by shops to look though and wheel and deal on the price. The shop keepers can be a bit much but it is not rude to simply walk away. A unique area in Dubai that is far from the polish of DIFC or Marina area. When we visited we ended up walking over 10 miles between the Bur Dubai and Deira areas, we walked from the metro station around the fish market and Gold Souk before heading back to the creek and crossing to the Bur Dubai side. If you bring some good shoes and don't load up on merchandise you can spend hours in this area.

The abra is unique. The abra which is the water bus is very unique since it shows the heritage of Dubai and is extremely cheap for the ride. The boat ride is very comfortable to travel between the Burdubai area and the Deira area which are the two important locations of the Dubai history.
Cultural Experience. We truly enjoyed crossing the creek and having dialogue with other visitors sharing ideas and having a total different experience from the other side of the creek.

very disappointed if not 10 pax they cancel your trip. wanted to go with mom on one of their brand new boats to visit the creek waited 40 mins and trip was cancelled because not 10 pax had booked for the boat so the rta is not really abra.... cadabra!!! lol will take the old boats with the crowd this is the real life for one aed only...

Never got enough of this. And cheap!. We just got back from Dubai and my family and I regularly used the abras to get from Deira to Bur Dubai. We had our little one with us in the stroller too and it was no hassle to get him on and off. He loved it too! It was only 1 Dirham to ride and perfect for travelling between the Gold Souk and the Old Souk/Meena Bazaar. You always had an abra ready and you are usually on the move within 5 minutes. And not forgetting the lovely views of the buildings and people. Def a must do!!

Cheapest tourist experience in Dubai. Just 1aed to ride the Abra. You can cross the creek and then explore the many souks. We book cashmere pashminas for less than £8.00 and the quality is just superb! Definately a must.

Highlight of Bur Dubai. We took this amazing little boat after walking round the Gold and Spice souks - it was a ridiculously small amount of money and the way to cross the creek. A must do from my perspective....

Great little boats - convenient and scenic. I loved the little boats crossing the creek - so cheap (1 AED each way) and such a great way of getting around. A friend and I even took the round trip ride along the creek and back again (AED 120 -per boat, not per person) taking in all the Dubai buildings whilst enjoying the fresh air on one of these traditional little abras. Just great!

A little slice of old Dubai. I love Bur Dubai. The newer parts of the city feel like Vegas. But places like Bur Dubai remind you that there's still a little authentic personality left in the place. The abra ride is very cool, very cheap and lots of fun. I've had a plenty of visitors come to Dubai and the abra ride usually ranks among the top. Parking can be annoying around there, so I usually cab it.

Great way to get around. Wherever you stay you will want to cross the creek. The abras are quick and cheap, with a great view of river life as you cross.For some reason the abras do not go straight across the creek, so use the eastern dock in Bur Dubai to get to the Spice Souk and Gold Souk.

Economical and fast. This is the fastest and the most economical way to travel to and fro bur dubai and deira . The Dock itself is well maintained and the creek in itself is really nice to walk along , especially at night with all the lights glimmering on the boats .

My favourite place in Dubai. This was the place to be, in my opinion. Very "real" place in a city of flamboyant fantasy. It was easy to spend an hour just watching the hive like activity of the waterfront.

Shops and a boat ride. This was a great way to cross the river to the souks after visiting the Cultural Center. A little confusing picking which boat station would take us to where we wanted to go, but a great ride and got some fun pictures.

excellent ways of using water ways -economical way of transport. Well maintained with lot of business activities, tourist activities and souk (gold and spice markets). The people are very polite helpful in their nature. The creek is very busy with dow and yatch movements. excellent place to enjoy in the evenings.

Great cheap boat ride. If you are in the market district in Dubai, a boat ride on an Abra is a great way to view the old city and the boats being unloaded. And it is a great way to cross the river to visit markets on the other side that only costs 1 Durham. There are several Abra docks along the waterway and you wait on the dock for a boat to your desired destination. The little boats hold about 20 people with the driver standing in the center surrounded by the platform/bench for the passengers. You hop on the boat and find a spot to sit (all passengers face the water on either side) and pay the driver or attendant when they come around. The motorized boats move quite quickly to take you to the other side or along the river to another station where you hop off when the boat pulls up to the dock. There are many old buildings, docks, and boats to see along the way. In the evening many buildings and boats have colorful lights.

Go in the morning or evening. Abra rides are a great way to see the harbour and the Dhows being loaded and unloaded. Rent one for yourself or your group makes for a more pleasant experience. It gets a bit hot mid day and the sun on the water can give you a sunburn if you are not protected.

Life is good, at the price of 1 dirham. Such a nice, aunthentic transportation across the lovely, peaceful, bright blue Dubai Creek (it's wide, don't let the name fool you!) At the price of 1 aed (20 eurocents) you can just keep riding back and forth. Watch the seagulls, take photos of the boats, then have coffee at a terrace cafe!

A must when in Dubai. Crossing the creek with a Abra is a must when in Dubai and its really, really cheap!! 1 Dirham!!
The abra's are used for transporting people from one side to the other so its a real mix of locals, businessmen and tourist!!
If you want to make a longer trip on the Creek you can rent a abra for yourself/group.
Abra a must. ride an Abra to get a feel of the Dubai creek. Its cheap, fast and has a local flavour. Avoid dhow cruise. Its over rated, noisy and expensive

Something different. Going on the boats is a real experience and it only cost 1dirham. The boats are one of the main transportation over the creek from Deira to Bur Dubai so the boats are filled with tourists and people getting to their jobs or just transporting small things between the 2 places of Dubai.Pros:- Nice experiance.- A must thing to do while in Dubai.- Quick transportation.- Low cost.Cons:- Most of the boats does not have a exhaust pipe so out of the middle of the boat where the boat captain sits there is loads of fumes coming up. A tip is to sit at the front in order to get as little fumes as possible.- Considering the fumes one may wonder what kind of health policy the company have towards their personnel. Or rather, if they care about the health of their personnel at all.- Safety #1, there is no safety rales at all on the boat. A less then 1" high board on the edge of the boat is all you have to support yourself onto.- Safety #2, considering #1. It is very common for the boats to bump into eachother.- The entrance/exit areas are dirty and not well kept. - For someone living in Dubai it is easy to know which boat to take if you know the different names where the boat is going but for a tourist it is difficult to know which boat to take to end you up at X position on the other side of the creek. A hint for the company would be to put up some better information about it.

Great experience, fun. Where else in the world could you cross a significant waterway (called a creek, but much more than that!) for such a tiny cost? So interesting to see the boats and bustle of this area.
Old Dubai. Has some flair and it is interesting , definitely a must see if u are traveling through Dubai . Easy access to the Abra boats , are always there for you

Crossing the creek. To get across the creek, the abra is still a fascinating way to travel costing just 1 AED. You mingle amongst the tourists and locals. As well as a cheap and easy way to cross the creek it is also a good way to take some photos of the city.
' Open air cruising a la Abra'. Great fun, simple but very effective mode of moving people back and fort across the creek. Great value at 2 AED, return!
Very nice place to sit at night. I have crossed it many times its always a exciting .they got a lot of restaurants near the dock area serves good food and great view.

Great fun and so cheap. We went in the evening and got a bit lost as taxi dropped us off in wrong place. The abras are very basic wooden boats without sides etc, you sit on a wooden deck around the engine. There is a wooden canopy to keep the sun off you during the day. We paid our 1 AED (about 20p) and chugged across the dark inky waters of the creek passing the dhows moored along the bank. We got off at the stop nearest to the spice and gold souks. Great fun and well worth the fare.

marvellous way to enjoy Dubai Creek. Meant to do this on first visit to Dubai 8 years ago but have not got around to it now on our eighth trip, so good! 1 aed a person for 10 minute ride across creek on an old "water taxi" operating without regard for health and safety (although I did note they have life vests in roof) . Marvellous way to view that end of Creek. And one can enjoy sugar cane drink and fresh orange jiuce from a stall near dock station.
Another Dubai Must do. You must take a boat ride! It is included in the Big Bus tour if you purchase a tour through them, but even if you don't its a must do!
One time in life,,,. Nice experience, kids like :) 1 AED is positive thing. I make this trip several times, fo fun and when i needed,,, If You go holiday in Dubai, try it. You smile,,,

Hustle and bustle. We wanted to cross the Creek by boat to visit the Gold Souk.What better way than use the Abra, the traditional mode of transport used by everyone. Dozens of these little boats plying back and forth with everyone rushing on and off. The cost is less than 20 pence! Be sure you take the right Abra. If going to thecGoldcsouk make sure you get on the right one otherwise you will end up somewhere else.Before getting on just say "Gold Souk" that will keep you right.

Wobbly but wonderful way to cross the creek. At 1 dirham each way this is a brilliant, authentic way to cross the creek. Yes - getting on and especially off you definitely need to pay attention but this just has to be done if you are in the area.

Old world Charm. It is a wonder that Abras are running in Dubai in these modern times. However, it was a pleasant surprise to me to be able to ride the abra from Bur Dubai to Deira at a reasonable 1Dhs cost. The small motor boats run almost every couple of minutes ferrying both passengers and tourists alike. Very good... preserves the cultural heritage of the country.
A must in Dubai. A Creek crossing for 1AED, you cant beat it for views.Daughter was not sure 1st time but enjoyed the return trip. Worth doing at night as well

The other side of Dubai. It was nice. The boat ride to either side of the creek was pleasant. We took the private 30 mins ride and get to see the bigger picture of the old Dubai along the creek. The souk at the dock was worth a visit.

A great way to spend the evening!. This is very enjoyable ride! We book the whole abrar for 60 dirham for half an hour cruise for our family only (3 adults with 2 kids) . We even bring the stroller up the abrar together with us! If you travelling alone, you can ride the abrar across to the other side for 1 dirham. Totally recommended!

The most well spent dollar!. It's like riding the Venice water bus but for a fraction of the price. A -1AED ride for a sensational experience. In fact, we liked it so much that we have taken it 3 times to cross the creek. It felt as if we were travelling back in times when goods and spices had to be transported by boats. It's so unique. The station is about 5 minutes walk from the metro where wooden boats with motor are moored and passengers walk on to sit on long benches. One of the three ways to get across the creek from Bur Dubai to the souks. On either side, there's lots to do. We have done it in the morning and twice at sunset. It's truly magical!

Relaxing!. Took a 1 hour abra ride in the creek. Paid the driver 100 AED for one hour. Then just sat back and relaxed as he took us along the creek while we soaked in the sights along the banks. A bit expensive but you could negotiate further. But overall a relaxing and enjoyable trip.
Very cool. I took the Water Taxis over to the Souqs. What a great way to spend 1 dirham! Seriously, best dirham you can spend. Cross the Dubai Creek and step back in time. :) Love this.
A Place to visit. I recommend it during sunset as the place looks magical. It is nice to take an abra to cross the creek. It costs 1AED (0.2EUR)

Just Amazing. The Souk Madinet is a fantastic place to spend the evening. The Abra tour is great value for money and a great way to see the Burj Al Arab. I would highly recommend this where you can enjoy a great meal and shopping swell

Abra. This is a fantastic experience.
You get the opportunity to travel to gold souk from burdubai in the abra. Old style wooden boat. Wonderful experience

not very memorable. for starters we were on the boat a very long time before it sailed, in sweltering heat. it took the guys a long time to come around with cold drinks for sale, the cans were really dirty. however, it was interesting to see the creek and other boats on it with huge cargo on board.

Great Experience. We had a great time riding the abra boat across the creek to go to the souks and then back again. I think all of us actually enjoyed the boat ride more than the souks. :-) The ride also provides great photo opportunities. Considering the price (1 AED one way) this is is probably the best 'bang for your buck' you are going to find in Dubai. It is also nice to see a side of Dubai that isn't skyscrapers or large malls. If you are traveling with young kids (or others who need assistance) make sure you help them on and off the boat (or at least keep a close eye on them) as you may have a big step to get to the dock depending on how close the boat pulls in. You don't need to have exact change, but you'll want to have a small bill. You pay the boat operator after you get on the boat and start moving.

Cultural Dubai. The Dubai Creek should certainly be on your list of must do's when visiting Dubai. It has a very different feel to the rest of Dubai. The textile, gold and spice souks are all easily accessible from here as is the Bastakiya area.

A must do. The quickest and the cheapest thrill in Dubai and one that makes you feel like a local. Its about 1 AED to cross the creak from Bur Dubai to Deira or other way. You can cross from Deira to Bur Dubai and then take a the metro anywhere, the train station is a short walk away.
Good experience. Fun experience crossing the creek. Was coolOnly 1 dirham per personCan take nice pctures or take the experience in
Take a boat to Deira for 1AED. It costs only 1AED to take a boat ride to Deira. There you can visit Deira Gold Souq, Deira Spice Souq and Deira Covered Souq.

Abra Ride. I think one must not visit this if you are visiting Dubai. This is one of the oldest.You can go from one side to other for 1 AED. The waterfront is amazing.
