I would recommend taking an exclusive abra ride, which one can hire. The costs range from AED 50 to AED 150 for an hours ride. They would take you take across the creek until the Al Maktoum Bridge. The waterfront is just amazing. An evening ride just during sun set would be an amazing experience. One can get this ride anywhere from across the creek side and not necessarily at the Abra station. Rate negotiations are possible.

easy ride to diera. the best way to go to diera side is from the bur dubai creek and avoid traffic especially in the evenings. This part of the bur dubai is very good with old souq (souq in arabic is for shopping) and all the decor is arabian style close to this place. The ride is very cheap , just be carefull while stepping on to the boat.... its a nice few mins ride to and fro from the bur dubai (there are 2 stations on bur dubai side and drop you at 2 diff stops the other side) ,not very far ,but one is very close to naif market in diera.... so better check before you board

Cheap, Cool, and uniquely Dubai. There is no better attraction than an abra ride from the Bur Dubai abra dock across the creek in Dubai. First off for 1 AED(about 30 cents) you get a boat ride across the Dubai Creek and see the waterfront from the boat. The waterfront is always a buzz and hubub of activity, the scene is mad but there is order in the chaos.My family enjoyed the boat ride and rubbing elbows with the locals who use the water taxi to commute along. Do it, trust me, it is a neat experience and truly memorable. Great pics from the boats.

Traditional water Boat. Liked the petty boat ride from Bur Dubai to Deira a 500 meter ride on a small motor boats with 20 people capacity, 1000,s of passengers use this mode of transport for crossing the Creek

The way to travel !. A little different to all the prestige cars in the city - a little wooden boat to ferry you across the creek for next to nothing. The best way to see the souks and convenient on both sides of the creek to pick up the Big Bus Tour. An absolute joy !

Feel of real & ancient Dubai. It was a great feel while docking Abra. All the small boats were filled with people travelling from one port to another. A 5-10 minute ride in clear waters on an open boat is a unforgetful experience.
Wonderful way to cross the creek. Excellent way to cross creek and avoid getiing stuck in traffic jams.A must experience for tourist from all over the world.

A must for all traveller's. It is incredible to see the city of Dubai transform from the fast moving business oriented concrete world into the charming and humble old world made of wood and stones. The Abra is the ancient wooden boat that people used to travel across the creek. You can also visit the old spice markets and souks on either side of the creek. The ride itself is nothing less than a stress buster, you get to see the old charm of the bustling city from the clean serene waters of the creek. A must do for all travellers

Perfect Venue For Time Out. For a memorable water-cruise, head to the Abra Dock in Bur Dubai, the historic district of the city. The name 'Bur Dubai' means 'Mainland Dubai' and the abras make the connection on water between this district and Deira. Bur Dubai and Deira make the two sides of Dubai Creek. Hopping in a boat with a group will cost you AED 1 (~27 cents US) per person. Make sure u've got coins!

Wonderful experience. We took the Abra across the creek and it was a great experience, very cheap and lots of fun. Later in our vacation, we hired the whole Abra for 1 hour and went up and down the creek at sunset, it was really beautiful, we negotiated the price for Dir 120 for the whole boat and we went at 6pm to capture the sunset and night lights, stunning.

Cross the river cheap and original. For only one dirham per way you can cross the creek and at the same time enjoy the most original way to travel, like people in dubai do since decades. you pay direct to the boat driver and sit down, there are always plenty of abra around. there is no cheaper way to travel in dubai and you have a beautiful view on both sides of the river, bur dubai and deira.

Water Taxi Ride at the Abra is a must!. After wondering around the Meena Bazaar one must take a water taxi ride from the Abra to the Spice and Gold Souks. It costs 1 Dhiram (cheap in perhaps any currrency!) and you sit on a bench with about 30 people. The water ride is refreshing to appreciate the old port sites of Dubai. You are very likely to see seafaring boats loaded with goods on the port side as you disemabrk on the souks side.

Great value. We used the water taxis (Abra) and it was such good value for money for a trip across the creek. We also took one for half and hour to go along most of the creek and that was well worth it too.
Wow!. At AED1 to cross the Creek, incredible value for money! Such an unusual & authentic experience - highly recommend.

Interesting place. It is very nice travel to & fro to abra always when we are in Dubai. It is a small creek place, even though we have metro & full bus & taxi services, it is good to go via Abra boat service to go between Bur Dubai & Deira Dubai

Chaotic but worth a visit. A very crowded and chaotic area, but worth experiencing. The abra ride costs only 1 dirham and lets you see a different side of Dubai, without all the glitzy man-made buildings. You can cross the creek to access the spice or textile souk, depending on where your starting point is.

Great way to cross the creek. Some may see the Abra and turn away from this mode of transportation. Don't. It's a great, quick and very inexpensive way to cross the creek. For 1 Dhs you can cross the creek with the locals. It's safe and enjoyable ride. The Abra connects Deira and Bur Dubai - on one side you will see the spice and gold souks and on the other you will see street markets and Meena Bazaar. Definitely a must do in Dubai.

One of the best rides in Dubai and the least expensive.. Nothing is free in Dubai and not even the Abra rides. However I didnt mind at all paying the 1 Dhs that the service charges. This 1 Dhs is one of the most enjoyable rides in Dubai and easily beats the best rides costing 100 Dhs upwards. A must see on your Dubai visit. Surprisingly clean water and seagulls all over makes it a memorable ride.

Old Dubai. The Abra Docks are one of the very few places in Dubai where you can get a sense of what Dubai truly was and is - at its heart. The place where it all began, Dubai Creek was the centre of all of what made Dubai today and this Abra dock and ride gives you a good feel of what it was like to live in Dubai, back in the day.

Great way to see the city. We loved the Dubai abras. The dock is a bustling area, and the abras are a very cheap, easy and authentic way to cross the creek.We were a group of 6 and we hired an abra for 120 dirhams for 1 hour to take us up the creek and back. The diesel engine was a bit fumy, but it was a great way to experience Dubai.

great way to cross the creek. head down to the Dock and see the activity - not just a tourist trap the locals still use the Abra's to cross back and forward. At about 20p and approx 10 mins a crossing quick and fun way to see a bit of old Dubai - even if you just cross over and back again. Look for the old Souks at both sides of the creek - colourful and full of characters.
The face of old Dubai. You must have to try, it was the authentic way for transportation there. One route is one dirham, at night it is beautiful.

Real Dubai. Hasn't changed in 30yrs just got a little busier it's a must see only costs 20p. It's a real invite into the real Dubai heritage quickest way to get from bur Dubai over to the gold souk and spice market

Traditional way to see the Creek!. The dock where you can make the transition is not far from the museum and Bastaqia, and is near the textile market. From this area you can rent a traditional boat (abra) to get in Deira (the old area). Crossing costs 1 AED per person and lasts 10 minutes. Also in this area you can rent a boat across the channel to walk for an hour for 100-120 dirhams (must negotiate strong). When you get to the other side right near the dock you will find souvenir markets, gold etc.The ride is pleasant but short (if you choose the variant 1 AED - public transport) and you share the boat with another 10-15 people. That will not be a clean area as the rest of Dubai but it is an area that must be visited in order to make a difference between the new and old Dubai.

Great trip cross the creek. We crossed this because we had to go to the other side of the Creek, but the crossing was a really nice experience with great views. We were a bit worried as we were two females alone and it was getting dark - but as we came we could see there was absolutely nothing to worry about!
Abra Dock. `This is a traditional way of taxi to cross from one side of the creek to the other. It only cost 1 diramm and 20 people can ride together. Very quick service
Different side of Dubai. Took a boat ride to Spice and Gold souk. My 3 year old loved it. Regulars just jump off the boat as it reaches the dock. We waited for it to dock and then got off.

A great way to see the real old Dubai. Abras are very cheap to take across to the Souks and back again. Plenty to get and you can also take an hour or even ask them for 30 minutes and go up and down the Creek to see more of the bustling and busy local boats loading up all their wares to take to other countries .

Fun and novelty. I thought it was funny when the boat driver saw that 1 man had not paid him and he started banging on the wood to prompt him to pay! You can get a good view of the buildings of Dubai while crossing from one district to another. When I first went on the abra, it was my first time being in an Asian place so I found it a real cultural experience. I was sat among men and women wearing all different kinds of international clothing and I thought it was unique and exciting experiencing a different way of transport to modern buses etc which are in many countries.
Good enough. I like to go on the abra, but sometimes it's a mess and to crouded, but if you are in Dubai and you want to try it just go for it, it is a unique experience ande really cheap

The cheapest mode to cross the creek. Bur Dubai Abra caters have two types of boats crossing the creek. One is so cheap that the ticket fare is just AED 1 for one way and the other is an Air conditioned boats which is just AED 2. This is the cheapest mode of crossing the creek and to avoid traffic congestion.

Cross the creek with the locals. The only practical way to get to the other side of the Creek, and so easy: find the Abra Dock, wait for next boat which is either immediately or a matter of minutes only, get on board, pay 1 AED and 5 minutes later you are at the other side. Take time to walk along the side of the Creek and marvel at the wooden ships and all their amazing cargo which has to be seen to be believed!

Across the creek. This is a very inexpensive way to view Dubai's creek, one can get to the other side of the creek for 1 AED.There are many souks nearby, such as spice souk, gold souk and textile souk.

Don't miss this - it i so special. I am on my 10th trip to Dubai and on each trip I have been on an Abra at least 4 times. The views from these little boats are just fantastic and for the local people who frequent these boats it's just a normal thing to do.Don't take a traditional taxi from one side or Dubai to the other - take an Abra, it's so special and feels like you are having the opportunity to take a trip back in time ..... for less than 20p a ride. The trips leave every 3 or 4 minutes apart so you don't need to make any "timed" plans - just turn up and ENJOY!!This is not suitable for severely disabled passengers - certainly not wheelchairs.

Book a private one!. for this experience we booked a private boat for 1 hour for only 60 dirhams. it was so good, we went all the way ear the end of the creek. we really liked the views of deira with the big wooden ships carrying merchandises. I was really surprised to know that there are still wooden ships that go to the open seas. i thought that was a lost era because we already have big modern cargo ships. but wow, it was so good and their numbers, it was not just 10 or 15 ships but hundreds of them. we stepped down at the souk station and walk from there which we overly enjoyed exploring.

Visit in the Evening - Just before Sunset. Awesome view of the sunset and the creek. Dusk seems like a beautiful time to visit the Abra Dock to take snaps. Cheap/convenient mode of travel from Diera side to Bur Dubai or vice versa for just 1 AED per trip with good frequency.

Experience at 1 AED. Had time to spend on my tour to Dubai & found this place by chance while roaming from Al Ghubaiba Bus station...I remembered what I had read & was really keen to experience the Abra RideWent on a aimless trip paying 1 AED & returned back paying 1 AED after clicking enough pics :)Worth the experience

Different form of transport. This is the cheapest way to see the Dubai creek from the water. Make sure to get information brochures to guide you to the different agra stations.. a crossing is not more than 2Dhs.. which translates to less than 1Usd.

Dubai Creek Abras. This is great! It is where Dubai started off, so if you're looking for some genuine Dubai experiences, this is well worth a go. It's cheap, not very clean, probably quite dangerous, but really gives a sense of old Dubai.

in the waters..... a boat ride. when I told my daughter I want to see the famous gold souk,she said lets go by abra.well an abra is a wooden boat with seats all over.It takes you across the waters of the Dubai creek for a mere ONE DIRHAM.now thats amazing.the spice bazaar,the gold souk,the street food stalls are all there,once you get off the abra.in a desert,an abra ride,most welcome and a rewarding experience...and return home the same way too.one can hire an abra also for a day and go around admiring the tall skyscrapers of this black gold city

Abra Dock..... a traditional boat, what we called "Bangka" in the Philippines, its quite not so good but the point is the attraction you will see while cruising is i find it a little bit fun!!!..riding traditional boat, seeing all the traditional cities or let say old cities here in Dubai. 1 aed/ person for the fare not so bad, affordable i can say. And they will drop you in the Heritage Village, Old market that all vendors is pushing you to buy thier goods at the cheapest price.
Got to be Abras. My favourite bit apart from the beach - the abra is a basic sort of water taxi - you can go across the Creek for 20p! Takes about 5 minutes and is really lovely.

Be specific!. We visited the Gold Souk in the morning and had planned to visit the museum across the creek in the afternoon and I had read about the 1 AED fare to use the water taxi. There was no clear signage on our side of the dock and the entrance wasn't immediately obvious so we pottered up and down the waterfront for a time past the more industrial parts of the creek. Once we found the station we were shown a sign written in Arabic that depicted 1 AED and 120 AED, we could see a boat that was nearly full on the side so agreed. Once we were down on the riverside we were ushered onto an empty boat - I initially thought it was because the other boat was full but alas no! We had unwittingly agreed to go on an hours private tour for £20 ish. Whilst this was not what we initially wanted we decided to go with the flow and enjoy the scenery and it was very relaxing. The price wasn't too bad for an hour of the drivers time - although he spent all of it on his phone and steering the vessel with his foot. As a relatively experienced traveller I should of known better but we enjoyed ourselves so what the heck!

Worth the time - explore inexpensively. Use the water taxis (1 Dirham) to explore the docks and waterfront area. Its easy, cheap and laid-back. Used by everyone. Close to the metro/buses at Al Ghubaiba...easy to find. Access to the other side of the creek plus a glimpse into dhow wharf activity.
Awesome experience!. I took some friends to the Abra dock and we took a water taxi to the spice souk. Great experience and it's great that Dubai still has this side of it!

Great fun. Agree with all the reviews that say this is the best 1 dirham you will spend in Dubai. The contrast between the metro ride to Al Ghubaiba station and the rickety old abra boat crossing of the creek could not be more marked and this all adds to the fascination. All great fun and nice that there is still a part of Dubai that clings on to tradition.

1 dirham ride. I have been to Dubai a few times and finally got to go on an Abra in October, it's a little local boat that goes across the creek and cost 1 dirham. Used by locals and ex pat workers etc .Previouly I have been hijacked and taken across by speed boat, the first time two of us somehow ended up on a huge Dhow doing a tour of the creek, (these people can be very persuasive). Make sure you get dropped off at the right place otherwise who knows what mode of transport you will end us getting across the creek. All good fun though .

A delightful experience.. When in Dubai try and get to the Abra dock just before sunset, (for the photo opportunity), to take an Abra, (local, open sided water taxi), to the gold souk or spice souk.It is a nice way to get down and across the 'creek'/river.You just jump on the first boat you see that is nearly full of mainly locals and is about to leave.You pay a couple of dirhams, the driver jumps into the well in the middle of the boat and you're off.Don't be concerned if you miss one, there are lots more and they run continuously.Take an abra back as well as a taxi has to take a circuitous route over a bridge.Get a taxi from the abra dock upon your return, it's quicker, cheaper and more fun.

Best value boat trip in the world!. I love the Creek with it's heritage, history and local colour. The one Dirham abra trip across the Creek is the best value boat ride I know and a 'must do' for all visitors to Dubai. Tourists mix with locals on the short trip across the Creek, Provides great views of the working dhows and their crews as well as the Rulers Diwan and the Grand Mosque. Very convenient transport to the souks on the Deira side.

Old World Charm. A must visit when travelling to Dubai, and as a resident, I go there for lunch several times a year, take the Abra across the creek from Bur Dubai to the Spice Souk...a great way to spend an afternoon in the winter....too hot in summer though.

The Simplicity in the middle of Dubai. Dubai Dur Dubai Abra is really the simplicity in the middle of busy expensice city like dubai. you can spend a day walking at Old diera souk enjoy the different shops and boutiques, it is really an nice experiense, walking through the souk till reaching the creck to take Dubai Abra, all what you have to pay is 1 UAE which is noting to cross the creck
Bur Dubai Abra Dock. we shoot this 3am.. nice place..Get great views of the older parts of the city from the Abra dock, and an enjoyable if boat ride between the Deira souks and Bur Dubai souk areas.

Abra. Very cheap crossing on the small wooden Abra boats. It is a must-do, if you are at all interested in the old Dubai. You could just go across the creek and come straight back, if you do not want to visit the souks. Pay the boat-man actually on-board the Abra (have small coins ready). You don't need to opt for the more expensive round trip. The short trip across is delightful, despite the potential smell of fumes and the lack of shade/air conditioning. It is used by both locals and tourists. (Not suitable for buggies, wheelchairs or those with can not sit down on a low bench.)

Good and cheap transport. It's good way of transport which has been operating in Dubai since decades. I use it a lot when I travel to Dubai as it is very cheap and also saves a lot of time in the traffic when you want to go from Bur Dubai side to Deira or the other way round. It runs every few minutes from both sides. Recomended to use if you are traveling between these two side of Dubai.

Old style water taxi. Inspite of all the development and modernisation, one thing in Dubai hasn't changed for years.The Abra is a wooden boat, open on the sides with a roof on top and is used as a cheap, convenient water taxi to cross the creek.There is a Abra station at Bur Dubai, and across the creek near the Gold Souk and at Sabkha.The boat seats about twenty people, seated along it's sides roughly ten facing outwards each side. Fare is reasonable, one Dirham from Bur Dubai, across the creek to the Gold Souk. The journey takes about 5 minutes, hop on, the fare is collected as you cross the creek, and hop off. No frills, no receipts, just quick, convenient water taxi.The Abra Dock has it's own old world charm with the wooden boardwalks and sheds etc.

Excellent. I loved it here, old world charm, cheap crossing of the creek with local characters. A reminder of what Dubai was like. Interesting to see what is being transported around the docks.Totally worth a visit, perhaps incorporate with souks. Excellent !
Old world charm in modern Dubai. Get great views of the older parts of the city from the Abra dock, and an enjoyable short boat ride between the Deira souks and Bur Dubai souk areas.

lovely attraction. its a must for Dubai visitors ... a traditional wooden boats that will carry you from Bur Dubai bank to Deira Bank & reverse .. enjoy the ride in very cheep fair ,, its available for private but very high fair
Simply Nice. We took a walk as there was plenty of time for the flight. Nice clean and maintained Enjoyed the walk!

Excellent. It's a wonderful place to visit and I recommend it. Unfortunately it was almost deserted on the day I went there (week-end) and I would have spend there more time if I had any explanation about the place.

Most fun for the...Dirham. Best value in Dubai.The iconic Abra that ferries people back and forth across the Dubai Creek is vital for many locals, and fun for the tourists. The same way as the famous Star Ferry that crosses Hong Kong harbour is both fun and useful, both at a bargain price.Long may they survive in this modern age!If you know where you want to cross to, there are official people who can tell you which one to take, it works much like a bus station, but I never saw any destination boards on the boat or the dock.I may have missed them.

A tourists delight. The whole setting of the promenade alongside the creek is fabulous, to walk along the moored working Dhows and Abras, and looking through to the 30+ storey glass skyscrapers across the Creek give a fabulous contrast. Wandering through the Soak, and through to the heritage Village, give an insight of times before Oil, a truly fabulous, area to walk, and enjoy, fine sea food in the numerous Creekside cafes and Restaurants.

Can be a bit scary. We took the abra ride for 1 dhs each. For me it was interesting and something I wanted to do while in Dubai. For kids however, it was a bit scary. Not many tourists were around and the darkness also contributed. It is a means of travel across the creek, could be fun in daylight for sightseeing.

Cheap and cheerful trip across the creek. If you go to Dubai it is a must do.Traditional wooden boats that ferry you across the creek to the gold souk.Local transport really.We went a night and the creek water was brightly lit from all the lights from nearby buildings.You also get an opportunity to see the Dows loading their cargo for transportation further away.

One of the best value boat trips ever. For 1dr a cross creek trip from Bur Dubai to Deira has got to be one of the best boat trips ever, only rivaled for value by the free Hong Kong or Staten Island Ferries. Watch your footing though!

Forget health and safety here. Unique traditional boat ride across Dubai creek costs 1 diram travel across and have a drink and see the traders cargoe ships with all manor of things on the decks from fridges and bicycles to cars and goats then ride back to the other side to the gold souk .

Try once. It worth to try traveling with abra at least once, and it is very cheap. You pay on the board while starting. The only thing is, on the water, the sun will even burn you more cruelly than normally.

A nice boat ride. I had seen this place few years back but wanted to take my wife on this boat ride and to see the gold souq that is situated at the Deira side. We went there at about 9PM and though there are ticket counters, none were operational.You go on the boat and pay the driver 1AED per person. The ride takes about 10 minutes to reach the other side. Visit this place in the night to see the other colourfully lit larger boats. You can visit the souq on the other side and be back within an hour. An experience in contrast to the otherwise expensive tourist attractions and means of transport in Dubai.
Take a private tour. Dont miss the spice souk nearby and then take the Abra across or if you are a group of people take a private tour. Not too expensive and they take you up and down the creek.

Travel with the Locals. Great way to cross the Dubai Creek in order to get to the gold and spice markets (souks). Boats are cheap (about 20c), leave frequently and take you from one side to the other in 5 minutes. The boats are full of locals making a trip across the Creek. Definitely worth a trip for the keen explorer.

Abra docks ok for a wonder and ride. The best part is the abra ride - costs peanuts and a great experience of something historical and authentic. The challenge is the heat walking around outside (to be expected in Dubai) and the shopkeepers do hassle you to buy which is annoying. That spoit the expereince of the surrounding souks for me.

The other side of Dubai. I loved meandering along the Creek by the docks and seeing all the boats loading up with everything from bananas to frigs for trips to unknown and presumably exotic places in the Middle East. A breeze blows off the water, welcome after a 40C day, the Abra are there to whizz cheaply from side to side and I had the best ever Hamburger and lime juice.

Inexpensive Dubai activity. A quick taxi to the Abra station will get you on a boat on the creek, either for 1 Dirham which gets you a quick trip to the other side and the Gold souk or 120 Dirham and a hours trip up and down the creek. I have done both and the choice depends on how much time you have and how hot it is.. but if you have an hour I would take the longer journey... it's very peaceful and relaxing and you may be lucky to get a cool breeze off the water, especially at sunset!

Hustle & bustle. The dock is an experience not to be missed. It's a teeming mass of people hopping on and off the water ferries to cross the creek.It is necessary to sit sideways on the boat, was a bit nervous about this because you are very close to the water. Try not to get on a boat with no other passengers because we paid way over the odds for that trip as opposed to very cheap fares on the other boats with a lot of passengers. We really enjoyed having a dockside meal overlooking the creek, there was always something to see and the atmosphere is great.

Fascinating touch of local colour. You can take these little boats across the Creek (really a river) for one dirham from stop 31, Bur Dubai. Feel like a local sitting sideways on the dinghy while the motor put -puts beside you, spewing fumes. You can sit next to men in long white gowns, or trousers and shirts. Not long after you're at the Dubai souk.
returning to history. I recommend to everyone who visit Dubai. Only 1 Dhrs, 10 minutes trip at Creek, with very old woody boat. It is really cool

Dubai creek and the Abras - love them.. Quaint, rickety, smelly, noisy, used by everyone - from local emiratis, to ex-pats, to business people, to labourers - you'll meet everyone here..... and I love them. Cross the creek in a few minutes for 1 dirham, or hire one for yourself and friends and spend an hour going the length of the creek and back for 120 dirhams, and still a bargain. See the whole creek with its variety of architecture, from the traditional wind-tower houses of the Bastikia, to the old mud buildings and narrow alleyways of the gold and spice souks, to the gleaming glass skyscrapers further down, and the green parks beyond. Take a look at the colourful old dhows, loading up with all manner of goods to trade up and down the gulf, and to India, Africa and beyond; then just beyond those, the luxury yachts and leisure craft and the beautiful old dinner-cruise dhows. Lots of street food stalls, creek side restaurants, refreshment kiosks, lots to look at and enjoy, very clean and friendly, and wonderfully atmospheric. I HAVE to come here every time I visit Dubai and simply love it. A cheap and very cheerful day out for everyone.

The traditional way to cross the creek. There is a bridge to cross the creek to Deira, but the real way is to cross on water by Abra. Some of these wooden craft look a little unstable, but the handlers have been operating these boats for many years, so I think they are quite safe. To travel by Abra is something to experience!

Creek Crossing. Easy way of crossing the creek, only takes a few minutes and costs a few Dhs. If you want to get to the gold or spice shops and are on the North side of the creek this is the easiest way. Can be busy near prayer time or when people are leaving work. If a women is crossing they are normally put in their own line and usually get on first.There are 2 crossings leaving from, make sure you are on the correct abra.

Cheap and cheerful way to travel on Abra. Very interesting travelling on Abra the local, traditional way. The Abra(boats) are traditionally made and used to ferry from one end to other. A lot of activity goes on here with the local businesses as goods are imported/exported from region to region. It is indeed a good experience to observe the real tradition Dubai this way.

Bustle. This is the old Dubai -- but be carefull, it s slippery, people are in a hurry, it s not according to safety standards applied in other countries but it s probably the best view while crossing the creek for a couple of Dhs you will ever get of Bur Dubai and Deira -- don t use the aircon abras, thats only 10 % of the experience. Never heard of an accident but don t get up before the abras has reached the other pier / landing side, there could be a bad bump waiting once it stops.

Better than a ferry 'cross the Mersey. Experience the traditional way of crossing the Creek, almost for free. It is fun, and you rub shoulders with a complete cross section of society, from the business man sharing his lunch with the fish, to the labourers who would be confined to one side of Dubai without this transport

Cheap and local way to travel. An abra ride across the Dubai creek is a fun way to experience the local culture. The ride is so cheap and you see all kinds of people riding on the boats. On either side of the creek and close to the abra docks, there are souks that sell spices, souvenirs, clothing and home decor.

travel to the true dubai. travelled from abra from diera creek area to burdubai abra ,with my family,in winter abra travel is beautiful , u have ample parking space in diera side,there are soem excellent street food shops near diera abra stop- to not to be missed is teh cooked chickpea with chilli spice and onion ,cut greenjchillies,with big green chilli dipped in batter fry-and a astrong kadak chaimoving to burdubai u have suoq there with textile shops and antique shops, not to mis is teh 2 pakkoda shops( check ur stomack if u are sensitive for oily deepfriedn foods) its cheap and excellent street food, you can walk upto to house of Makhtoum family and museum at end of creek entrance

"Travel like the Local on an Abra". Travel as the locals do cross the Creek from Deira to Bur Dubai by Abra. This is a blast from the past and costs the princely sum of 1 dirham to the driver collected on board the Abra. The Abra's shuttle back and fore in large numbers and they go when full. This is the original Dubai with Deira & Bur Dubai having loads of streets with every type of shop also Dubai Fort is in this area of Bur Dubai.The nearest Metro Station is Al Ghubaiba. On Deira side there are the Spice, Textile and the Gold Souks. A very worthwhile place to visit on your holiday in Dubai.

Interesting Experience.. It's very interesting to cross Dubai Creek by taking Abra.If you'd like to experience the life like local Arabian, you'd never miss abra!More importantly, ticket price is unbelievable low of merely 1.0AED (~0.3USD)!

very cool experience. Just don't expect too much. But this is very original - this is a way the locals travel (in this particular area). Takes only 6-7 minutes. If you have never traveled this way, must-do!
Old world charm. Old world charm, the Abra operates for 1 Dirham from Bur Dubai to Creek side, you get the old world charm of how people used to travel from one point to the other.
Old meets new. Brilliant little touch to add to the excitement of a day at the souks! Extremely cheap- 1 Dirham! Really good fun and a good place for photos/filming. I highly recommend it!

Great way to cross to Burdubai. Very nominal fees to use this local age old transport system sustaining on expat use. A great way to see city skyline and cross on the other side. Market and shopping area at both ends. Very cool during dusk times. Very hot and humid in afternoons.

Great Authentic Experience. We were told this is a must do. Not realizing how inexpensive these trips are we went over expecting to hear a high price but were stunned by the low aed amount. So fun especially as people are crossing late in the day.
Way back in Time. Want to see the old bollywood style docks with small boats bringing in goods be at this place to see the old retail and the wholesale industry and deal with the locals.

Very relaxing. Well we used the water taxi being started by the RTA. I found it more appealing and comfortable with well equipped cushioned seats and dafey measures. Tickets is quite cheap so i wud recommend this over the typical abra rides. We found it very relaxing and provided a good view of adjoining buildings and creek area. Do try it if u have a love for sight seeing. I will recommend it to arrange ur trip such that u visit dubai museum, heritage village, shiekh makhdoum house and abra ride on thw same day as all these attractions are near by.

old dubai. After all the modernity this boat ride across the river in the evening to the older souks across the river was a great treat to get more a feel for the city. and only 1 dirham! Roam around the souks on either side of the river and check out the great vegetarian Indian restaurant near Abra dock
Relax and wind down. After a busy day site seeing the Abra boats are a good way to wind down and view the creek. Our trip took us up and the creek with good views of Deira waterfronts.

Loved this boat trip - very cheap to get from one side of creek to other. This is an authentic way to cross the river to get to little India. The lovely thing about it is that because everyone sits back to back, everyone can enjoy the amazing view and the hustle and bustle of the Dubai Creek. It costs approx 1 Dirdam. Just hold on tight at there are no safety rails around the edge of the boat. I could have shuttled to and fro all day! :-)

Worth taking the Abra for a creek crossing. Quaint way to travel. Gives you a feel of how it must have been in Dubai a quarter century ago before it became all glitz and glamour. It is cheap barely a Dirham and shows you how the labourers live and travel. If you have been a couple of times to Dubai then you'd hold try to do some different things what the locals do

Very good attraction. Very good attraction. Experiencing the dry dock's height and length was amazing. Would definitely recommend getting a guided tour of the dock as otherwise limited information available.
nice view. nice view of the dubai creek and the buildings that are by its side.very cheap.just a dirham to go across
Cheap and fun. Was pleasantly surprised at the low low price of taking an abra across the creek. Doing it the way the locals do.

Travel - old school style. Had an interesting walk through the textiles souk on the way between the old Dubai fort and the Bur Dubai Abra dock. Caught the boat across the creek for 1 dirrim. All part of the experience!

Quick service. Easily able to access this ride across the creek. Just hop on and have your 1 dirham ready to hand to the boatman. If you are unsure what to do just ask someone. Cheapest ride in Dubai. Would be great to enjoy this area in the cooler season.

Hot....very hot..... A waste of time and the area is not conducive for upscale tourists...not very safe either.....and the trips offered are really nothing great.....the boats are in a dilapidated condition....

I love Bur Dubai Abra Dock. I love Bur Dubai Abra Dock, all the part of Dubai makes me feel as I'm not in Dubai anymore. I will not spend my full week end there but for one day you can spen some really good moment

Nice experience. It is a kind of short transportation way which take you from a side of Dubai to the other (Diera and Bar Dubai).
Cheep and fast and better than using TAXI which mostly take time because of traffic.
Still primitive part of Dubai. This part of Dubai is still lying in the olden days. The otherwise beautiful and modern Dubai is totally cut off from this part.

One of the most organized and systematic boat crossing.. I have been taking the Abra boat ride since 1982 when I first visited Dubai with my family. It is a must do ride in Dubai if you have the time and the option, better do it when it is not too hot or sunny ay be after 5pm. The Abra is for sure the cheapest and the fastest mode of transport to cross from Bur Dubai to Deira and is also considered as a life line to workers, business people, customers, tourist, etc who live and visit Dubai.I wish there was a similar thing in our country.Keep it up.
amaizing. As a first time visitor to Dubai there were many new hotels to choose from. The staff were exceptional. All were friendly and professional.

At its best in suring the sunset. If you want to go there just for the fun of it, try to reach there during the sun set, around 5-6 in the evening will be good enough.You can travel in the abra from burdubai to deira ( crossing the stream) for just AED 1 per head.the breezing wind, the view of the sun set, Oh the beauty!! But if it is a round trip, make sure of the destination it goes to. There are 2-3 abra docks along each coast which are walk able distance from each other. if you are done with the the trip, you can have a walk along the creek.

Traditional. Greetings of the day :-)if you are planning to visit Dubai Museum i will suggest to take a traditional way to reach Come on baniyas road you will find on creek so many little boats they charge only 1 AED.. yes am not kidding one AED and your creek is Crossed and you are entered in to old dubai, and in this market dont feel shy to bargain trust me if something is100 AED tell them you want to 50 AED they will say no just leave the shop the will call you heheheheh thats my Trick then walking to beautifull streets you will get to museum. Enjoy :-) enjoy the amazing history of Dubai

Hark back to history. It gives you a real tast of the old time Dubai and on cool winter evenings walking beyond the abra station follow the path around the creek side. You will arrive at sheik mo's former house and the heritage village. The creek at night offers some outstanding night photographs with glitzy but serene dhows plying up and down the creek way. Bit confusing at the abra station at first, but if in doubt someone in uniform can guide you and take our dirham with the for the fare. It's a wonderful ride and if you can do both day and night. Opting for old souk and spice souks in the evening. My only down side is dependent on how you arrive at the abra station you may have to pass the textile souk and frankly the traders don't always accept that you don't want the latest in Arabic throbe or scarf and the walk through can be tedious. But be polite and just smile.

The magic of ancient Dubai.. There are two main routes. The first route runs between Bur Dubai Abra Dock and Deira Old Souk Abra Dock (near to the mouth of the creek), while the other runs between Dubai Old Souk Abra Dock and Sabkha Abra Dock. The excellent way to experience the magic of ancient Dubai through picturesque view of the city.Not recommended when this much heat.

Dubai treasure. If you are interested in getting to know the origins of Dubai, then take a trip to the Creek and rent your own Abra (water taxi) to go up and down before you cross to the Souks.One of my personal favourite parts of Dubai, it’s a historical part of the town and you can negotiate a fee with the captain, who will take you on a private little tour to see the old part of the city.You can do the trip at different times of the day, at sunset and at night as it will be a completely different experience all together.Go behind HSBC bank on Bur Dubai to get on the Abra and cross to Deira to visit the Souks.Make sure you have your camera as there are a lot of photo opportunities, just remember to ask permission before taking pictures of people, especially local ladies and dress modestly.If traveling with young kids, make sure to visit a toilet before going there as there aren't many clean options around.
Great free experience. We travelled on the abra for the bargain price of one dirham. Great ride across the creek between the spice and textile souks. It was great to embrace some emirati culture.

a must do experience, taking a ride on an abra. we roamed around meena bazaar , had lunch in mini punjab there and then decided to head towards the abra dock, we went through narrow alleys and old buildings, asked around and finally reached this abra dock. it was early evening when we reached and there was a crowd there but the atmosphere was electic and nice. there was a nice wind blowing and people were just clicking pics and chilling there. we too went to a nearby souk, shopped for sum souviniers then decided to take an abra ride (which was 1 of th best decisions we made). Taking a ride on an abra is an experience in itself, and its practically free in 1 dirham :). we had our two children , a child buggy , sum shopping bags , yet managed to hop on an abra which took us to the deira side of dubai. there were sea gulls flying around, people on different types of boats waving , there was even a water bus transporting its passengers, a dhow, it was an adventurous experience which cannot be simply described in words. it was like one is living the life of a local by taking a ride on the abra. we enjoyed it thoroughly (even my kids)

Evening time pass. I combined my visit to the Indian temple with a boat ride at the creek. Its a 5 minute walk from the temple to the Abra dock through the souk selling clothes and dress materials. You can hop on to a stationed boat and when the boat is full, a guy comes around to collect 1 dirham from each passenger. Its a 10-minute ride across the creek. Its not a ferry but an open boat, so boat ride in the evening brings with it the cool breeze and sunset.For most people who get on to the boat, this is a cheap means of crossing the water. If you are a budget traveller looking for good experiences for a less price, I definitely recommend the boat ride.

Beautiful at Night. The Abra Dock near the Dubai Creek is the best place to go for a stroll in the late evenings. The Creek is lined with beautifully decorated dhows that offer attractive dinner packages. The Abra takes commuters across the river to Deira at nominal rates. The breeze and the seagulls flying low offers a beautiful picture at dusk.
Favorite part of Dubai. wandering the alleys and souks in Bur Dubai and Deira and the Abra ride across the creek were our favorite part of our trip.
Nice. Best way to come to Abra dock is from „Al Ghubaiba“ metro station (green line). „Abra cruise“ is a nice ride across the creek. It is worth spending few hours in the shopping at the souks.

riding abra like the locals do. Abra transport is a practical and affordable mean for the locals to cross the creek in a swift. It's also tourist's delight to experience something so indigent and yet so efficient. For 1 AED(approx. USD 0.30) you can get on this simple wooden watercraft from the abra dock and pick a space to sit on (the benches are lined in the middle parallel along the boat). Boat is motorized by the diesel, so get used to the fume and noise from it. There are designated boat docks along both sides of the Creek. The popular docks are the Dubai Old Souq marine station(by the textile souq) and the Deira Old Souq marine station(by the spice souq). Crossing the Creek on abra can be little frightened since there is no handrail to hold on to. In general still pretty safe to ride on. You pay after you board. Sometime you might come close to the Dhow dinner cruises sailing by. The night crossing on the abra is fun to do you can enjoy the cool breeze, colorful hanging lights decorated dhows, the glowing neon lights from the buildings along the Creek, and the light reflections on the water waves.

Different Boat Experience. We had taken the metro to visit the spice & gold souk's, and decided we would return via the Abra Dock's. You are able to take a water taxi across the creek. The taxi's are very basic and functional, but a bit of fun for the kids. There are no railings and "comfort" seating, but a short ride across the creek for 1 Dirham is one of the less expensive things you will do in Dubai. It is also a small glimpse into old Dubai, which is quite refreshing, considering all the modern marvel's Dubai has to offer. There are also some good views from the water that can be captured for those memories.

MUST DO - cross the creek in an abra - costs less than $1. Every visitor to Dubai must cross the creek with an abra (an old traditional water taxi). A crossing costs you 1AED and you get great views of the creek and the dhows. It's the best way to get from the textile souk to the gold and spice souks and vice versa.

Busy Creek. Visited in Company of my 6 and 9 years Olds...we love the experience ....Some of the boats can quite colourful in the night with decorative lightings adorning the boat exterior. Not only that we had some fresh organic fruit juice with tasty burgers and some pop corn at marine restaurant. The boat ride are quite cheap and fun.

Good value for 1 AED. Worth a trip across the creek for 1 AED. Join the locals for an interesting 10 minute journey across the creek to the souks. Try and time it for sunset.Personally, I was disappointed by the spice souk.

Great views crossing the creek. Only 1 Dirham each way for the 10 minute trip across the creek on an Abbra, (water taxi). Great views of the creek across to see the Gold and Spice Souks and to watch the Dhows being unloaded.

Went back and forth just for the fun of it. 1 AED per person per trip. Just kept on taking pictures and going back and forth. Just have to be careful when the weather is rough. While we were there they was news that one person tipped over during one of those sand storms.
Be a "local"!. Loved this although you have to be quick getting on and off. The locals are experts and slide in front of you to all available spaces.Good way to get to the gold souk.
Super cheap and fun!. Why not pay 1 dirham and take a fun ride across the river on an old boat. The ride is short, but I found it entertaining.

Local people. Of course, there is some smell of the gasoline from the 'abra', They run very often, many people are using it - all of them local people, we were all sitting next to each other which was interesting. It is cheap and useful transport. We recommend it.

Not sure this is an "Attraction". The abra docks were easy to use, staffed with helpful agents, prices were low, and it's a fun, easy, relaxing way to get across the creek. It's a transportation hub, that's all.

Why not?. The visit to the old city of Dubai can't be completed without the reliable and super cheap water taxi. Best way to get over the Dubai Creek, unless you take a taxi or metro. Good way to see the old city and relax from walking. Plenty of souks and shops around the water taxi as well.
Olde World Charm. Lovely way to experience the Creek and Old Dubai area and for only 1 AED some excellent bargain shops and inexpensive dining available in the area too

Abra Trip across the creek. We took Dubai City Tour and part of the tour included an Abra trip across the creek - fascinating to diagonally cross from the historic side in Bur Dubai to Deira on the other side of the creek where the Spice Souk and Gold Souk are located.The Abra boat trip made you feel like a going back in time as an intrepid traveller experiencing by the hustle & bustle on this busy water way - great fun and recommended
Great experience. Great experience for only 1 dirham per person, although a little hair raisingEasy way to travel between souk areas, and only takes a few minutes
Join the locals. Another Dubai must do. We just crossed to the gold souk but at only 1 AED a great experience. We loved it.
Ride across the creek. Fun time crossing Deira creek with the locals. Very short 2-3 minute ride across the creek. Gets you to Deira where you can shop at the Spice Souk or Gold Souk.

GOTTA SEE THE SOUKS. A river is usually at the heart of a city and this one is no exception. Hop on a dhow for the crossing to the Old Souks where you can wander around spice stores, gold stores, souvenir stores and all manner of great stuff. The store owners are friendly and fun-loving if you approach them in the same way. Be polite even if they are touting for you to buy - its just their way. Have a bit of fun with them and the experience will be all the better. Thoroughly enjoyed stepping back in time...........
Experience. Wonderful experience for AED1 to cross from old dock to Deira. You can go to souk from here. Excellent experience
The best spent 1Dh!. Chaotic and crowded but well-worth it. No rails on abra but felt safe.A great way to see the creek, mosque and palace.I did it a few times, just because I could!
must do in Dubai. It's almost like bumper boats but what an atmosphere. 1 Dh and you get to cross the creek and see so much on the way. For tourists and locals alike. Noisy, smelly, old school, fun.
Great time crossing the bay. Take the Abra (boat) all for yourself (family, friends), including a tour of the bay. It is a bit scary with no rails, nor life vests, so be carefull with children

Traditional small boat dock - enjoyable trips across the Creek. This is 'old Dubai' where small boats steered from the middle take all comers very cheaply from one side of the Creek to another. It's a no frills service and a very enjoyable way to see this bit of the town and get a flavour of local life. Nice local food on the dockside too..

cool cruising on the creek. The Abra cruise is another must. seeing the souks around the creek show Dubai in perhaps a more traditional light. And that cruise down the creek is so cooling, the breeze and views are great! It's a cheap way to tour the creek too - a few Dhirams.
Abra boat ride. The Abra boat ride across the creek was fun. It really allows you to see the old city from a different perspective. And at a couple Dirrhams excellent value.

One of the things to do in Dubai. It is fun to do and cheap (AED 1)
going for a one hour (AED 100) trip is fine but quite uninteresting

Past meets present. You can get a very good feel of how things might have been in years past when you visit this place as it still carries the sense of years past with all the abra boats, but I do imagine that the volume of traffic and boats today is far less than that of the past. Again, this being the modern era, it's no surprise, but worth seeing if you have a good sense of imagination to think about how it was years ago. Good heritage site, authenticity is fading though, see it before it gets completely ruined with the modern era.

cheap boat ride to cross from one part of Dubai to the other.. it is nice to get on an Abra to cross the Dubai channel. you get the 'honour' of mingling with the local crowd of many other nationalities who use this means of transport. If the smell of sweat is not your type, then just stay away. Otherwise, you will certainly enjoy it !!! thumbs up !!
its arabic feeling .... visiting this area is a must ... so many shop selling souvenir and dubai stuff, very nice, traditional and old ambience.

A must-do experience.. Like the Star Ferry in HK and the Staten Island Ferry in NY, it's one of the world's great water rides, and certainly the cheapest. Don't wear heels, and don't fall for the touts trying to flog you an expensive private ride.

One of the best values in Dubai!. For 1Dirhams, yes about 30 cents American, we had a 5-minute ride across The Creek in a traditional Abra with local workers as they were commuting to/from work. I understand you can hire an Abra for an agreed-on price to take a longer ride on The Creek, but we were just needing to get to the other side.It was a local delight and is one thing I was hoping to be able to do again before I left, but it didn't work out.
Something different. A contrast of the new and the old Dubai. Take the ferry boat ride @ 1 dirham to experience the diversity that Dubai has to offer.

Nothing special if you come from India. This is a very much hyped tourist destination. This is something you would see in many parts of India. If you are visiting here from India, its no brainer that this is a place to skip.It gives you a view of how the old dubai looked and what it has transformed to.Its just another dock where there are boats to ferry you across a smelly and dirty river. Its right next to the Dubai museum and could be used to ferry across to the Gold and spice souk. Cheapest way to travel from one half of dubai to the other. The same in a taxi would cost you 10 times more
LOVELY TO WATCH. Very interesting to see dhow's being loaded and unloaded. Cheap exciting water taxi ride not to be missed.

Nice in the evening. Nice place to visit in the evening, with several souq's nearby for wandering around after a nice meal. Short trip over the creek is well worth the 1 AED fee, and is recommended for everyone. Interersting to see all of the wooden ships in the dock as well.
Dubai. Dubai has clear skies, clear blue waters, clean surroundings, welcoming people, and grandiose sites. The Dubai ferry really fun.
Typical Old Dubai. A world away from the sky scrapers of new Dubai. Enjoy a 1 dirham ride on the abras to the Souk to enjoy the smells and sights of the spice markets.

Fun and local feel. If u want to have a feel of real Dubai which is away from cosmopolitan attractions , u must visit abra dock which is located in bur Dubai . For 1 dhs u can have a ride in a dhow across the creek .

Very Cheap Entertainment for all. A trip across the creek on an Abra is a must when you're in Dubai. It costs only one Dirham per person and you simply give it to the driver when you get on board. On the Bur Dubai side there are the silk souks while on the other side are located the gold and spice souks so there is something to see on both sides. The dock itself is vibrant and never stops, go, go, go...
Dhows are fun!. I loved traveling by dhow between Bur Dubai and Deira, cheap (1 dirham) and authentic. Always available as well

Well worth the 1 Dirham for the view. The abra is like a water bus operated by the public transport authority. You simply turn up and then board and pay your captain the 1 Dirham. Then enjoy the view of this busting harbour and the both sides of the 'Creek"

Old and New.. One can get a glimpse of the old Dubai as it was and the new Dubai as it is now.The Abra ride was wonderful and specially the trip to the Gold Souk.Sure do remember to go there while in Dubai.
Take the evening ride with an abra boat, rent it for yourself for an hour!. Very nice and calm thing to do, quite romantic with the sun going down. About AED 100-120 for an hour. So cheap and fun!

nice abra journey. i think it's really cheap and good way to connect bur & Deira area just 1 aed per person per way is really cheap and good to experience. water is clean. You don't have to wait for the abra. They are widely available

Heart of Old Dubai. Absolutely a must-see and must-try for any visitor to Dubai. Old abras available in old part of Dubai at the Creek are still used as a main mean of transportation across the Creek by local population. Abra trip will give you unforgettable few minutes of relaxation enjoying view of Old Dubai from water perspective.

Quick and cheap. The two historic district between Bur Dubai and Deira at Dubai Creek the crossing easiest and fastest way.Unless, if you are misinformed, and other stations are brought inside as you want!The boats leave from the Burj Dubai Old Souk Station, to Spice Souk Abra Station and to Al Sabkha Abra Station two directions. After repeated questioning neither at the Spice Souk Abra Station scheduled ended up, so we had to walk. Be the time to clarify your destination!A boat without a barrier, but they were not going to stand. If anyone still bother to try to metro. The boats will leave when full. There is high passenger traffic, so almost every minute depart the boats.

So cool!. What an experience! I recommend that you get away from all the tourist traps and go from Bur Dubai to Deira for a day in the Gold Souk and Spice markets. For 1dh (20 cents US!) you get on, grab an open seat, and float down to Deira (and back for another dirham when you're ready). It's an awesome way to get a little history lesson in the old part of Dubai.
A nice 5 minute ride. It is a nice 5 minute ride for just 1 AED. People are good and safe. I connects Gold Souk to Creek. Can be done while visiting Dubai Museum or Gold Souk

Fun ride. The first time we took the abra was at night and did not know where we were going. I was great fun It is in the old part of Dubai. It is used by the locals as a taxi to get from one side to the other side of the creek and is only 1AED per ride. It is a wonderful way to meet the locals and get to the souks. The people were very helpful and we had a great fun time
Abra. Its a very good experience, its in between the city and shares the historic and cultural part of Dubai
Real 1Dh experience. Great that everybody can use this mean of transport as it's great local experience. You pay 1 Dh to the guy on a boat and go. 5 minutes and you're at Bur Dubai.

a bit of nostalgia. This was a pleasent ex[ereience. Given the cities huge sky scrapers and modern living. sitting on a old boat taking you to the old souk and gold markets was a joy and only having to pay 1aed was a bargain.

A Hive of Activity. Take a ride across the Dubai Creek for the minimal price of 1AED - the cheapest transport in Dubai. The abras operate day & night. All you do is climb on board, sit down and when all the seating space if full the boat owner/pilot will collect everyone's money and off you go. It is a short, but fun ride across the creek. You pass other abras & water vessels on your trip. It is a must to do while in Dubai!
cheapest fare in dubai. cheapest transport in dubai...1 AED per person per side...1 side rowing takes around 2-3 mins...there are no railings on the boat but still it's a fun...
Heritage Revisited. A great place to take family and friends visiting from other countries. A true description of old U.A.E and it is almost overwhelming. The markets and abra rides are a must!

Price never increased here.. Its a Abra (boat taxi) dock in Bur Dubai. Very easy and comfortable way to travel from Bur Dubai to Daira Dubai. I am visiting Dubai since last 15 years. Cost for this Abra is 1 Dirham per pax and it is not changed since many years.

Romance in Dubai. The best money you will spend in Dubai. Instead of paying the 1 AED to cross the creek, ask to rent an abra for 1/2 hour. They'll charge about 60 AED and take you up and down the creek. My husband and I did this at sunset on our last night there, it was the perfect ending to an amazing trip.
Well worth a visit. Feeling of the real Dubai, really cheap also. We went by night as well, and that was really an experience.

VALUE FOR MONEY AND TOURISTY. I would recommend the abra as it is the most fascinating ferry across the creek at 1 dirham. U may vist the textile souk and gold Souk with the Abra. The Dubai Museum is close to the Textile Souk.

Old Dubai at its best!. For 1 dirham only this is something nobody should miss! Visit the Gold and spice souks on one side, then take an abra to the other where you can have a lunch or wander yet through another market. There are some food sellers, why not get a samosa for 2-3 dirhams, or a coconut water. If you want, you can hire the abra for yourself for 1 hr tour on the creek, it costs around 120 dirhams (last time we took)

Great experience and great way to cross the creek. Great experience and great way to cross the creek. This is not just a tourist venue. This is a common mode of transportation to cross the creek for locals and tourists. Be ready to be "hounded" by the vendors on both sides, but a simple "no thank you" is all that it takes to be left alone.Great views from the creek, and it only costs 1 AED, which is about 25 cents US.

Good value for money. Gets you from A to B for 1 Dirham! If you're in the Souk area and fancy a lift over to the Spice Bazaar (from Mina Bazaar) then it will take a few minutes in a small boat to cross the murky waters. A great way to experience everyday life and mingle with locals (less vocal more visual communication).
Best value for the experience. Where else can you get a boat ride with a Middle Eastern vibe for a quarter (1 AED)? Boats are very basic, wooden abras with bench seating.

Well worth a visit. The textile souk is one side of the creek and the old souk and gold souk are on the other side. These are well worth a visit and you can catch the abra boat between the two. These are an experience in themselves and so cheap at 1 dirham to cross.We were also offered the chance to hire one for half an hour or an hour but having already been on the water bus and a dhow decided to just cross the creek.

Old Dubai. This is definitely a place to visit when in Dubai. There is hustle, bustle and haggling nearby in the textile souk (bur Dubai) and in the spice and gold souks (Deira) and a lovely Abra crossing in between. The Abra experience is a good one, a small boat crossing the creek, next to all the dhows for 1 Dhs each. The guides will show you which boat to get on, sit on the bench, hand your money to the man in the 'hole' in the middle, when full the boat will leave. Once you arrive at them other side wait until it comes to a complete stop (don't follow the regulars who jump off when it is near to the dock) and then get off. Great views of the creek.

More than you expect. We were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed this. It is a nice calm half an hour on the boat. There are also lots of lovely restaurants near by to sit and relax, and people watch! I would defintely do this again next time we are in Dubai.

Ever changing scene. It's cool by the water here even on a hot day. The food is basic, tasty and fresh. The food is enhanced by the constant stream of abras and other river traffic that ply their trade up and down the Creek. Lively and very different to glitzy Dubai.

Best Value for Money Ever. 1 Dirham per Person ( 0.27 $) from Deira to Bur Dubai. Even cheaper than walking or swimming the Khor. Don't be afraid from crowds they vanish easily because there is too many boats and there is always a boat waiting for passengers. This is the real essence of Dubai (Old Dubai), On Bur Dubai Side there is an old market (mostly Pakistani fabrics and shoes) and a very nice restaurant.Don't miss this, It is very nice from the transportation authority to leave these boats working with the same rates since a very long time

Don't missed this. We paid just dh1 for a ride from Abra harbour to the opposite. Just an experience of the local water transport ride.During the boat ride, you enjoy the windy sea water thus look like a river. Many seagents are moving around.Wonderful experience!

Bur Dubai. Well worth a visit but ladies please be respectful with your dress code as this is the old area of Dubai and as such is more conservative then Dubai city. Clothing that covers up your top half and 3 quarter shorts or long dresses would be best to wear in this area
A must for Dubai visitors. 1 dirham to cross the Creek on an Abra is one of Dubai's best value experiences - highly recommended.

quaint and laid back. its like stepping into another era...the rest of dubai shines like diamonds... this is what i thought dubai would be like... quaint.. old.. laid back.. shopping ion souks.. the museum... the lanes... the dancing singing white seagulls.. the water....

Boat trip is a great experience. Quite cheap to go up and back for an hour for a small group on one of the boats, before crossing over the creek. Very relaxing and enjoyable. Boatmen seem to do it hard, so give them a good tip!

It's just part of the experience. very few original things left in Dubai. This is one of them. Park on the Bur Dubai side, enjoy the ride, explore the souks in Deira, come back for a late lunch or dinner on the creek. Make sure to pick one of the local restaurants. Most importantly go slow and take the pictures with your hearth

Old Dubai is the best Dubai. Love Bur Dubai, near airport and port.Tip: if you're active duty Navy, regardless of nationality, check out Seafarer's Club right next to port. Free entry with CAC card, swimming pool, place to chillax, cheap liquor great food. We used their facilities, and stored our luggage while waiting on our cruise ship. Note they do close at midnight.Bur Dubai, definitely take the water taxis to cross the creek, very inexpensive. Gold souk is magnificient, but if you're serious about buying gold (their's is 22kt) make sure you know daily market worth in gram, in Dirham, and don't pay more than 10% over market. Prices will vary, be shrewd, and walk away if their price does not meet math. I'm a jeweler, push the I believe Kimi button on this. *Note, mostly all their jewelry is manufactured in India, so ask.Souk shopping was great, picked up several dresses, as an example, one dress they wanted 350Dirham, I paid 120DirhamNegociaite with a smile, and for the love of God / Allah / Whoever, don't pay for anything in any other currency than Dirham. You'll be treated like a tourist if you do. When I travel to states, I always make a point of letting them know I live in Bahrain.

Different view of Dubai. Took a taxi from our hotel to the dock, wandered around the textile souk and Old Dubai and then took the abra across the creek for 1 AED each - a bargain and beautiful views from the creek to the textile souk and gold souk.Was a bit disappointed by the textile souk...only seemed to be a couple of streets and mainly only selling pashmina. Husband's bargain of the day was a can of coke for 2 AEDs.
Abra boat ride, cheap and an experience!. Did this to cross the creek. Costs 1 AED (about £0.20). Rickety wooden boats, but very traditional. Take your camera!

Transportation, not an attraction. Great way to cross the water. Cheaper and much quicker than a taxi on the road. 1 duram gets you across. They also have tours for 120 duram that take a bit less than an hour and are a good way to see the area if you don't want to cover it on foot.

Fun way to cross Dubai Creek. Travelling on a traditional Abra is a perfect way of crossing Dubai Creek from Deira to Bur Dubai. It is cheap at 1 AED and a lot of fun too. The Abras take about 20 people and when they are full they depart; a great way of seeing the Creek from a different viewpoint.
Water taxi. Abra- a traditional water taxi that take you across dubai creek. you'll get to see a great view of the creek good for photography.its not expensive. try it once atleast!

The cheapest way to cross to the Creek. This is the cheapest way to cross to the opposite site of the Creek. Most of the local will use the small boat Abra to cross the Creek.I decided to go to the Bani Yas, Gold Souq, Spice Souq from the dock near Dubai Museum or Bur Dubai Abra Station. The opposite is called Deira Abra Station.
Go local!. Great way to cross the creek - you can go on a posh boat for about £10 or travel like a local for 20 pence using the abra boats.

U must visit bur dubai. Me and my husband rode the water taxis to but dubai and we absolutely loved it! It was a great experience and so cheap; at 1aed per person. We visited the museum and the market and it was just great! Shopping galore!
Definately a place to visit!

Abra ride for 1AED. Experience a short abra ride (5 mins)from Bur Dubai to Deira for 1AED to old Dubai where you can see the gold souk,spice market,the fishing boats(on the way) and if you are interested you can take a Dhow cruise dinner @ Bur dubai. You can return by abra ride or nearer to gold souk you can find Al Ras metro station.

Old Dubai balances out the new.. Ride a dhow to get to Deira. Dhow is a simple bench on the boat run by diesel, go w the locals to the old Souks for spices and gold. A neat experience and good views of the old buildings from the boat. Peaceful. Clean. Short boat trip but great way to get back and forth.
Nice!. Best 1 Dhs spent in Dubai! Sunset is best!It was nice and short ride.... You can also book 1 hour for 120 Dhs
fun. it's fun and cheap. good shawarma place around the corner too. it takes you the gold souk which is fun. and cheap shopping!

Interesting area. The areas around the docks are good to look around, historic sites, souks etc The short boat/ferry ride is cheap and good, ideally do it one way in daylight then the return at night, you get a different perspective.

Try it!!!!!!!!!!!!!. The souks are well worth the visit, the Abras' are not overloaded, 18 people max and the captains do not allow anymore, for 1 dirham across the creek, well worth the experience, to buy spices and do a bit of tourist shopping. All stores selling much of a much, however haggling is the name of the game. Great place to buy nougat and various types of dates as well........

JUST FOR FUN. To connect Bur Dubai to Old souk, you take the ABRA. For AED 1. Just for the fun of getting across the creek is an experience on its own. On the other side is the spice market, gold souk and textile places
Great views. Great views of city, good for crossing creek and cheap to use, however disappointed with how much rubbish and debris was in the creek, probably the dirtiest place we experienced.
Not to be missed. A must do thing when in Dubai - only 1 dirham, and brings you over Dubai Creek to the souks (Spice, Gold, Perfume, and Fish souk).
Cruises. The buffet was average. Boats did not provide a suitable place to take exeptional photos. Entertainment was ok.

Every tourist should try an abra!. Pleasant ride from the gold souk area to the other side where the Dubai museum is located.
One ride=1 dirham

A One Dirham Boat Ride Across Dubai Creek. This is a fun thing to do, and the original mode of transportation for hundreds of years. Remember to sit down and bring your camera. The spice and gold souks are on the Deira side and the textile souk is on the Bur Dubai side.

Step back in time on an abra. We thought that the abras might be touristy. We were wrong! These are still a major form of water transport for the locals on their way to and from the markets. You really feel that you're stepping back in time as you cross the waters from one souk to another, passing by old wooden trading ships that still sail the Arabian seas all the way to India and back. This was a very special and very (genuinely) authentic experience. Please enjoy!

Not to be missed. Crossed the creek in an abra and then spent a good few hours browsing. Had egg parathas in a back street and then fresh juice and samosas by the creeks - both very inexpensive. Enjoyed watching the boats being loaded up ready for their long journeys. It was great to see this side of Dubai and it it was just as enjoyable as the 5 star hotels etc.

Great little diversion!. The abras are a fantastic 10mins or so journey across the river. really fun ride and very cheap - however be careful with kids as there is absolutely no barriers or heath & safety whatsoever so easy to fall in the river!

1 dirham boat ride ... Where else in the world?. Go to the souks on the Al Ghubaiba side then take an abra across to the spice souks. Great opportunities for photos enroute. A very short but enjoyable ride.
Abra ride a treat. The short abra ride was excellent. It was interesting to see how hard working the boat captains are. The souk near the dock area was very interesting.

Cheapest tour activity in Dubai. For AED 1, you can hop on the 'abra' (water taxi / big motor boat) from the dock at Bur Dubai where the textile souk (market) is or from the Deira side where the gold & spice souks are. There's a restaurant at the textile souk area. You can order drinks, sit down, relax & watch : flocks of sea gulls, abra ferrying peoples up & down the creek, the water, the buildings, etc. There's no life jacket, no side railing. But the abra isn't travelling too fast, no tide or strong current in the creek, boat is big. I don't know how to swim but I have no fear sitting on the abra. Enjoy every moment of it.

Would say the best and cheap - looks and sounds natural without any commercial motivation.. Would say the best and cheap - looks and sounds natural without any commercial motivation. This is the 2nd item that all travellers should do and avoid using the AED 155/Adult WonderBus or the AED 220 Big Bus Tour. This Abra ride is a must do and 2nd on my list just after Dubai Fountains
Go, go, go!!. My favorite after spending a fortune on visiting high buildings and only looking at money, it was a tremendous relife to spend 1 Dhs to cross Dubai Creek. A fantastic contrast!

A fun way to get across the creek. For 1Dhs this is a must do way of getting across from Deira to Bur Dubai. Quicker than driving and an experience not to be missed. For apporximately 100Dhs per hour you can hire an abra and the boatman will take you up and down the creek.

Good value transport. Definitely a most for the old Dubai experience.
Visit the Gold Souks and Spice Souks.
Cheap way to travel, in an expensive city.
Bur Dubai is definitely worth a visit.

Old Dubai in all its glory. A must do experience for visitors to go across the creek in one of these abras. Just be careful with young kids and mum and dad as there's no guardrails and very little lifesaving equipment onboard. Can be quite scary at night and not recommended if you're a non swimmer.
Confusing!!. Omg this place is the most confusing place ever and there is no one to give you help. Once you figure out how it works however its an amazing way to cross the creek.

Nice to watch the creek at sunset. Went here at around 5pm to stroll around the souks and soak up the atmosphere. Whilst it is not as lively or bustling as a market in Morocco or Tunisia it has a pleasant atmosphere and you can find souvenirs and nice Pashminas. The boat ride over the creek is 1 add and offers nice views of old Dubai. At that time of the day it's nice to sit at the creek with some mint tea and watch the little boats go back and forth. Nice alternative to the ultra modern high life downtown Dubai.

Nice touch. Nice insight into the old city of Dubai where traditional cultures comes alive. The spice markets and gold souks are popular there and is a good area for shopping. Definitely worth a visit to get a good feel of old Dubai.
Worth trying. It was worth trying. Our first driver appeared to be inexperienced. Hitting other boat and pilings. Other rides were much smoother.

Take a magic abra ride. The Bur Dubai is in the Old Souk area, across the Creek from the more famous and popular Gold and Spice Souks. Accordingly, fewer people spend their money in the Bur Dubai markets than in the Gold Souk market area.Please note that Dubai has become a cruise ship destination in recent years. During the 10 days we were in Dubai we saw the Gold and Spice Souks overrun with large groups of primarily German and Chinese tourists who were dutifully following their cruise guides to the places that give kickbacks to the cruise lines. There was noticeably less negotiating for jewelry in the Gold Souk versus the less-traveled Bur Dubai area.The great news, and the undoubted Bargain of Dubai, is that there are a couple of places on each side of the Creek where visitors can catch an "abra" (a diesel-powered wooden water taxi) and get transported across the Creek for one Dirham per person. So for the equivalent of 27 US cents per person, people can jump on an abra and take a 15-minute voyage across the Creek either to-or-from the Bur Dubai marketplace. The view of Dubai and the dhow docks along the Creek from the abra is absolutely magical.

Great to see. Lots of fun to see, but too scary to go on. The boats have basically no railling or sides. Boats are not tied down and people jump to and from the boat. Located near the old souk- it is well worth the visit. It was too scary for me, but others didn't seem to mind.

Traditional Boat.. The only thing that i found extremely entertaining is riding this boat from Deira to Bur Dubai and back. Its only 1 dirham one way...and u have the sea-gulls flying along with u. Love it.

Fast and cheap way to get across Dubai Creek.. We had to get across the Dubai Creek to the Spice Souk, and we bought a ticket for one of the boats, it was only 1 AED! It took about 5-10 minutes to get across the creek, and it was an enjoyable ride.

this is dubai. a 30 minute stroll along the side of the dock, watching the dhows load / unload, import and export happening the same way it did 50 years ago. Dont go at midday unless you have an umbrella to keep of the sun, there is little shade. the chance to catch the water taxis and also in this area the spice and gold souks. There are very nice hotels nearby but this is that hasn't change much in the last 40 - m50 years, well worth a mornigns stroll. remember to take your camera and a huge memory disc!
The cheapest turist attraction in Dubai. It has to be the cheapest turist attraction in Dubai.I recommend you get your map with you first. You will need to know where you are going.It is a nice ride
we got a cheap boat across 1 AED. The cheapness! :) There were expensive dhow cruises but you get a mini experience with the water taxis for 1 AED each - kids free.
1aed for sounds and sights. A must! Enjoy mixing with the locals.Sat near the front and got wet feet.Great fun. Shipmates ahoy. Just great...pls let that be 100 chars now

Great boat taxi. Gem of a little journey across the river. Start yourself at Al-Ras metro station and walk to the dock. Costs around £0.16 or $0.50c. You pay when you get on the boat. Try it yourself on your trip.

Well preserved and authentic!. Must commend the Dubai authorities for preserving this unique service and yet maintaining the safety quotient. This is by far the only cheapest ride in the whole of Dubai and deserves to be on the top of all attractions. Costs only 1 AED to cross the creek from Bur Dubai to Deira (Gold & Spice Souk).
