One must visit & experience the ride to feel the old school modes of transportation.
loved it. i love the small boat taking 1 dirhams and leave us on the opposite side. cold wind lovely, fresh water. love going at night bcoz evry hotels and place beside it very gliterring with lights

Quickest way to get to Deira. Frequent service. Only costs 1 UAE Dirham! Lovely trip across the creek. Great trip after dark, the lights on the dhows as they cruise the creek, and the beautifully lit skyline.

great authentic and cheap or free. authentic, real working dock. not many thing are "real" in Dubai as opposed to created to fake something else in the world, but this dock is the real thing; serves a purpose and has been around since Dubai has been. Great to see the variety of human life down there, people from everywhere.
Well laid out. Open, clean with well marked stations. In the heart of the busy district of meena bazzar...very convenient way of getting across the creek for only 1 Dhm...and a great experience.

Lively Place. Whenever you feel lonely, just get down here and life will be back. Take a ride on the boat, walk around the creek and Mina bazar, try out all range of restaurants around, market is cheap but you need to bargain to get a good deal. Be aware of duplicate stuff though, especially electronics.

Ancient and modern again!. Creek is the wonderful river connects the ancient and modern Dubai! The Abra dock is still keep their traditional memories alive. You just pay AED 1 to cross the river here.. Night vision is extremely pleasing and you can see the trade system over there. You will wonder like the most modern city still keeps their traditions untouched..
nice!!!. nice experience when you travel through the creek like in good old times of this land! must do in Dubai
Inexpensive Fun. A must for anyone visiting Dubai. I very much enjoyed riding and seeing all of the sites. Very colorful and fun and CHEAP!

Useful, economical & great fun. Great way to get to Deira, Old Gold Souk, Spice souk. Traffic by taxi to these places can be stressful. So, why not join in the fun with the communities and sail across the creek...Only AED 1 per way!!!

Best deal in Dubai. Every visit to Dubai involves several trips on the Abras. only 20/- each around 30p. The abra dock at the old souk side was modernised some years ago so has lost some of its charm, but is safer all passengers now. Wonderful

A Really Fun and Exciting Ride. When exploring the souks of Deira, which is just over the creek from Bur Dubai, there is no cheaper and fun way to get across the water than a ride an an old-fashioned abra for 1 Dirham, or USD 25 cents. The dock on the Bur Dubai side is right in front of the Textile Souk, so you could explore that area first before taking the abra to Deira to see the Spice and Gold Souks.The abra ride across the creek is less than five minutes but it's breezy and fun as you watch all the boats go by and take in the scenery. My family had so much fun doing it and if you are with your kids, they will really love it. To get to the dock, take the Green Line Metro to the Al Ghubailba Station. It's only a five minute walk from there toward the water.
A different experience. A different side of Dubai, I went with Big Bus Tours,you get to see the dhows. As it was Friday when I went there,all the nearby shops were closed

Pleasant Experience. I would definitely recommend the trip in the abra while in Bur Dubai. The trip is very cheap at only 1 AED. I particularly liked that the staff at the dock were very helpful. A great opportunity to observe and an easy way to cross the creek.
Cheap and fun travel. Great cheap and fun way to cross the creek to travel between the souks - for me the true dubai shopping experience forget the expensive shopping malls and haggle in the malls
Nice Experience for 1AED. Just taking the boat across sides in 10min trip to feel the taste of old dubai , Nice experience won't cost time or money.

Affordable option to enjoy Dubai Creek. What I like the most about it was the price to take the abra. You can use the communal or rent one four your own. It's very relaxing and you can enjoy nice views of Dubai Creek. I loved it!
for 1AED you can get a taste of old Dubai. Brilliant with children and not overly touristy - you can relax knowing you are paying the same as everyone else and not getting in their way

So cheap but rich of culture :D. Just prepare 1 dirham, no need to buy ticket, no need to swipe card. And enjoy your precious 10 minutes seeing the culture & architecture of old Dubai, without any shade, nor even glass window :D
PS: prepare sunglasses at noon

cheap and good fun. Enjoyed taking 2 trips (back to back) on the abra across the water. Nice subset and weather added to the charm of seeing old dubai from the water. My 3 year old daughter really enjoyed it...

An experience. You can hire these Abras by the hour or take an Abra taxi for Dh1 just to get across the Creek. Safe and great fun and gets you from Bastakia/Dubai Museum area to the Spice & Gold Souk.
do it. Its a nice sight and the Abra rides are definately something that every visitor to Dubai should do. Its very cheap, easy and fun.
a Must-Do. Its really nice to see some of the traditional Dubai and watch ordinary people going about their lives. A beautiful, relaxing spot to visit.

A must do in Dubai. Get away from the rhinestone studded part of Dubai and take a trip along the historic creek. There are various ways to travel, from the cheap abras (about 2dhs between stations) to the water buses (75 dhs) to the water taxis (rates run to several hundred dirhams). My suggestion is to charter an abra for about 120dhs per hour... Each abra could fit 12-20people...if you want to share the experience. Your trip takes you from the heritage diving village to the floating bridge... Through the old souq and the Dubai Parliament House. Just one very important note: some areas along the route are high security areas, do not take pictures or videos around these sites.

Quaint & charming experience. This is a charming experience for any visitor to Dubai. The Abra or water taxi is the cheapest and quickest way to cross the creek that divides Dubai into Deira & Bur Dubai. It costs less than 50 cents with boats constantly pulling up on both sides of the creek. Each side of the creek has an old part of the city with souks/bazaars/markets to explore. The Dubai Museum and the wholesale Textile market are on the Bur Dubai side, whereas the Gold Souk & Spice Market are on the Deira side of the creek. Regular taxis are hard to get in both these areas so the best way to cross over is an Abra.The Abra station is manned with polite staff and dont worry if you dont have time to buy a ticket as they will take cash on the boat as you cross over. There is a govt. run service but I much prefer the smaller, traditional boats that are run by licensed private operators.

Touch of old Dubai. I was returning back to Dubai after 14+ years & I was thrilled to see that the water taxis were still operational & very reasonable (1 AED/person) for a one way trip! It was very nostalgic. They are also a great way to get across the creek (Deira <> Bur Dubai). With a city is constantly changing & hardly recognizable, it was very comforting to be able to see some parts that have survived un touched through the years.
Excellent way to travel across the creek. The Abras are a great way to travel across the creek and it only costs 1AED bargain! The staff at the dock are very helpful in telling you what to do.

The Real Dubai. Dubai is known for it's glitz and modern buildings, thankfully there is a history and plenty of culture you just have to look for it.The Abra Dock is a great way of finding it, we walked from the historic Bastakia quarter which is full of art galleries down the narrow lanes by the Creek where trader's are selling their wares before we embarked on our Abra. No waiting, as soon as it is full, it goes, our Abra took less than 2 minutes to fill and then a short ride and we were moments away from the old markets including the world famous gold souk - a great way to spend a day. The ride cost AED 1 which is about 25 cents. If you are feeling rich you can hire the Abra to yourselves by the hour . A great way to spend the day.
Fast water taxi. Fast and cheap to cross Dubai Creek from Bur to Deira. There is a lot of trafic in the Creek, but this time no collisions.

get a peek at local culture. one dirham abra rides sound cheap but are a great way to experience the local culture....go from bur dubai to the old souq in one of these and enjoy the breeze as you sail through slowly
Excellent. A great way, if short (5 mins) to cross the Creek and get a good view without spending money on a Dhow cruise. At only 1 Dhr you won't get cheaper.

Relaxing way to spend an afternoon in Dubai...... .....traversing the Creek in one of these cheap and charming vessels.Away from the maddening plastic activities that largely make up a Dubai holiday.....

Interesting. Loved the atmosphere here and the boatmen are very good at helping you in and out the abra They casually skim across the creek dodging the other water traffic to arrive safely on the other side!
Best taxi ride. Short but fun taxi ride to cross the Dubai Creek in an old boat that allows you a glimpse of old times. Completely recommend it and for just AED1.00!!!!!

Old dubai. Embark on the journey of old dubai, in the water taxis called abra. For 1 aed the ride transfers u from one part of the creek to another, where the historical spic souk and gold souk are located. It gives us a chance to get a glimpse in the old dubai way of life. It's definitely must do. A simple thing but its soo much fun. Just sitting on the open abra with the locals and tourist alike, watching the cars zoom bye, the activities a the creek, the fishing boats, and the awaiting old world dubai business charm on the opposite side. The water taxi is fun and much more. Must go, you won't regret it.

An Authentic Dubai Experience. For a city which is in many ways, contrived and artificial, catching an abra (water taxi) across the Creek to Deira is a fantastic chance to reset your perspective to a time when the city was focused on marine fishing and trading, and not the latest clubs, designer clothes or skyscrapers.

Alternative Dubai. Great way to experience something different. Cheap cheerful and fun. Can't go wrong for 1 dirham. This has been a form of travel for a very very long time.....since before health and safety in the west was invented so try not to be daunted. Great to experience the contrast between 'new' and 'old' Dubai. A must 'do' even with very young children, just make sure you hold onto them.......
What an experience.. Great fun buzzing back & forwards from one side of the Creek to the other for pennies (bargain!) & watching the world go by.

A must do!. It costs only 1 AED pp and is a great experience. Its short and just takes you across the water but I must say its a nice thing to do. Gives you that whole feel to what Dubai used to be opposed to the many upscale vehicles you see everyone travel in on the roads today in Dubai.

Busiest taxis in Dubai. On the Creek tucked behind the labyrinthine alleys of the Spice Souk is the Abra Dock. It is used by locals and tourists alike and is a great (and cheap) way to cross the Creek.You get this crossing as part of the deal if you go on the Big Bus Tour. These abras look like not much more than covered rafts but don't be misled, they are safe comfortable craft that nip between the other vessels across the water.Fun experience - and good photo opportunities too.

Just across the water. Nice, inexpensive way to cross the water to get to the souks. Just get on and pay 1 UAE dollar and you're off. Careful they don't think you want a private tour of the river though - we asked the price (and, must have looked touristy!, and they said something very high - but this is a price fixed by the authorities to charter the boat for a longer trip. If you just want to cross to the souks it's very reasonable.) Keep hold of kids onboard - quite a smooth ride but no safety rail or belts or anything.

cheap and inexpensive :p. for tourist : better try at least once (AED 1 won't hurt you) But a bit dangerous as they won't provide you with safety vest, just be careful and grab something just in case the boat crashing each other when they going to park at their small wharf. Just make sure you grab tight your phone/camera when you are onboard...for resident : the cheapest n fastest way to cross the creek. using car will cost you petrol, salik and traffic lights, not to mention the time to get parking & fees. despite its looks and its age, abras still the best way to cross the creek :))

The boat ride. This was great. Only 1 dhs so value for money. Was a great way to cross over to the old souks. Was really quick as the boat doesn't take that many people so once about 15 are on, you're away. Not long to wait for the next either

a must do in Dubai. visit the Textile Souk and then cross the creek with this traditional water taxi for 1 AED pp!
there are 2 stations on both sides of the creek so better ask which one goes where. many locals use it

Quite an experience. The Abra Dock in Bur Dubai is quite an experience. You have to race down the ramps to hop into the abra. Remember to have your change handy.
There is also a good souk close by for shopping pleasure.

Nooks, Crannies and Souks. If you like the souks this is the place for you, everything you could wish to see. For the Westerner the Docks is a place for you. All manner of ships to see and water taxis to catch to the other side. Full of life and things to buy and the Museum across the water. A must see when you are in Dubai

The cheap & easy abra ride across the Dubai Creek. The wooden boat called the abra is a convenient and fast way of going from 1 side of the creek to the other side like spice and gold souk. The abra dock is alway busy with commuters.
Cross River. Take the abra from the fabric souk across the river to enjoy the spice and gold souk. A worthwhile experience.There is almost always one available and you can return the same way,
WOW BUR. exquisite EXPERIENCE HERE. Special beauty or charm, or rare and appealing excellence visit. statuesque (as in “beautiful as a statue”? How about ficusesque?

A fun ride. Rented an abra for an hour and really enjoyed the views.. one of the highlights of our visit. Contrast between dhows and modern buildings in Diera highlighted to rapid transformation/creation of the city.

Organised Chaos. The Creek is one of my favourite places in Dubai - it is what the real Dubai is all about - Souks, stalls and street food. The Abra Station really is organised chaos but for 1dh to cross the creek, it is worth the jostling and the funny looks! Negotiate for a private Abra trip down the creek too. The old sea-going dhows moored next to new office blocks are a sight to behold.

The other side is also very nice. If you do not find the place: do not get nervous and just back along the creek, on what ever side and you will be able to enjoy this nice place, what ever transportation you choose! We got lost with the traffic and could not find the exact location. We parked the car on the other side of the creek at a RTA station, where all the restaurants-Dow are parked. We took a private boat (but we could have also taken a RTA water bus) and had a ride to the heritage village. We walked back, through the old souk. It was a very nice afternoon for us and the kids.

cross the creek. We went in an abra, small, wooden boat to cross the creek to old part of Dubai. It was really interesting to see the contrast of rich, glitzy Dubai, and the traditional, trades and customs. Great place to buy gifts, souvenirs, and textile goods. People are friendly, and welcoming.

Traditional water taxi in a wooden boat!. We went to Bur Dubai to see what Old Dubai looked like all over, and as part of the tour we took the Tax across the creek (which is more like a huge lake to me!) to the Textile Souk. We walked down the port to another taxi stop to come back. What we found so interesting is how safe it was there. The big wooden boats were docked at the port with their wares sitting on the dock waiting to be picked up the next day. No one takes anything! It sits there until the next day when the buyer comes to pick it up. It was really amazing!
Water tour. You can see amazing traditional and contemporary places in Dubai through Abra tour.Take it from Creek or bur Dubai and enjoy the view

Nicely maintained history. My friend explaind the role this dock played in the history of Dubai, with all the encient business happening near this dock. They still have some old shops with the age old architecture, which is a bliss to see. The adjacent Gold Suk is 'Must Visit'

Ancient water taxi. This is Dubai at its best, an old wooden abra that will take you back and forth across the creek of 1 dirham, nothing like it. try renting one for an hour at sunset go for a sail and watch the sun go down, perfect.

Fun way to see old Dubai. Cheap and fun day out! A great way to see old parts of Dubai. Haggle in the souk and buy holiday gifts. Eat local foods at affordable prices. Great relief from the gold bling of Dubai!

Traditional Dubai. You have to see the old Dubai and its creek and you can not miss the crossing by abra, those traditional wooden boats that go back and forth from one side of the creek to the other for 1AED per person!! Quick, efficient, authentic and cheap!!!
Funny to discover the Creek. Used as water taxi, you need 1AED to cross from the Creek to the souks. Funny experience and full of tourists of course

Excellent and cheap. Great way to see the old parts of Dubai and see the souks. We also rented one for a whole hour. Take one about half hour before the sun goes down. This way you can see the beautiful lit up dhows on the way back. Great photo opportunities.

Historical promenade. Most of Dubai visitors rather going to the malls, enjoy the beach and soak in luxury... this is all good but for me, i wanted to see the old Dubai to enjoy the other side of Dubai... you can start your tour by a visit to Gold Souk then spices souk, then head to the creek to take the Abra (traditional boat) to go to the textile market. The Abra Dock is busy since it is a commercial center and u can enjoy a historical experience if it is one of your hobbies.

Try it. A trip on a Abra should be on everyones must do list. For just 1 dirham you can cross the Creek to the old souks. There are some modern Abras available that charge more but to get the feel I suggest you try the old wooden ones, it is amazing how different everything looks from the water

A nice trip down the khor. We just did this trip without any prior planning, just went to the docks and rented a full abra, can't remember how much exactly, but it was for an hour and it was qutie cheap for 4 people, I think this is a must do at least once if you leave in Dubai for a while
A hive of activity. Great place to wander around, (for a little while as it gets so hot). lots happening good to look at all the boats unloading spices. Take a boat ride across the river.

Fantastic value. This is one of the cheapest things to do in Dubai, at 1 dirham a ride, which is a relief in such an expensive city. It's really a fun thing to do and very pleasant to be out on the water when there's a breeze. Stop off and visit the textile souk which is very well preserved and nicely shaded.
Great to see original Dubai. Love visiting this area, old and not fancy and glittery like the rest of dubai. Very cheap and fun trip to make accross the river in the Abras
Creek Crossing. Great way to travel across the creek to visit Bur Dubai, takes you straight to the souks. Very cheap crossing, i think it was about 50p

Do Not Miss This Boat!. Don't be afraid, climb aboard, pay one dirham and set across the creek. Or, pony up a few extra bills and rent an abra for yourself and friends. A cool way to life on the creek and make it across to the other side.

Going back in time :-). These small wooden dhows cost only 1 Dhs for a journey across Dubai Creek. These operate quite often and take less than 5 mins to get to the other side. Extremely recommended for touristst doing Bur - Deira - Bur. Tip: try to study the sun and the direction and make sure you sit in the side that you get shade for the whole ride!
Interesting ride. A fun way to get across Dubai Creek! At rush hour especially it is an interesting way to be involved in the culture of the city.

Great way to get across the creek. Don't be scared on travelling on one of these - they don't look very safet but are a great and cheap way to get from one side of the creek to the other. Also worth going on a private trip on one along the creek but make sure you negotiate a good price.
Cheapest crossing?. This crossing has been 1 Dirham for so many years that it gets my award for best value for money. Not for those that are unsteady on their feet. Superb experience.
Nice way of crossing the creek...... The ride on the Abra gives a very old- world charm to the futuristic Dubai.This is the only value for money attraction in Dubai...I think ?....!!
the abras are so cheap. We thought if we come to Dubai our pockets will suffer a lot but things like these made it easy. and plus we get to see nice buildings and water travel is always fun.

Do not miss this abra ride. We did both the crossing with people for 1aed (~25cents). And the tour for 120aed.
We enjoyed both too much as one was with people like taxi to cross fron A to B and the other one like lovers alone for the entire creek about 1hour tour.
One of the cheapest and the coolest activities in Dubai. An authentic abra boat that takes you to another side of the creek just for one dirham. The trip is quite short, but yet really exciting.

A taste of the past. A great way to cross the creek.We crossed from Water taxi area 31 on the textile souk side to get over the other side to visit the gold and spice soukOnly 1AED each wayDriver more than happy to do you a personal tip up and down the creek but not sure how much this costs Great experience - life jackets stored in the roof of the abras but wouldn't want to count on them !

Abras are great, but be incredibly careful with small children.. Don't let people coerce you into buying stuff - it's quite difficult to resist. Watch little kids on the abras, they are very ad hoc - no proper seating, & definitely no safety measures.
Old Dubai experience. Want to experience the feel of "old dubai" ? Then this trip is highly recommended. Prices are cheap too.

WATER TAXI....EVER HEARD OF IT?. its awesome!love the water and so love travelling on it! its makes a lovely weekend outing for the family and friends alike!Very useful to hop over to deira from Bur Dubai
very cheap and pretty. SO CHEAP, Abra Taxi. and so beautiful... we float we go from here to there. and It feels perfect.. I mean hoe cool is that. :-D

An evening ride across the creek !. Come evening and If you are shopping in Bur Dubai and wanna come over to Deira to home or whatever the reason be, the ride with the Abra is short yet very refreshing

Use the Abra. Using the Abra in Dubai is a must, this takes you accross the creak to different locations. Make sure you ask for the right location ie Gold Souk etc. The cost is 1AED per person each way and you pay teh driver. A tip is to sit in front of the driver as the fumes from the engine can be bad towards the back. A 1 hour cruise on a Abra by yourself is 120AED for the Abra not per person

Nice Experience. Best way to Cross from Deira to M- Bazar. No traffic, no stoppage, signals but no life jackets too.One should just try this as it's reminds the heritage of Dubai civilization.Very nice in the night, you can enjoy night skies, free sight of fire works on creek side. t's really nice for a joy ride.

Improved Access. The abra (boat) boarding point on the Bur Dubai side of Dubai is now much improved compared to what it was some years ago. It is well designed and organized and therefore safe even for elderly travellers. The crossing to Deira takes only about 10 minutes and is a must for those who want to experience the Dubai Creek
Great bit of local colour. For a very cheap fare, make sure you catch a local abra across the Dubai Creek to the Deira Souk. Great views of Dubai, especially at sunset.

Abra great experience from Dubai creek. Took the Abra from the city only costing One dhiram to the old side of Dubai, it's was a great and cheap way of using the crossing, try to do it when it cools abit down as its just to hot in the middle of the day and last about 10 mins, worth a visit to see culture.

The Real Dubai!. It is worth a visit to this part of Dubai to experience a ride that has not changed much in 40 years. While the rest of Dubai travels at break-neck speed, the Abras gracefully chug across the creek.

Health and safety is unknown. Taking the abra trip is a very good way of getting a feel for old Dubai, it costs about 60 dirhams for 4 people for 30mins of going up and down the Creek, passing by other abras, boats, dhows, yachts and some awful looking larges cargo ships, that are about to fall apart. Price really depends on the driver. If there is a problem and you should need medical attention dont counton anyone.
Classic Dubai. Not much to see in terms of an attraction, just a few boats leading across the river! Only costs 1 dirham to cross which is great!
fun experience. this is one of the traditional things in Dubai. I used to go every year when I was a kid and I still enjoy it, but I prefer when the weather is good, i.e. not tooooo hot.
Taste of the old.... Get away from yhe glass and steel and ride the open Abras for a feel of the local culture...must do for anyone...

Cheap, relaxing means of transportation. Considering the movement from Deira to Bur Dubai, the traffic is always hectic. Abra is the easiest way to cross over to the other side of Dubai from Deira and the Gold Souk (Market) area, and costs only 2AED that is local currency and the view is amazing especially in the evening at sunset.

Cheap creek tour!. You can take abra from different abra docks in bur dubai to deirah side, or vice versa. some are closed abras with AC & more safety (which are little more expensive) & the rest are open wooden abras which the ticket is only 1 dhs !You might seat beside local/indian workers who want to go to other side of the creek.Its an interesting experience, you will see many expats/tourists with their cameras taking pictures from the creek!

Best 1 Dirham you can spend in Dubai. There is not much you can do in Dubai for 1AED so spend it here. Textile souk on one side and spice and gold souk on the other side of the creek. Not a tourist trap but a well used by locals and expats of all nationalities. Also a cooling breeze is a welcome respite during the heat of the day. No business or first class lounge here.

Just fab. If you go to Dubai you must go on The Abra , it Is great for crossing the creek from Bur Dubai to the Deira side ..of Dubai it is very cheap and you just go with the crowds it is a fantastic experience no worries about parking and it takes you straight into the souk a fun trip loved it .. ..

1 Dirham and you'll love it. Go ahead, go where the "locals" go. Grab an agra- just pick a destination (or not), hop aboard, hand over a Dirham and go. Where else can you get a quick 5 min tour across the Creek for essentially 30 cents? One tip: DONT wear high heels! If you are the high maintenance type, this is not for you!
The best memory of Dubai. The Abra crossings - for ONE dirham - were brilliant: scenic, full of bustle, just one MUST DO experience! They also travel between the places you'll want to visit.

Experience a different more real Dubai. Nice change to the glitz and glamour that exists almost everywhere in Dubai. Only 1 or 2 Dirhams. Good place to take friends/ tourists. Can also hire Abra for private use. Just make sure you get on the right one.

very good experience. Abra is nice and good and cheap, every one should try it unless you have a sea sick ... the only problem is : if you want to do it in the summer, and i advice also to do a trip in the RTA water taxi
seeing the two parts of Dubai. from this place you can see the "majestic" modern dubai and the old part of it. take the dhow cruise, you'll appreciate it more.
Great experience. Super way to explore other transportations and super cheap to take an abra across the creek. Interesting to see how they load and unload old colourful boats with all kinds stuff.

Abra for 1 DHS. This Abra is a very exiting way of transport between the traditional gold market with the best deals and designs for gold jewlery and Al Bastakiya, the best place for museums and traditional souk.
Do not miss afternoon Morocan mint tea at Bait Alwakeel in Al Bastakiya.

Old Dubai. This is a lovely way to experience traditional Dubai. The Abra only costs 1dirham (20p) to cross the creek. The boats are very rustic, you just hop on and sit sideways on the central block, no ropes or bars to stop you from falling in! It's also great to experience something alongside the locals. We hardly ever saw any westerners in this area of Dubai. I think that often the most interesting way to see a city is via boat, and the views of the dhow wharf against the backdrop of sandy coloured buildings on the Deira side were beautiful. It's also nice to get a breeze in the intense heat! Just beware of people trying to trick you into taking a tour - if they mention it costing any more than 1dirham just walk away and join the queue with the locals.

Retro in the mid of glamor. When we talk about Dubai it often associated as something glamor, luxury and anything that represent a high-class lifestyle. Having Abra Dock in between is just a great idea. The wooden boat is far from being luxury, even its sound is clearly heard from an old engine technology. The cost to get in it for a transfer service from one to another stop point is also unbelievably AED 1, which is less than EURO 0.20. Multiple hundreds of people are using this service everyday without hassle. The schedule, ticketing and its in and out pathways are just well organized that make people comfy to utilize the service.

A must if in Dubai. If you only do one thing in Dubai you must go across the Creek in one of the abras. It's great fun and very cheap. Just wear good footwear, no high heels ladies and remember you will be sharing with ALL of Dubais residents :)
Interesting. While at the spice souks, take a trip on an abra across the bay and visit the textile souk. It's only AED per person (€0.20) and all our visitors loved it

Convenience. Getting from bur-dubai to deira in busy house is quite a task with the kinda traffic seen normally..... taking an abra is the best option....!! very cheap and very convenient....it is also newly called as a water-taxi...!!
Must try. Those old rickety boats are a great way to go from Deira to Bur Dubai and vice versa. You have to try them at least once.
A quintessential Dubai experience. A great view of old Dubai and the quickest way between the Textile Souk and the Gold Souk. What more could you want for only 1 Dirham?

A very nice local tour. Hire your own Abra to stroll around or simply pays AED1 or 2 to get across the creek in the local Abras is very interesting to see the local people and culture. After all there are souks on both sides. The best and cheapest way to see the origin of Dubai.

basic neccessacity. This ferry ride grows on you, it is simply convenient and you just cannot do without it, You can stay in Bur Dubai with its comfortable hotels and spread of restaurants and visit Dierra in a couple of minutes and just a dirhan for business at the wholesale markets or simply visit the aromatic spice market or go to the magnificent gold souk, Once you know of it you can't do without it
Bur Dubai Abra Dock. Sounds interesting and it's alright. Nothing bad about this attrraction.

must try. in a posh country, it takes 1 dhs to have a nice cruise across the creek. just remember to tell the guy where you want to go, so to make sure you hoop into the right one. Or, you can actually jump in the first one and live a little adventure. Do not listen to people who would tell you to get a private one, in case somebody decides to spoil your commoners' day.. enjoy!

a glimpse from the past. To have a glimpse at what was Dubai prior to Burj Khalifa, Dubai skyscrapers and mega malls, visit Dubai old downtown and Dubai creek, and take the Abra across the creek from Daira to Bur Dubai or the other way around, or better yet take a tour around the creek with the Abra. A must do, at least once for Dubai visitors.
Love the Abras. Great piece of old Dubai. The Abra are cheap and plentiful. It's also a lot cooler on the water.

Has to be seen to be believed. This old area of Dubai is still that - old! But fascinating. The nearby Souks (markets for perfume, spices, gold, textiles etc) are wonderful to stroll through. Then take an "Abra" for 1 dirham each way (very cheap) across the canal. The docks are stacked with boxe of cargo which are still "hand loaded" onto wooden boats which trade with Asia etc. A fascinating sight to witness.
we liked this. somehow we had the feeling to be in original dubai, although we know that the old city is mostly a replica.... anyway the abra drive is really refreshing and authentic ...
Annother old face of Dubai. Its amazing still Dubai is maintaining the same old Abra as it is till now and many people uses it as a daily transport and people living by transporting.
Fantastic..!!!. Simply awesome..!! Food is not that great when you select a dhow cruise. The views of Old and New Dubai is worth watching..!!awesome experience to know what "Dubai" was once.
Good for Dubai views and fun!. Lovely little journey across the water! This is something I would recommend doing whilst in Dubai.
worth a trip. to see a different view of Dubai/Deira from the water, this is a taste of old Dubai

Worth doing!. Well worth a visit to take a boat ride on one of the Abras, super cheap and you see the city from a different perspective.
It’s quite refreshing to get away from the super slick glass buildings and to get down on the water then walk round the nearby souks.
You can also hire some of them for private tours.

Abra dock. An experience as you ride the Abra with daily commuters, always busy but hardly any waiting, the crossing only takes a few minutes but you get to see the Dubai Skyline and various vessels. Fascinating to watch how the Abra is guided into dock. Well worth the 1 AED , brilliant !

an experience. go to any dock (they are numbered) on the creek, and get on the local boat and cross from Diera (souks) to Bur Dubai. it is 1 dhiram each way. there are lots of Bazzars to visit. Very easy. Make sure you visit the spice souk and the gold souk. Very nice.
Cheap and fast. Fast and cheap way to go from Bur Dubai to Deira (home of Gold and Spice Souck). Good experience to mingle with the locals.
Trip on your own Abra can't be beat!. So vibrant - a real insight into the life of Dubai.

See the creek for pennies. Don't spend your hols shuttling between 5* resorts in breakneck taxis, it's not all Dubai has to offer! See a bit of real life and travel like a local but paying AED1 per person (abut 17p) to put-put across the creek in an abra. You can always see a city different from the riverbank.

do not miss this treasure. See the real Dubai cross the creek by Abra visit the spice souk and the gold souk if you have the time and are interested the fish and the fruit, veg market is also worth a visit . Don't forget to haggle over the price not only in the gold souk but also when buying your spices
Old against the new.. Take an Abra ride across the creek for 1 dirham or do as we did and have one to yourself for an hour for 120 dirhams. Lovely way to see dubai from the water.

Could spend the whole day on these abras!. Always a pleasure spending time by the creek. Lovely restaurants along the water and some good museums too. And the abras are a great way to travel to the gold and spices souqs from Bur Dubai. Only 1AED per journey. Visitors love it! Finally, a little more authenticity in this ultra glitzy city.

Great Little Boats. For a taste of old Dubai a trip over the Dubai Creek in a tradational Abra is must. Each trip will cost you the grand sum of 1 Dirham!(about 18pence). Take a tour of the souk when you cross.

What fun. The souk is great, have fun haggling, the abra boat service across the creek is brilliant, hop on and off you go, we had a pram and baby and it was no prob. The driver even let our son jump into the driver pit and have a go, excellent considering 1 year olds are not the best drivers!!

Don't miss a visit here for a look back at old Dubai. This is a great place to get a feel for how Dubai was years ago. The Abra's operate 24 hours a day for 1 dirham. There are 3 Docks to board in the Bur/Bastika side of the Creek. You can also rent your own Abra for an hour for about 120 Dirham. A wonderful treat! Go there and ride them, or just watch the action while having a tea and a shisha!
Enjoyable trip. i enjoyed the trip across the creek on the abra and it was very cheap
Best way to travel in Dubai. Cheap and easy way to cross the creek. Part of the real Dubai experience.

Cheap and fun way to get across the Dubai Creek. A really cheap and fun way to get across the Dubai creek on the old wooden boats. Only costs 1 Durham! Amazing views of Dubai creek from the abras. Good way to get across to the old Dubai.

Great way to take see the creek side. The Abra taxis can be taken from the banks of either Bur Dubai or Deira. It is an inexpensive medium of transport. These are the banks where Dubai had begun its destiny to match or in some cases exceed the best in the world.

Like an Arabian Venice. The hotel grounds are zig zagged with narrow canals and an abra (narrow boat with a driver sitting in the middle) gently sails throug. The architecture imitates old Arabian buildings. It sails past open air theatre, restaurants and shops on the complex as well as provides unobstructed view of the iconic 'sail' building. It is a nice and relaxing 15 min ride, but you will not be culturally poorer if you don't take it. It has 'attraction' value only. I have enjoyed it and I am glad that I took abra.
A dive into the past. In the moder Dubai it is rare to find Authentic places like The Abra, a unique experience to blend and experience the Old days of Dubai

Worth Doing. It costs 1D to cross the water. It's a nice little stroll up to the abra stop from the metro station. Something that you have to do if you fancy a visit to the old part of Dubai. You will be sat on a boat with a lot of Indians going to/from work.
A taste of Arabia. Boats look as if they have been crossing the creek for ever! Very efficient and so cheap!
Great Local Experience. Fun way to get across Dubai Creek for AED1. A must experience.

A must!!. Whenever I come to Dubai I love going down here it's such a global village and and experience of Dubai 40 years ago. Great area for pictures I love the dhows and their crews.one even let us tour their boat. Best spot for the way things were
really quaint tourist like trip to take. cheap, and links you into the heart of Dubai - find hidden Souks across the creek.
Great real way to cross creek. It only cost 1aed but its best to have change ready

A quick crossing to Deira. A short walk to the harbour like quayside from Bur Dubai and here every few minutes one can catch an Abra to the other side. The journey takes about 8 minutes and it's a pleasant crossing and you can view all the adjacent buildings and others crossing the Creekside it's very relaxing. The cost is 1 AED each way which is very cheap. I have visited Dubai in excess of 100 visits and always try and make time for this delightful crossing so don't miss it!
Abra. What an interesting experince. We experiencd this as part of The City of Merchants Tour so we did it as a group. Very busy place, but well organised.

Dhow cruise. Must do thing in Dubai, got the Cobone vochour for Dhow dinner cruise with Saluja Tours, OK boat, cheap magic show, great food, what can be expected for 75 Dhs a head, lama is a big boat, some even have belly dancing in the dhow.
Travel back in time. Amazing experience. A must do to experience old Dubai
Experience must try. Amazing experience that you must try, cannot explain it, you must practice it
Traditional Abra Ride!!!. Cheap water rides across the Dubai Creek...Nice Time to spend your evenings...
Relaxing afternoon. ...as long as you can easily say NO to the agressive sales techniques of the vendors in the Souks. Enjoy a cappuccino and some sheesha on the waterfront.

Cost a dirham for an experience!. Be adventurous!!! try the Abra for just a buck or get a deal with the owner and rent it for an hour. After the ride, you can stroll thru the old souk. You can find a lot cheap souvenirs there, i.e. shisha, belly dancer's dress, arabic slippers, shawls.

Very Scary. This is good if you don't have any alternative to move from Bur Dubai to deira.
Very dangerous. They don't have any life vests, big troulers also crossing on the same way.
A must when your in dubai. You simply haven't been in dubai if you didn't travel by abra

Very Cheap. The Abra Dock is fab and I was lucky that I was staying in Bur Dubai. The Abra (water taxi) is cheap and takes you across the other side of the creek in Deira which allows you to visit the The Gold Souk and The Spice Souk

Back in time. The abra is an experience that takes you back in time, very nice trip, for 1 dirham you get a lift from one side to the other with 19 other pasengers....form100 dhs, you get a full hour tour alone or with your family, a recommended experience
Experience not to be missed. Never failed to take an abra whenever I visit Dubai. Dirt cheap and always an experience
don`t miss it. Nice view of the city for 1 dirham only. Good to see both sides of Dubai.
Real Dubai. Just turn up and experience the real Dubai. Costa about 10pence per journey!
Love the creek crossing via abra!. 1 dirham (next to nothing) to cross the creek!! Enjoy the trip and the sights of old Dubai from the water! Very well worth it don't miss it!

another experience. lovely to see both sides of Dubai. a trip across the creek on an authentic abra is a must - and of course a visit to the souks on both sides. the only negative on this is the hassle you get to buy a handbag etc i wish they would have left us alone to browse the souks instead they made me leave before i had bought what i really intended to get.

Old form of transport. Between the two parts of old Dubai (Deira and Bur Dubai) there is the Creek, to allow the local traffic of ships and small vessels to come to the port. As the distance is fairly small, for the longest time, there was the water taxi to take people across. Mostly used by workers, to save a few steps and quite a few bucks by avoiding the bridges and long way around, now is a great way to see both shore from the sea as a tourist - for very inexpensively, less than a dollar round trip. The old city has the traditional souks on both sides, so make it a day trip and plan on looking at the gold souk in Deira, the great fabrics and more gold and spice souk in Bur Dubai. Good place to take plenty of shots for memories. Not too many places would preserve the past this way...
Love it. I love all of it. When you are heading there, you are set for a mini adventure. It is exotic, authentic and well - cheap.

A completely different vibe. No trip to Dubai is complete without a trip to Bur Dubai and Deira. Start off with a walk around the Batikyia area of Bur Dubai. Walk up along the creek passing the Hindu temple and the textile souk. Catch the abra across to Deira (10 mins). You can alternatively hire an abra for 30 minutes or an hour to bring you on a tour of the Creek. It is well worth it. Finally cross over to Deira and head to the Gold, Perfume and Spice Souks. A perfect evening in Dubai

It costs 1Dirham only!. It’s definitely the cheapest transportation in Dubai!We visited at night. Since we were staying in Deira district, it wasn’t far for us to take a taxi from Deira district to the ‘taxi boat’ station. It’s advice to save a picture of the taxi boat station in your cell phone and show it to the taxi driver. Somehow they may not understand what’s ‘taxi boat’ until they see the picture! They recognize how it looks like rather than its name! Personally I think it’s good to visit there with a group of friends. Not 100% feeling safe. Some ‘locals’ were starring at us while we dressed properly (I couldn’t understand). Anyway, the taxi boat only costs $1dhm!!! What more can you ask for if it only costs such little? You can enjoy a cozy silent seaview of the Dubai Creek which takes ard 5 mins to go. When we crossed over Dubai Creek and arrived the Bur Dubai side, we reached a long street for souvenirs. Beware there are some people trying to sell in an aggressive way… apart from that, it’d be a nice experience to enjoy the breeze of river and shopping for souvenir.
Nice view of the city and cheap travel too. A cheap way to travel around Dubai and conjure up the sights in a wooden boat.
Old dubai is worth a visit. A must see to get your cheap shopping fix too. Bargaining is a must in this area
My favourite thing to do in Dubai. Just jump on the Abra and enjoy the ride! It's cheap and it's easy. A good way to travel

Top of the list of Dubai attractions. You cannot visit Dubai and not take a ride on the Abra. The ride across the creek really gives you a true feel for Dubai and how it has evolved. It gives travelers such a sense of the city and the root of its existence. The Abra is a great way to get across from Bur Dubai to Deira. While most tourists to the city come to see the Burj Khalifa, Dubai Mall and many of the other architectural wonders that have been created in the city; the a bra rides across the creek really are a much bigger attraction and one that can be experienced for under one dirham. You can also hire an abra for an individual experience for a reasonable price.

Wonderful. Tried both the wooden boats and the RTA rides !!!
The traditional one is far better than the RTA boat (though needs to be more careful with the kids)

Interesting and affordable way to experience the creek. If you want to experience the Dubai Creek one of the best and affordable way to do it would be via the rides that you can take from this dock. Do try it if this is your first trip to Dubai.
Abra Dock. Take an Abra ride across the creek and visit the fish market, the old souks. The most inexpensive means of transport in Dubai and it is quite scenic

Pleasant Suprise. Wanting to visit the Gold Soul from the south side of the creek we asked the taxi to drop us at Bur Dubai and tooke the 1Dh ride across to the Gold and Spice souk in the evening.
Thorughly authentic experience and a bit of traditional Dubai opposed to the tourist areas of the Marina of Jumeriah
Absolutely loved it!. I was completely drawn by the atmosphere of the old Dubai and took several rides on the dhows to soak it all in! The price of 1 dirham is far less than what is deserves!

New experience in the olden form of transport. The travel time of 6 minutes from Bur Dubai to Deira is a true experience and joy which you can get at just 1 Dirham. Perhaps the only place in Dubai where 1 Dirham has a stand alone value. The ride will keep you alive with its oscillation of the boat in the creek water. But its sad to see lot of people throwing plastic and other wastes in the water. The RTA may take a step ahead in increasing the quality of those Abras (boats) and increase safety features to attract "A" class tourists in a large level.

Good fun and cheap. From the museum to the souk and back was 2 Dh and took 2 minutes. Make sure you get on the correct route as it appears most boats go up the creek. There are staff to help you. Nice to see a change from the typical Dubai, and absolutely well worth a visit and not scary. We went at 4p.m and the souks were mostly shut so be careful of you timings.

Unique experience, not expensive. The abra stations are on either side of the dubai creek, old dubai where all thentraders and wholesalers are based. This is the citys origins as a trading hubAbra is a wooden motor boat takes you from one side to the other costs about 40 pence each and takes 10 minNice ride across and nice to walk through the bazaars and shopsIt reminds me of walking through the streets of mumbai far fom the artificial side of dubai

A great way to get across the waterway. It is one of the 'Must Do’s’ while visiting Dubai, as it is cheap and a very frequent service to get from the centre to the various Souks on the over side of the waterway. It is an open boat with seating on the single deck, you just walk on and sit down and the boats skipper takes a small fee before setting off on this ten minute journey down the waterway passing work dowels and other craft using the dock. At night it is even better as you get to see all the lit up Dubai sky line; it is a service I have used since first going to Dubai in the early 80’s.
Good boats. It's the cheapest travel by small Abra (boats) and RTA boats also to travel from Dubai to Deira and back

If you go to Dubai, you should go here. The atmosphere at The Creek is totally different from that in the tourist areas of Dubai, at the Marina and Palm Jumeirah. For the equivalent of a few pennies one gets to travel on an abra - small powered boat, with a very mixed set of passengers - mostly workers. The boat takes a diagonal trip down The Creek, so the journey is a worthwhile one. Be sure to take a camera.
Busy!. Well preserved part of the Emirate culture. Allthough it look chaotic, it works perfectly!

Not safe. If you don't have any option of moving then only Abra should be choosen.This is not a safe mode of crossing the creek also & i don't see that the operators are properly equipped even at an accident.

Cross the Creek Like a Local. A great and very cheap but possibly hectic experience - crossing the Creek each way on an Abra. There's nothing to it, but you'll get a feel for the hustle and bustle of old Dubai and see the old, but still fully used Dhows lined up side by side along the Creek with every sort of product stacked up on the dock-side, before they set sail to the portsaround the Persian Gulf .

A great look at Dubai's water ways. Either pay for an hour and travel up and down the creek or pay just $1AED for a trip across the creek to experience the wonderful waterways of Dubai. We loved the hour sitting on our own private Abra. If this is your first time to Dubai it gives you a great insight into Dubai from the water
Great way to discover the creek. Fast and very frequent service. Travel with the locals and get great views of both sides of the creek, all for 1 Dirham each way (about 20p!).
A piece of local life!. I really enjoyed my short ride across Dubai Creek on the Abra. No need to pay AED120 for a 1 hour tourist trip. This was a great little experience for AED1!

A truly Dubai experience. The hussle and bussle of the Abra dock is one of the joys of life in Dubai. So much activity and colourful characters along with the sense of a journey on the creek it makes for a memorable experience
Back in Time. This was such a quaint look at years gone by,jumping on the small wooden boats to cross the creek great fun very cheap and a must on a visit to Dubai
Cheap & convenient. 1 AED to cross one way.Easy and quick travel between the Old souq market and the spice/gold souq.
Take a trip, it is better than a paid cruise. This is the best way to see Dubai from the creek - only costs 1 dollar and is awesome
nice journey. love taking the Abra to the Gold Souk, Very cheap and a fun journey especially at night.

Ask for the abra. The abra dock was hard to find for me - it's located due east of the textile souk (near the Bastakiya district) on the creek. Do not waste your time like we did by wandering up and down the creek trying to figure out which boats were the abras; simply ask anyone who approaches you where the abras are (do not say "water taxi" as this did not seem to work for people we met) and they will happily point you in the right direction.Abras travel frequently across the creek and only cost 1 dirham per person. It's a pretty cool experience once you do it. Only three stars from me because it's a 5-minute boat ride across a river...how special can it be?

Easy and cheap way to get across the Creek. Take an Abra across the creek. The stations are marked and if you aren't sure which abra to get on, just ask. It costs just 1 Dirham to cross and it provides another vantage point of the Bur Dubai and Deira neighborhoods. It is the quickest way to cross the creek.
Good way of exploring Old Dubai. Take a abra ride between Meena Bazaar and Gold Souq for 1AED and explore Old Dubai
Very much improved dock for the abra boats.. Great views of Dubai creek from the cheap abra journey!
wonderful. its very nice experience to ride, safe. and like to ride again and again

Bunch of fun. The Abras are cheap and fun. If you want to prowl the other side of Dubai Creek, jumping on one is the way to go. They are stable, not over filled, and quick. Can't say a bad thing at all.

Nice Experience. It's only AED1 per person to cross the creek. But the staff is a bit rude. It's a nice experience anyway. There are many souks nearby, such as spice souk, utensil souk, gold souk and textile souk.
Loving Dubai. Great place to see part of old Dubai. if you want that old Arabic rustic feel.

Open with yesteryear boats. Its great to take an Abra up and down on winters when you have lot of sea gulls hovering over you all over the creek. it costs very less for the ride and you can see big dhows taking goods up and down Africa, India, Iran etc.
This is a typical Dubai attraction. It costs only 1 AED and it´s one of the most typical attractions in Dubai.
great way to view Dubai. This is a very inexpensive way to view Dubai, one can get to the other side for 1 AED. We took a 'private tour' which lasted for one hour and cost 120 AED for both of us.
dubai creek. authentic Dubai of yester year, defintately worth a vist, cross the creek for one dirham, about 17p, probably the only thing cheap in Dubai lol

Have to experience!. Take a ride on the abra (only 1 dirham each way) and experience the other side of Dubai - the old town, the souks, hustle and bustle. Abra was a bit scary at first - your within inches of the water but I enjoyed it (friend was terrified).

Take a trip on the New Dubai ferry. is near the Mina Bazar and you can take an Abra boat (120 dirham) for an 1 tour through the harbour or you can take the new air conditioned Dubai Ferry for 1 hour tour. I will recomend this one not just because is cheaper (50 dirham) but because is air conditioned, with proper seats has a bar a does 2 different routes. you can also bargain hunter in the Bazar just be prepared to barten a lot. No matter how cheap you think you are paying there is always someone who pays less than you. So be ruthless!
lovely. we completely love the Abra, like a breath from the old days. cost olnly AED 1.-

Ancient Way of Life. Abra Dock facilitates thousands of residents and visitors to cross between Bur Dubai and Deira Dubai. It is economic and attractive as well to travel in manner which is mixture of ancient & modern culture

Great fun for 1AED (0,3 USD). A lots a of boats sailing from one dock to other side, nice way how to shorten your way for almost no price. The sailor is ready to help you with baby coach, dont be afraid to bring your kids! You can get some nice photos in the night.

Beware. I just took Abra to cross the deira side & till i get out of the Abra i was praying. I don't thing you shuld take any risk using the abra as there is hardly any safety arrangements. only reason i took is just to try because of heavy traffic on the Bar Dubai area.
Down the road from hotel. Excellent, in the vicinity of shopping for home, gifts, eating etc.
Arabian touch. Try to have a ride on abra, great pictures of Old Dubai from the water
Really well thought out. Hassle free aithentic shops with a nice waterway to enjoy lunch whilst observing this massive structure.

Such fun for 20p!!. I must be a little crazy but could ride the Abra all day! Its such fun and cost 1UAD per trip - thats about 17p! the boat men use them a bit like bumper cars and the view of the Dhows rom the river is the best!

small boats and nice breeze at evening time.. the busses are very slow if we plan to go from place to another.
and the market by the abra a good collection of stuff to buy.

Memories of ol' Dubai. Had frequented the abra dock in bur dubai just for pleasure rides or as an alternative mode (instead of the bridges) of transport to cross the creek. A very pleasant feel during the winters and it provides excellent view of the amazing Dubai infrastructure built alongside the creek. A morning ride and a night ride are a must to do if you are a tourist.
Great fun - and so cheap. Cross the Dubai creek by Abra for Dh1 - about 18p if you're British - 40,000 people a day do (so they say). Direct to the spice souk.

Worth the PENNY spent. Was there just criss crossing between Deira and Bur Dubai for pleasure, other than that you have to sit in a open space, this trip costs almost nothing and gives the view of Dubai on either side of the CREEK. Just spend sometime and enjoy the ride as well as the markets along side.

Very good indeed. One of the nicest things I saw in Dubai. Sounds like the real Dubai to me. The Creek is a link between Deira and Bur Dubai. It is really worth a trip on abra, the light small wooden motor boat which will only cost you 1 dirham and which is very much used by the locals. For the price of 120 dirhams, youcan also pay for an abra of your own with a local driver, who will drive you from one side to the other of the Creek on a river trip which lasts about 1 hour.
The first and most important call to understand the history and culture. Ambiance and information was free flowing and well presented in a realistic and understandable fashion.
Such an experience. A must when you are in Dubai. Experience it with the locals all for 1Dirham an absolute bargain. Great photo opportunities during the ride which takes about 8-10 mins.

Avoid tourist traps. If you just want to get across the creek, avoid the sales people who want to sell you a 1h "cruise" for 120 Dhs. You can get across between Deira and Bur Dubai for 2 Dhs. The cruise takes you up to the mouth of the river and down towards the Floating Bridge. Used to be about half the price before the Abra drivers all got organised.
nice experience. Must do it. The best way to cross the creek. Just 1 aed (0,25 euro) to go to Deira on this gorgeous wood boat.
The other Dubai. Always take a few trips across Creek...Like the atmosphere in less opulent area and even enjoy persistent 'hassle' from vendors.
Cheap and Fun Local Travel. Wherever you stay, try to fit in at least one ride on a local abra (1 durham). Great way to travel like a local and see the city from the water.
Good experience. A very cheap and inexpensive way to cross the creek the shops on the dock are very interesting.
Excellent. A must do! Good fun and a different way to see Dubai

Switch the dhow cruise for an abra. The metro is not going to give you half of the experience of crossing he creek on an abra. Not even in gold class (which is nothing special btw) Next time I will also change the dhow cruise for an hour in an abra for 120Dh instead of squeezing in on a tacky tourist trap :)

Quick easy and entertaining way across the creek. This is fun, if over much to quickly. Jump on the abra which is filling up, grab a seat, pay your 1 Dirham and off you go. Nice views of the creek as you cross.
Only 1 dirham. A must whenever in Dubai, great views of the creek
Meet the locals. A working area,the creek,the boats,life going on,a working Arab town.

The REAL Dubai. If you visit the gold and spice souks, you should take an abra to the other side of the Creek to the Old Textile Souk. It costs a dirham, and you will be riding with poor South Asian workers. I've been on boats that have banged into others. My wife HATES it but all our visitors think its cool. We always eat at Bayt Al Wakeel. The trip is fun in the day but surreal at night.
Boats boats!!. Interesting if you've never been to a waterfront area in the east.
Do it!. Take the Abra across the Creek to explore the Indian souk on the other side. It is an experience and you can hire your own Abra rather than sharing.

Get down and local on the Creek. Too many visitors to Dubai are blinded by the bling and don't make it down to the Creek either on the Bur Dubai (oldest part of Dubai) or Deira sides. Connecting the two sides at the lower end of the Creek are the small, long boat abras which have been plying their routes for decades and are the cheapest and most used form of transport for workers commuting across this part of the city. For 1 AED (about 30 US cents) you can take a five minute ride across one way. There are two stations on either side of the Creek several hundred metres apart. If you take the lower staton (behind Bank of Baroda near Carrefour Bur Dubai), your abra will pull in at the lower station on Deira side which is the spice souk area. If you go to the top station on Bur Dubai side, near the mosque and fabric souk, your abra will land near the gold souk (Al Sabka) station. It doesn't really matter which one you find as they are just walking distance apart. It might look a bit precarious to the first time user but it is a really efficient and safe process of fast docking and smooth riding despite about 20 people all sitting facing the water on either side of the driver who stands in a pit in the middle of the boat. There are also life jackets for those who are anxious passengers. You see whole families with even prams and shopping on board and it all seems to work well. Money is collected on board by the driver just as the boat is filled up and coin is appreciated though they can usually manage some change of small notes. There are drivers who will approach tourists and offer you an abra ride (personalised) for 100 AED which is a complete rip off as they do not usually have the language skills for any commentary and you could take 100 of the standard rides for the pleasure. There are also 'imitation' abra rides to be had at Madinat in Jumeirah but these are around the canal area there rather than a working port space and 60 AED is charged. Well out of reach of the standard Dubai worker who might receive that in a couple of days of wages. Try a Shawarma (doner/souvlaki) at one of the cafeterias around the Deira souk areas. They are usually 5 AED or less and are a great and safe snack to eat while on the move. This is something I do regularly and makes me feel I am really seeing Dubai.

Real working life Dubai. Didn't actually travel on one of the Abras but great to take a stroll along the Creek at Bur Dubai (close to the Dubai Museum) and watch the world sail by against a backdrop of traditional souk and glittering, modern architecture.
The abra ride must be done by all tourists!. The boat ride from Spice souk Deira dock to Bur Dubai abra dock was amazing. For me was a nice experience.

Nice place for an evening stroll.. I visited the Bur Dubai Abra dock in the evening while the DSF celebrations were going on. The celebrations consist of small shopping stalls, food stalls and street performances. The stroll at the dock towards the Dhow cruises is quite relaxing, also during DSF their is firework show at 2000 hrs everyday, so be their to watch it.One can take the Abra (AED 1 per person) to visit the Diera area which comprises of famous Gold Souk.Overall it is suggested to visit this area in evening especially during Dubai Shopping Festival (DSF) time.
Great boat ride. The boat ride from Spice souk Deira dock to Bur Dubai abra dock was amazing a must to do all tourists.
Authentic experience. Crossing the creek by abra is both cheap and interesting,as you pass by the dhows heavily laden with goods ready for transport along the coast.
Don't miss a trip across the creek on an abra. cheap about 20p equivalent, quick efficient, great for taking photos and acting like the locals!

Dubai Creek and the abras docks: true oriental harbour atmosphere. Indeed Dubai Creek with Abras docks is the place to visit when the connection time between two flights exceeds 5-6 hours, or when staying overnight in Dubai.It takes 45mn to 1 hour to go through airport passport control and reach the Dubai Creek by taxi, 1-2 hours to walk along the harbour piers and abras docks, visit the nearby spice souq & gold souq, enjoy a snack, then again 45mn to 1 hour to get back to airport and go through passport control again.It gives a good taste of the middle-east, witness downtown Dubai life and souqs.While walking around the Deira (Al Ras) area, we discovered Heritage Houses, Al Almadiya Heritage School that can be visited (free of charge).If not in the hurry (1-2 more hours), it is worth crossing the creek using the Abras boats and walk in the "Bur Dubai" area : Al Fahidi fort & museum, Heritage and Diving village are worth the visit.And if really not in the hurry (2-3 more hours), reach the Jumeirah beach by taxi (10-15$), walk along and swim. The beach is close to the famous Burj-Al-Arab tower. Beach is safe and clean.

A taste of REAL Dubai. It's almost impossible to drive to the dockside and park, so take a taxi or walk. For a flavour of how Dubai would have looked before the glitzy sky-scrapers, you can't beat an abra taxi across the creek.
Abra Dock. Cheap n quick mode of transport to Deira area.Taxi drop off is at the dock and very close to meena bazaar if u looking for bargains.

An experience of the old town. The Abra is the traditional way of crossing the Dubai creek and provides very easy, and low cost mode of transport to both sides of the creek .With some routes operating 24 hours, the Abra is good as both a mode of transport and as a mean of simply enjoying a cruise along the creek. If you dont want to use a public abra, you can rent your own abra at a fairly good charge and enjoy your own private cruise across the creek.

Well worth a visit. Really impressed (and surprised) by the low costs; of the trips on the abras and waterbuses; and the prices at concession stands in the area (330ml cans of brand drinks - approx 30p)The whole area is steeped in tradition, we found it inspiring to walk along the commercial dhow area; seeing the goods being loaded for transport. Well run & organised (the same company run the bus & train system!)
Must be. The old way to cross the creek.If you have seen the museum the best way to go for the souk.
old ~Dubai. go to the souks, get an Abra over from the rulers palace to the spice souk go to gold souk and the fish, meat and fruit markets.

Old World Cool. Taking the short journey across the Dubai creek is a must do. It takes one back through the ages. The bustle of the small punts coming and going is fascinating and the experiences don't get much more authentic than this.

Great experience. Wonderful destination to check out the creek and people riding the abra to cross between Deira and Bur Dubai neighborhoods. For 1D, you can take a short ride to cross the creek yourself and get a great view of this part of the city.
interesting. cultural, cool and a huge variety of people, boats, and a great atmosphere - so different from the malls..!!
Abra. What an amazing place. This was a wonderful experience and I was amazed by the friendliness of the local people, who couldn;t do enough to help us.
Abra Ride. Nice experience but the Abra are full with locals.

cheap way to cross to the souqs. Just make your way to the dock, after some beaded leather shoe shopping. This is one of the public transport choices that you can take to cross to the spice souq and the gold souq. It gives you a feel of the buzzing activity and flurry of boats going up and down the creek.
Shock. Indeed an eye opener. For 1 AED you get on the Abra to cross the other side. it can only take 20 passenger at a time. Water's very clear & lots of seagulls

Must take an abra ride. We took a privat abra ride. You can get across for 20 aed or take a half hour ride for 50-60 aed. A wonderful perspective of Dubai from the waterways and you get to see old Dubai and the likes. A must do.

A good view of Old Dubai. The docks are lively and fun - have the cab drop you off next to the old Spice Souk and you can easily tour the docks, Spice and Gold Souk (both great to find souvenirs at reasonable prices). Be sure to take the water taxi across the river to get a better view (only 1 Dirham).

Public Transport across the Creek. For one dh per person you can take a water taxi to cross the Dubai Creek. This is public transport to ferry people all day long and its an efficient operation.Get on the boat early to get a good seat and although the ride can be bumpy sometimes its a fun way to experience a more traditional Dubai. It also gives you an opportunity to take photos of both new and old Dubai as you travel along.
an experience. get in with the locals and take the 1dhs abra across the water, its a little dirty and smelly but worth the expereince

Take a abra cruise. For all visiting Dubai, an Abra cruise is a really nice and least expensive way to see the Creek in Dubai. A 45 min. cruise cost around 120 Dhr for the whole family and you won´t regred it...Garanteed!
Cheap transport. 1 dirham to get to the other side of creek.they pack as many as they can on them but a enjoyable experience and a oppurtunity to take photo's from another angle
Interesting. This was far more interesting than you may think . if you are into the history of Dubai , its all here around the creek area
A good experience of Original Dubai. Its always worth taking an abra ride across teh creek to get a feel & glimpse of the bustling creek and day to day life of Dubai. Recommended during sunset.

Good old Dubai feel. After visiting Dubai Mall, fountains, Abu Dhai, we went to museum and after that we took the 1 AED abra trip across to Deira. The abra is simple, functional and fun. December weather was cool enough for us to enjoy the trip.the approach to abra Via the alleys with shops was interesting.
ok. yes its just ok coz there shuld b improvement in cleanliness here..
Cheap and excellent fun. 1 AED = 20p to cross the creek on a little boat, brilliant photos, keep your eye out for the QE2 docked close by

A glimpse of old Dubai. This place was a little difficult to find. We were dropped off at the Dubai Museum by the cab driver who gestured vaguely in the direction of the dock. It's not the most obvious place but isn't impossible to find. Remember that this is not set up for tourists only and the water taxis or Abras are public transport for anyone wanting to get from one bank to the other. I would recommend doing the 45-60min creek cruise on an Abra for 100AED. The boatman will obligingly shoo all other passengers off the Abra just for you. An awesome way to get views and photos of traditional trading vessels, wharf trading activity and old Dubai.

Great and cheap. The little abras are a great way to go over the creek only 1 drm so really cheap. If you like travelling like a local then thats the way to go, they look a bit dodgy but feel really safe. They zig Zag accross the creek so you can get on and off easly.We also used one of the water busses and if you buy the day travel card on the metro you can use it on this too. Great fun at sunset and we had the pleasure of this and the haunting call to prayer. Magical

Old and new. It is a nice experience to ride the Abra, as you can have views of both new and old Dubai, it very cheap to ride and any taxi can get you to the Abra, from there you can enjoy the old Souq

The best 1dhs tourist experience. When I first came to Dubai, the Abra was the main means of crossing the creek between Deira and Bur Dubai. With all the new bridges this has changed, but the abras are still there. It is a nice way to get around, and a good way to experience "old" Dubai.

The best bargain in Dubai. For only 1 dirham, this trip on an "abra" offers visitors the opportunity to travel from one side of the creek to the other and have splendid views of many of Dubai's sights. It's fun to talk with the locals (and tourists). This very reasonable and relaxing mode of travel enables visitors to experience a unique the true Dubai of years gone by.
Abra Dock Bur Dubai. Always fun for visitors. Best way to reach the Diera gold souk as well and avoid traffic. (the metro is also pretty easy, just more walking from Union station up)

Excellent. I went to Dubai and did not go to any malls (except to see the fountain and the Burj). So what do I know!But I loved the Abras. They are cheap (1 AED per ride) and run very frequently and between the two old parts of the town. An excellent, excellent way to see the city, although their routes are not very long. They have different boats running on different routes with different names. Try and explore and ask around. WE went from Bur DUbai all the way to the Al Saeef, just to explore the water trasnport. And I loved it.

Cheap and quick way to get across the dubai creek. It is one of the oldest way of transportation and probably the oldest public transport in Dubai, but the Abra is slowly losing its patronage as more and more people are now choosing the metro over it. For the time conscious traveler who is also looking to experience some old world charm, a trip from bur dubai to deira and back using the ferry service may seem like a good option plus it is really cheap at 1 dirham pp.The deira side of the creek is lined with old world markets and traditional souqs, the bur dubai side is more upbeat with newer and more organised buildings, marlets, restaurants, etc. Both sides have plenty to offer in terms of shopping and sight seeing. Do try the spice souq, just across the road on the deira side.PS: the boats can tip easily so be careful while getting in and out. Accidents although not common have been recorded :)Have Fun..

perfect way to get around the traffic jams. Easy, clean and fast travel. Very cheap. I would book the Gold Class as it has less people in it during off-peak and its maybe 1 EUR more. The stations are amazing. Architecture was an important element when planning this.
Like going back in time!. We enjoyed a trip down the river on an abra - steered by the driver's feet, and with some near misses into other vehicles but it just added to the experience!

old Dubai at its best. using an abra to get from one side of the creek to the other is so much fun. This is the old fashioned mehtod of transport, and is still used today by locals and tourists alike to cross the creek and prevent expensive taxi rides across the motorway bridges. it is only 20p (1 dirham) each, you wait at the abra station and get on to the next abra that is due to leave (along with everyone else). the man on the boat will take your money, and you simply jump off at the other side. on this years trip to Dubai we didn't want to visit Diera (the other side), but took the abra just for the ride, got off and got straight back on the other next abra coming back across - the views of the creek are great from the abra and definately worth the trip.
Ride an Arabian Water Taxi. Good boat ride across the Dubai Creek, snuggled together with the natives and other tourists. And only one dirham (20 euro cent).

must try these if you are visiting dubai. love the abras, love the ones that run from deira to dubai, and all the hustle and bustle of people going on their business. and from the bur dubai docks you can go to the bur dubai covered bazaar and meena bazaar and the bastakiya district. all lovely and must see places
Cheapest fun ever. I took the abras back and forth every day just for the experience - even after I did everything I needed to do on the other side of the creek.

One of the BEST experiences in Dubai for 1 Dirham!. You simply cannot beat crossing Dubai Creek day or night on an Abra. No railings, no safety nets... not dangerous either. It just makes me really feel like life is a lot more fun when you don't have to be seat belted and life preserved. Definitely a highlight of Dubai!

Cheapest tour of the Creek. For the price of a postage stamp you can cross Dubai Creek and see the dhows loading their cargo in the old fashioned way. When you get to the other side you can walk straight into the Spice Souk and the Gold Souk.

quick and easy way to cross the creek. Getting the local water taxis across the river is the quickest and cheapest way to cross the creek. The journey costed us 1dirham each way (about 17p) every time. Just make sure you know the name of the dock on the opposite side that you want to get to, and there are always people around that can point you in the right direction. The taxis are constantly coming and going, so we never waited longer than 2 minutes for an abra. It took around 10 minutes to cross the creek.
A cruise for 1 dirham. A must-do for any visitor. Ride from the spice souk to Deira souks for AED 1. Stinky diesel engines, crowded, chaotic and a lot of fun. How do these things stay afloat?

It is a must. A visit to Dubai is not complete without at least one abra crossing. It is only 1 Dirham and takes about 10 minutes to cross from Bur Dubai over to Deira side where you can then easily see the old wharfage areas and visit the gold and spice souks.
Slice of life. Taking an abra across the creek is a wonderful way to see the creek and be part of the life there.
Its where the action is..... Boats cutting across the Creek, people walking, Souks nearby.... ist one of the main hubs of Dubai. Go there as the sun sets.. beautiful.
Worth a try. Just a Dirham of Abra Ride.. enough for you to experience and see Dubai's old wonder.The old town scenery is worth a look and shoudn't be miss seeing when you are in the city.

Old Dubai. In a place that scarcely existed 40 years ago, this is history! For just AED 1 (GBP 20p) you get to ride across the Creek ( I guess you'll go first in the dircetion from the Gold Souk to Bur Dubai and the Textile Souk mostly, as a tourist) and you get close-up views of the wooden dhows that still ply the Arabian Gulf and the Indian Ocean with great photo-opportuniuties to snap these old wooden vessels with 'Manhattan' as the backdrop. The Textile Souk is well worth sauntering through - it's (first) half tourist show and half (second, more distant) a working souk, little changed over a long period of time, much more than the 40 years since Dubai got developed rapidly. The restaurant hanging over the water a few yards up the Creek from the abra station is fantastic food at great value but crowded in the season and the nearby Fort, now a museum, is a must. You can hire an abra for AED10 an hour and take a personalised trip around the Creek - great value for money.

Informative. If you get to go by yourself - best find someone who will explain to you the history of these docks. If you cant find anyone, well taking pictures of the riverside and old boats while taking a walk is your best activity. Don't stray too late. Best time would be between sunset and 9PM.
Excellent view!!!. Full of bad smells, but the historical dubai lies there.

The orient at its home. We've used to cross Dubai Creek with abras - wich are the local water taxis (and a travel cost 1 AED only!). On the dock we 've observed a lot of people, some Arab shops. Very close are the Spice Souk and the Gold Souk, with their irresistible temptations.
Also you can arrive at the Dubai museum.
A must for all visitors!. At 1 Dirham per ride........this has got to be the cheapest, best and most authentic travel service in the world!!!!!

a piece of old Dubai. It's worth taking an abra across the creek - it's cheap as well as being a great way to see the city plus walking along the docks on the Deira side is fascinating. It's a nice break from the mall/beach/mall routine.

Abra Dock. Hi All,
The Abra ride is unbelievably cheap its just 1AED per trip, i was admiring for that. and if u go at evening / night time the experience is totally different. u can see the lighting effects and reflection in water.
Short boat ride in traditional way. Just pay 1 dirham for a short ride on Abra – traditional boat to cross the river and go around the creek.
Cheap option to cross the creek !. Only one Dhm to cross the water to the other side. Abra dock is clean and safe. frequent and enjoyable mode of transport.

Took a short ride. We took a short ride on an abra just to say we did it. You can purchase an hour-long guided tour up the Creek and the drivers will point out the sites. Nothing to write home about, but it can be cheap transportation if you want to cross the creek to get between the Gold Souk and the Textile Souk.
Give the Abra a go. Well organised and they are so busy... get on one its cheap and it gets you around the creek so you can see the sights

useful and pleasant ride across the river. Worth the 1d. Use it to travel between the gold souk and the textiles souk/Bur Dubai. Also, there's a restaurant on the textiles souk side, just to your left as you disembark, which does a terrific lime juice.

Definitely worth a trip for 1Dhs!. At a cost of just 1Dhs, this is definitely a crossing which is worth doing - a traditional water taxi takes you across the creek from one souk to the other. Gives you a lovely view across the water and you can also see some of the textiles cargo boats tied up. Be sure to have a 1Dhs coin ready to make it easier.

Warm feeling by crossing the creek at night. Dubai creek is dividing the city of Dubai in to two parts : Daira and Bur Dubai and years ago using the small boats was the only way to go between the two parts, it's not a long trip, its takes only 10 minutes to cross it , some Asian workers still used it as its very cheap way to get in to the other part of Dubai( 1 Dirham - less than $1 ) per person if you are going with the other passengers crossing the creek , however if you are looking for a private and longer trip ( which I recommend ) you should take a private boat takes you in trip for ( 1hour or half an hour around the creek), you have to pay ( 100 Dhs - $ 27) for the one hour and ( 60 Dhs-$16) for 1/2 hour , and this amount of money is per boat not per passenger Crossing the creak at night by using (al Abra = small boat ), it's a wonderful experience The small boats, the smell of the creek, and the soft lights around you give you an amazing feeling. The best way to get there is by visiting the heritage village anther magical place where the small cafés all around the (khor = creek), best time after the sunset and preferably in winter or spring
